description:
It's been ages since I've been to this restaurant. Heard they changed owners so I decided to give it a try. I ordered their Omakase $40. The menu says to order 15 minutes in advance and boy was I blown away by it! First of all the price is incredibly reasonable and the presentation is BEAUTIFUL! The  Omakase came with:
- uni w/ quail egg on top of a fried shiso topped w/ Ikura 
- amaebi
- walu
- Ikura 
- hamachi
- king salmon
 - hamachi toro
- kurodai (Japanese black bass)
- ankimo 
- Maguro and salmon sashimi

They also now have dollar oysters all night! They're super fresh and not cheap frozen oysters like other places that sell dollar oysters and there's a different  happy hour each weekday! Definitely going to be coming back again!
author: Ting Fei L.

description: Ordered the spider roll ($10). Only 5 pieces, poorly rolled and completely fell apart. The crab didn't taste quite right so I ended up throwing it away. Definitely a disappointment and a waste of money. I will not be returning here and I would not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Maura K.

description:
I love this spot for two reasons: the whiskey and the ebi!

It's so hard to find casual bars to sip great whiskey in San Francisco. Blue Fin has a collection of fine Japanese whiskeys and a full bar on the other side of the restaurant. It's my neighborhood go to bar. 

The ebi was nothing short of delicious, topped with black caviar and fresh to the gods. I'm not normally a huge fan of ebi but I dream of this in my sleep. 

PRO-TIP: ask for the fresh wasabi!!!
author: Alexis Y.

description: This restaurants has super aggressively reserved 2 public parking spots off the curb in front of it, two if anyone who parks there after 6pm. The parking spots are much needed and taking them away makes parking (including for patrons at the restaurant) much harder.
author: Rascal M.

description: Excellent service and nice menu choices. Thought that the food was good and prices were decent. Would definitely come back again.
author: M L.

description:
Came here with a groupon, but I would still say it's a little over priced. You're also not allowed to choose from the happy hour menu when using a groupon. 

What we ordered: 
* Walu sashimi - pretty good (4 pieces for $9)
* Spicy crunch maki - loved this!!! Must get here! I'm not a huge sashimi fan, but the sauce and deep fried texture really mixed well with the hamachi, sake, tai, shrimp, and onion. Also, the presentation of the dish was great. ($11.95)
* Volcano roll - normally called Lion King at other places. It's the baked California roll with salmon on top drizzled with house mayo sauce. Good and decently sized. ($11.95)
* Gold Mine roll - California roll with raw salmon, mayo, and roe on top. Pretty basic and not worth $13.50 

Service was good, and the portions were fair. I also love how this restaurant is connected to a bar! I'd probably be back to try the happy hour dishes and check out the bar.
author: Miranda T.

description: It was my first time at this old timer sushi place. It is an exquisite dinner and prices was not too bad yesterday. $1 oysterssssss. Oh sooo good!! There is a bar/ lounge to watch sports and have fun with some friends and family. The other thing is hard to find parking but if you don't mind parking a block or 2 away and walk a little bit.. it is a good exercise. But it is a place to try if you like sushi and have some drinks with friends and family or can be a date night on Fridays!! Very good environment. Waiters and service is friendly. Highly recommend to try!
author: Harriet C.

description: Staff are very attentive, food came out quick. Great tasting fish. One thing that stood out in particular, the Hamachi Kama was colossal, bigger than i've had it, anywhere. I've been there a bunch of times, and I will return.
author: Johnny N.

description: Just ordered fromBlue Fin through Uber. $150 order. Half of the order is spilled its the fault of Uber but there is more. inside the Oysters LIVE WORM not just one but 4 and one of them is HUGE. When I called to inform the rep and just started to explain what is going on, I told the person on the phone that I got the order half spilled, he didn't even let me finished yelled that I have to call Uber and hung up the phone!!! I called beck and they didn't answer. I was keep calling until somebody actually answered it, I told them that there are worms in the oysters... What I've heard was shocking. The rep told me that he is not opening the oysters so if I want a refund I can call uber! That is all, no sorry no nothing. I'm calling health department first thing Monday thats for sure. RUN PEOPLE, RUN FAST IF YOU DON'T WANT SOMETHING GROWING INSIDE OF YOU...
author: Alex R.

description: Blu Fin is the greatest! Whenever I make an order for delivery they show up pronto. The customer service is so accommodating and polite. Their fish is fresh and the price is reasonable.
author: Nea H.

description: I heard they have changed owners so decided to give it try with my friend. There was no wait on a Wednesday night at around 8:30pm. We ordered a Omakase which had to wait 15 mins for the chefs to make it. The Omakase looked beautiful. It has 6 pieces of nigiri and 6 pieces of sashimi, serving with 2 pieces of Ankimo and fresh wasabi. The uni on the plate was something we ordered separately but the chefs put it with the plate. For me, the Uni and the fresh wasabi were the best from the plate. Everything else on the Omakase plate looked pretty but missing that touch of freshness and sweetness. We also ordered Amaebi nigiri which were quite small, good thing about it was that they gave us options for the shrimp head, either fried or with soup. Some other nigiris that we ordered were Hotate and Unagi, same thing with the plate, pretty and reasonable size but missing the freshness and sweetness. Overall I won't give it a 5 star because a Japanese restaurant should always provide FRESH fish but other than that, it is all good.
author: Eugenia K.

description:
Tasty sushi dishes, esthetically presented, good portion sizes. We chose:
-purple heat roll (eggplant)
-gold mine roll (salmon)
-caterpillar roll (eel, avocado)

When we were seated we were promptly served with tea, pickled veggies, and ginger. Our rolls were served slightly spaced apart. The tea was regularly refilled. 

Decor is pleasing with counter made of  copper colored material which blended well with painted walls. TV set to sports and volume thankfully kept low.

The other side of this restaurant is a bar. The restaurant side is nicer in appearance. Nice neighborhood place for Japanese cuisine.
author: Liana T.

description:
Everything I ordered was SOOOO good! I am definitely going back! Parking is easy and the service was great! The guy, I presume the owner, was nice and helpful.

I got the salmon sashimi, two rolls, and the carpaccio. EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING!!
author: Darlene T.

description: Oh...my...god. My friend and I went here last Wednesday on a whim driving by. I have never in my entire life smelled the smell I smelled inside this restaurant. Like physically ill status. It smelled like fish had been rotting and not been refrigerated in days. We were so nervous ordering rolls so stuck to a veggie roll and immediately went to a different  sushi spot. The ladies were nice though.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Very rude regular delivery man and poor response from restaurant - would not order from here if you want a pleasant experience! 

We have been regular customers ordering at least once every two weeks for years. That will end after no longer being able to tolerate the rude, grumpy delivery man. He grabs the tip out of your hand as he grunts and walks away. We cut back his tip this last time and he grabbed the cash and shook his head. He does not realize that his attitude gets reflected in his tip.

Furthermore when we called the restaurant the man who answered the phone acknowledged the delivery man's unpleasant demeanor. But then did not discourage us from seeking a new restaurant. I guess they do not want regular customers. They think it is fine to ruin your evening with bad service!

Do not waste your time when there are so many options in SF!
author: Susan M.

description:
Overall Impression: Excellent quality sushi on Clement Street.

Cost: I'm not quite sure why other reviewers are complaining about the price of a $$ restaurant. The quality of the ingredients absolutely warrant the price.

Taste: We tried a few house special rolls, along with the Chirashi, and everything we ordered was very delicious. All of the fishes we had were very fresh (unagi, salmon, tuna, yellowtail). Of the house special rolls, I would recommend the salmon roll (baked salmon) at a decent price point.

Customer Service: Attentive waiter/host who check up on us on multiple occasions and had a very positive attitude. He might've been the owner, I'm not quite sure, but I noticed that he treated his coworkers/staff very well.

Ambience/Atmosphere: Sushi is served in both the restaurant and the bar/lounge. We sat in the restaurant, and had no complaints. We will try the lounge next time.
author: Kevin T.

description: Decent quality sushi at a neighborhood restaurant. Chill environment with a lot of decor. Service is really friendly.
author: Alaric O.

description: This used to be my go-to. Fish no longer tastes fresh, and the nigiri is super sloppy and cut very thick. Prices have gone up, and quality has gone way down. They also did away with the hawaiian roll. Bummed!
author: Emmy C.

description: My favorite local sushi joint. Good service, usually no wait for a table.
author: Lizzie G.

description:
BRUH. Bomb sushi and a bar attached. Go for the off menu food and get yourself off the grid.
Heavenly kimchi fried rice. Lots of Japanese whisky! The best sushi in the city. And the best staff ever - so caring and amazing! Year of the dog saki is a must, splurge! Best customer service ever!
author: Aleksandar I.

description:
Updated: went back and the service and food were back to a good solid enjoyable experience. 

UNDER NEW MANAGEMENT. There was a sign on the door that stated "NO GROUPONS, Under New Management." The new waitress did not know the names of any of the sushi including rainbow roll, walu, and red snapper.... Even when I pointed. That's not a big deal to me because restaurants are about food... But the food was lackluster and tasted unfresh.... Even the wasabi and soysauce seemed like they were diluted or off... I had to put three times the wasabi in my soysauce for any spiciness at all. The sushi all tasted the same and sort of flavorless. Definitely felt like the new management is very concerned with cutting costs. We were seated right away and served the food quickly so not going below a 3 star for now... But not a place to indulge, for sure, and on Clement... sushi options abound, so hopefully they improve the quality soon.
author: Lara C.

description:
Very friendly staff, great menu 
It's becoming my Partner and my date spot. The unfiltered sake, a spider roll and an unagi lovers roll with seaweed salad is the perfect meal for us to share but we always add a wild card and it's all been very good
author: Lesa J.

description:
I really wished I liked it more. It's SO CLOSE to where I live. For two rolls (Rock n Roll & Romeo and Juliet Roll), and a salmon nigiri (2 pcs) I spend about $25 (take-out), which is okay because fish is expensive. But... but something was DEFINITELY missing. The Rock n Roll was okay and dry (better with soy sauce), but the romeo and juliet was very bland. I enjoyed the fish but it wasn't fresh enough for a sweet taste on their own. It was probably over a day or two old, repeatedly refrigerated. I mean that's okay but I remember wishing for Ponzu sauce instead of soy sauce because it just tasted really wrong with soy sauce, and bland without it. It was a VERY conflicting moment for me.

I might go back to try something else just because the cashier was VERY friendly, probably because I was the ONLY customer during that time. Also because it IS SUPER close to my house haha
author: Kimberly W.

description:
The fish is good here! I like the ambiance although it was a bit dark. The place is spacious and very classy and clean. 

It was a little pricier than my preference but I had a Groupon! We ordered the Sea Bass which came with rice, veggies and miso soup, the Sun Kiss, Sun Rise, and lastly the Romeo and Juliet Roll. Everything tastes delicious but I think the Sun Kiss was okay because it was mainly crab and mayo wrapped with salmon (salmon was very tasty though).  Not worth my money in my opinion. Sea bass was delicious but was around $20. All in all, I think I would come here again if I had another Groupon. Otherwise, it's just too pricey for my liking unless it was a special occasion.
author: Christina C.

description: I'm currently enjoying another excellent meal from Blue Fin! I eat here so much, and always have a great experience, so I figured I should leave a review. Delivery, takeout, dine in, are all great here. I've tried all the nearby sushi places, and whenever I want to treat myself to sushi, this is my go to place!
author: Delia B.

description: We picked Blue Fin because it was close to the Airbnb apartment we rented.  Boy oh boy we're we pleasantly surprised. Best sushi I have had.  The 49'er roll with the lemon was the new standard rolls will be measured on - great combination of flavors. Even the dipping sauce for the  gyoza was good.  Fast delivery also.
author: Theresa M.

description: Feel bad giving this place a bad rating because the waiter was so nice and attentive and the sushi was okay but it was just not a very clean looking place and check out the health rating on yelp, they had a high risk vermin infestation. That's so disgusting. I don't understand why people in San Francisco are totally cool with all these restaurants having vermin - shut these places down! Other cities force them to close but not SF.
author: Emma M.

description: Been a couple times, had the Nabeyaki udon each time. It was delicious! Lots of toppings in it and packed with flavor, the noodles are very good too.
author: Wenqian G.

description: I been here one time and it was really good, I had a couple of sushi rolls and they were really good! The prices are reasonable and relatively the same as kitaro on Geary Blvd that is three blocks away. I think this place has a better quality of food compared to the other Japanese restaurants in the Richmond district. The service is great and staff members are friendly.
author: Alix J.

description: Friendly staff, nice food. I recommend this place to anyone who is looking for some casual place to eat sushi
author: Fedor S.

description:
ABSOLUTELY 5 STARS SERVICE AND FOOD!! SO GOOD, THANK YOU!!!

We hosted a party with almost 50 people last weekend and Blue Fin Sushi did an amazing job, the perfect venue! We couldn't be happier and definitely will be back for more good times.

I highly recommend any groups planning a large party. Kiko, the manager was easy to work with and they made everything go smoothly.

Thank you!!!
author: Jacky J.

description: Everthing was fresh.  My friend liked the flavorful broth of the udon, not too salty.  We sat down and immediately, we were brought green tea and a small plate of pickled cucumber and ginger.  I had the rainbow roll and it was fresh.  Had the ahi tuna with ginger vinaigrette  on the side, lots of greens and good portion of ahi tuna shared for two.  To round off our dinner, we had fried bananas.  It was okay, almost like tempura bananas.  All this for $40.80.  Service was very attentive.  Dark ambiance.   Clean restrooms.  Parking is a bit challenging.  TV screens every which angle.  You can't miss the SF Giants playing.
author: Helen L.

description: Had a Groupon, so scored a deal on some legit chirashi. Huge pieces/pretty much a perfect amount of food for one meal. Also complimentary tea and pickled veg. This place is super out of the way, but if not, would be a perfectly satisfactory choice if you had a hankering for fish!
author: Shendi X.

description:
Service is good. 

We got a sushi boat. Neither the sashimi nor the oysters are fresh. Look at the photo. The oyster broke down after i picked it up with chopsticks. The chef told me it's because the oysters are fat. Then I got sick the next day.
author: Ye Y.

description: This place is a joke. They have a Groupon available online but when you walk in there is a sign that says no  Groupons are being accepted. I double checked to make sure there was no times that were blacked out (there aren't), the new management just decided to not accept them anymore, but hasnt taken them off Groupon. When we asked the hostess why it was still available for purchase if they weren't accepting it, she had no answer... Not her fault I'm sure but still, a ridiculous waste of time.
author: Desmond A.

description:
The decor is really nice, and the atmosphere is loud.  The music over the speakers is of the Top-40 variety.  My roommate and I had dinner there early, so it seemed louder, and it probably was also playing in their bar area.

I ordered the dragon roll, and it was good.  The unagi was delicious.. It was as if it was grilled a little.  I also ordered inari, but they forgot it, so I had to order it again.  But other than that, it was a good dining experience.

They also have happy hour every day, which is worth checking out.
author: Vira P.

description:
We ended up stopping by bluefin for dinner after driving by their happy hour sign. It was 25% off all sushi rolls between 5-7pm.  We ordered a cherry blossom roll, a dragon roll, takoyaki, half dozen oysters, and one of their specialty cocktails. The rolls were good and my boyfriend really enjoyed the oysters.  I personally hate oysters but he got me to try one anyways and it wasn't bad compared to others I've had. Still not a fan but my opinion doesn't count because I already have a thing against oysters lol. The litchi salt frozen cocktail was really good but got really strong towards the end. I can't wait to come back again and try their strawberry sake mojito!

The service was great and our waiter was very attentive.
author: Linz C.

description:
A solid 3.5* on food but 4* on service.  Came here with a groupon, and was treated well. The ahi tuna salad and Hamachi kama was pretty good and fresh.
Husband is not much of a roll person, but the roll was tasty, but a bit on small side.
The Asian female waitress was so kind and they refilled water without asking.
Would come back again as its my neighborhood place. :)
author: Nan W.

description: Never coming back here again. Would not honor Groupon because they were "Under New Management" with a sign at the host area. I told them that my Groupon was still valid which it is and that what they're doing is wrong and that they're trying to take my money. The host whom I'm suspecting is the new manager and possible new owner had the nerve to tell me they've been under new management for 3 months which right around when I bought my Groupon and went on to telling me to work it out with Groupon and that I've never been there which is complete BULLSHIT. I've been to Blue Fin several times for 10 years going back to when they even served pizza with California rolls as a topping! Screw this place and screw the new owners/managers who don't give a damn about repeat customers. I will no longer to a place that will not honor their own deals and are looking scam people. You're much better off hitting up Kabuto and Aiake over on Geary. I'm also going to report this place to the city of San Francisco. I have no respect for this place after they have no respect for their customers. This place deserves to get shut down and I hope they do.
author: John Paul C.

description: I order delivery for the first time here, i requested to deliver before 6:30pm and the deliver guy arrived earlier than i expected. The food taste really good and the price are acceptable for me.
author: Zilong Y.

description: Sashimi is good there and prices are usual - great squid dish that my mother loves.  Staffing is very good, but, they can use a little more help as this place gets busy... Parking not so great - location is good!  I would go back but not during busy times....
author: Betty L.

description:
Went there after purchasing groupon deal. The place was half empty but we had to stand and wait for about 7 min because there was no one front. Then a lady approached and said to wait because tables for 2 were not cleaned. No one was in a hurry to clean them up. It did not occur to the young lady to offer us a bigger table. So we waited until a  man cleaned the tables.
Not a big deal but slightly unpleasant for the first time visit.
Looking at the menu I noticed that sushi rolls were in average $12-$16 which is not the cheapest place. But that is ok. Disappointment was after we ordered a few rolls in a price range $12-$15 and found out they all come only with 6 pieces. Seriously? In all sushi places I have been those type of rolls always have 8 thick, large pieces. While here I found 6 small size pieces. 
Needles to say raiders roll was very weird, do not try it. Some weird crunchy staff inside and all smells like herring. The volcano roll was ok but again for that price I would expect 8 pieces roll.
There are so many good sushi places in this neighborhood, so I would not bother to go to Blue fin. I am glad it was only a group deal.
At last, the service was slow, though the place was nearly empty..
author: Lacrimosa L.

description:
I think 3.5 star is pretty accurate.

I had a sushi combo that came with 10 pieces of sushi. It was just okay. Nothing special.

Tempura was not like what you have at real Japanese place. 

Servers were all nice and polite.

Maybe I will go back, maybe not.
author: C M.

description:
In an area flush with Japanese restaurants, Blue Fin easily sets itself apart from its competition.  After all, there aren't many restaurants in the Outer Richmond that can feature a restaurant and bar/lounge joined at the hip.  Man, if only the food could have be more exciting!

Offering a mix/fusion of Asian dishes, Blue Fin's menu is almost as unique as the restaurant itself.  Sushi, appetizers, noodles, salads, entrees, cocktails and more certainly wins them points for variety.

- B52 ROLL - Spicy Hamachi, Shiso Leaf, Cucumber, and Tobiko...$8.50
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-fin-sushi-san-francisco?select=tt1JWNwETdIA55C_MsJlrA#ubBHo_SxCD_G3-1BWsgElQ)
Pretty "meh".  I liked the shiso leaf, but the heat from the fish was diffused by the cucumber.  Not awful, but it didn't do much for me either.  I don't think I'd get it again.

- ROMEO & JULIET ROLL - Salmon and Avocado wrapped with Soybean Paper, topped with Scallop, Tobiko, and Spicy Mayo...$10.95
(see above)
The three of us agreed this was the best roll of the night.  The roll wasn't heavy on rice or mayo, and the salmon and scallops seemed decently fresh.  Certainly worth trying.

- CATERPILLAR ROLL - Eel and Cucumber topped with Avocado, ...$9.50
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-fin-sushi-san-francisco?select=tt1JWNwETdIA55C_MsJlrA#DbCHaAeKxxfQhtXj8Oh8og)
The taste was pretty standard, but it's not a bad choice.  Although it's comparable to any other decent sushi joint, both the portion and price were quite friendly.

- TAKOYAKI...$6.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-fin-sushi-san-francisco?select=tt1JWNwETdIA55C_MsJlrA#vt-DSQnE9Mfl1A2wsVossA)
I love takoyaki, but this one underwhelmed like almost everything else we tried.  Even though the pieces were sizable, they were light on octopus given their size.  The bonito flakes were nice though. 

- KIMCHI FRIED RICE...$10.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/blue-fin-sushi-san-francisco?select=tt1JWNwETdIA55C_MsJlrA#nIROaT9KrIinNZyxvEY9HQ)
I didn't expect much and that's what I got.  It was apparent just from the looks of it that there wasn't much kimchi flavor.  Given how it tasted like a generic fried rice dish, I think we might have been better off with the unagi fried rice we were eyeing.

To be honest, it kind of bums me out to be giving Blue Fin only three stars.  Especially since I thought they were pretty good the first time I tried them a while back.  I'll be back at some point to give them another shot, just in case we just happened to catch them on a bad night.
author: Mike L.

description: Purchased a Groupon for this place and it was really good! Servers worked really hard and were attentive to us the whole time. Rolls came out relatively quickly and tasted good. I would go back for more :)
author: Karen L.

description:
Went for a birthday dinner on a Saturday night. Warning: plan ahead as parking is nearly impossible in this neighborhood. 

The restaurant is quite large and can accommodate large parties easily. We ordered a variety of rolls to share but everyone ordered their own entrees. My husband and I shared a chirashi and salmon onigiri. The chirashi was fresh with one slice of each fish and several slice of tomago. The onigiri was preeminently rice and wasn't seasoned at all.  There was maybe one bite of salmon in it- not recommended.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Pretty good! Came here on Valentine's day with a reservation.  We got there early, but they were able to seat us right away even though the place was packed.  They've turned one half of this place into a bar/lounge area, and the second half into the restaurant.  The prices for this place were a bit steep, in my opinion, especially the sushi rolls.  I would suggest getting the sashimi and nigiri!  

We had the half dozen oysters with uni and quail egg, which I highly recommend!! It was pretty much an oyster shooter :)  The uni had a great texture, and all three went well with each other.  We also had the blue shrimp nigiri and amaebi nigiri, both excellent and melt in your mouth good!  The sunrise was really good too!  It was sushi rice wrapped in raw salmon, topped with tobiko and a quail egg.  A few of my favorite things. :D  

The live scallops that they had on their specials menu and the Ice-land roll, I could have done without.  The walu that topped their iceland roll had a water-y, just thawed taste.  

Service was pretty good! All the waiters and waitresses were attentive, although they didn't seem to have a system, because 3 of them asked us if we wanted drinks, one right after the other. haha All the food came out super fast too!  Right after we placed our order, we saw the sushi chef making it.  And at the end of the meal, they gave me a rose in honor of Valentine's day.
author: Kay A.

description: To be frank this sushi is just probably only a little bit better than something from a grocery store or gas station. You barely get any fish, the California rolls just taste like mayo and rice. Have a look yourself. Ill post a pic of a California roll and the 49er roll. 49 roll has a paper thin piece of salmon.
author: Joseph K.

description: I haven't been back for a while.   Tonight, i came in with my coworkers for birthday dinner.  The service was unattentive.    Portion shrank a lot - special rolls shrank about 1/3 of the size which came in 6 miserable pieces.  I think it is not worth coming here anymore.   How disappointed!!!    This place is just going downhill...
author: D F.

description:
Seems like I had a marginally better experience than some reviewers here.

I stopped by recently and tried some live uni, live scallop, the tempura that came along with it, red snapper sashimi, other more conventional sushi items like tuna and salmon, as well as a volcano roll. The sushi/sashimi was quite generously portioned for the price, and the quality, freshness, and taste were quite decent. The volcano roll, although on the smaller side, was quite rich and filling. Service was courteous and unobtrusive, and the place is fairly clean with a showcase aquarium highlighting a snazzy entryway.

There's a quieter sushi bar and restaurant on one half, and a livelier lounge on the other. Overall, a good neighborhood choice for a value-conscious sushi fix.
author: Vincent L.

description: I come here often because of Groupon coupons, it is easy to get to, the food is good, the service is friendly, attentive, and there is usually room at the sushi bar. This week I had Hamachi and Sake Sashimi, Spicy Scallop hand roll, and Spicy Crunch Maki. Everything was delicious. The fish was fresh, the servings generous, the sushi chefs and waiters friendly. It is a comfortable place to go if you want to eat good food and be able to get in and out without waiting a long time to be served. I will be back.
author: Adia L.

description:
I dined here the other night with my mom and we really enjoyed our dinner! If you're in the outer Richmond, I recommend dining here. 

The service here was absolutely great. All of the waitresses that work there are very sweet and friendly. I loved how the sushi chefs were taking sake shots with customers! Just a fun vibe all around. 

I had their salmon teriyaki (see pictures) and loved every bite. I asked for it to be well done and it was cooked perfectly. The teriyaki sauce wasn't too sweet - just the way I like it. I love how they also served steamed broccoli and carrots on the side. My mom had their seafood ceviche (I don't eat anything raw so I didn't try it) and said it was delicious and very fresh. 

Reservations were easy - open table! We didn't even have to wait a second. Parking wasn't that big of a deal, but I also don't mind walking a few blocks. Apparently they have a great happy hour so I'll definitely be back for that!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
Two weeks ago, I passed by this place and saw a huge banner advertising their sushi boat for $50. Who can pass that up?! So today, my bff and I finally had our sushi dinner here. Upon entering, silly me didn't realize there were two doors, one for the lounge and bar area and another for the restaurant part. Whoops. But the bartender was friendly and smiled while I pointed to the other side apologetically. We got seated next to the fish tank (nice view...but poor fishies had to watch us eat their friend...).

Upon sitting down, we got served iced water and some pickled cabbage. We ordered the $50 sushi boat, which we came here to try, half a dozen oysters with uni and quail egg, stuffy mushrooms, and lady finger roll. We got the oysters first and the mushrooms and roll came shortly after. Then our final surprise...the sushi boat...IT'S HUGE!

5/5 Oysters - I never tried uni before and surprisingly, it matches with the oyster so well. I loved it! Very fresh and sweet.
4/5 Stuffy mushroom - It's stuffed with spicy kani. A teeny bit too spicy but yummy nevertheless.
4/5 Lady Finger roll - I don't remember what's in it, but it's wrapped with soy paper. Crunchy, warm, and delicious.
6/5 Sushi boat - Yea...it's so good, I have to go over the 5. The reason why we ordered the roll was because we didn't expect the boat to be so big. But when the waitress put it down, it actually is the length of the table! It contains four more regular oysters, a shrimp head, assorted sashimi, assorted nigiri, and california rolls. Sashimi was so fresh and sweet. My first piece was the hamachi sashimi and I almost had goosebumps when I put it in my mouth, almost.

By the end of our dinner, I was working overtime to finish the last of the food. It was super worth it. Super friendly servers that kept our tea and water filled at all times. Always smiling. So I had to tip them well! Definitely coming back for more!
author: Sandy F.

description:
Okay-was there last week. Had all the specials--and my absolute favorite--Live Uni (sea urchin roe)!

This was 5 stars all the way! Still not my favorite in San Francisco, but definitely 5 star! Pictures coming soon!
author: Michael R.

description:
Ordered from Blue Fin Sushi using Eat24 and it was delivered in ~20 mins!  Fast sushi delivery makes me SO HAPPY.  Their speed might be because I ordered during a slow time - 9PM.  I love that this place is still open so late at night for when I get after work cravings!

I ordered the 49er roll, Super California, and seaweed salad.  All were super yums!!  The 49er is comparable to the Citrus Salmon roll at Daigo (my favorite sushi roll ever), but a few bucks cheaper.  Pricing here is average for SF.

I've found my new favorite go-to for sushi delivery, and will definitely stop by in person one of these days.
author: Cat C.

description:
Big restaurant, seperated by a restaurant side (LEFT ENTRANCE) and a bar/restaurant side(RIGHT ENTRANCE), both serving the same menu.

I personally perfer the bar side because it's more romantic, there are tvs, its a ltitle dimmer, and I like seeing the bartenders make my drinks... Bar side also opens after 10pm and I can order food :)

MUST GET: $50 sushi boat (special promo they have going on, see pic)

HAPPY HOUR from 4:00 to closing. There are different happy hours depending on the time.
The one I'm familiar with is the 9:00 to closing time:
$5 Jameson 
$5 Grey Goose
$3 Corona
$2 Apple Pucker

Appetizer HH from 10:30 to close also includes:
$4 Gyoza
$4 Buffalo Wings
$4 Calamari
$4 Crab Ragoon..
and more.

Sushi/sashimi served until 10pm. All cooked foods served until closing. Good spot to relax and hang out with friends while having a late night snack.
author: Tammy F.

description:
The sushi was great , the people that work here were really nice to me and it was really laid back . I felt like a pig because I ate like 5 rolls but man I couldn't help it , the stuffed mushrooms and volcano rolls and pretty much everything else too . It was great . Now I'm hungry again . 

I'll most def be back one day .
author: Nero D.

description:
This review is for the bar at bluefin sushi. Although I have never officially dined in the restaurant,  I have ordered a few sushi rolls and other dishes and really the menu is hit or miss. The ambiance is mellow and cozy in the bar. Even though  I go infrequently to the bar I will often see the same set of locals. 

During my infrequent visits over the last five years, I have only ordered a few snacks to accompany my beer or cocktails. The small dishes have been somewhat tasty, however usually err on the side of being overly salty and overly fried.

Recently the bar management installed three electronic dartboards. Unfortunately these dartboards have taken up an inordinate amount of room and have forced patrons to crowd into one side of the bar dining room. It is an awkward arrangement to say the least.

Local bars in this area are few and in between and Bluefin is acceptable contender. I would not recommend it as a place to socialize with new people or meet a potential new friend/cuddle buddy. But if you have a hankering for a cocktail and live within a five block radius of bluefin, this bar will fit the bill nicely.
author: Carole B.

description:
Very tasty sushi rolls. 

We had the Seaking roll - eel and avocado topped off with uni and ikura $16.95, Pay Roll - Soft shell crab, snow crab, eel, garlic, avocado, cucumber, tobiko and green onion $15.95 and Sunkiss - 2 balls of Snow crab and avocado wrapped with fresh salmon $8.50 (prefect with a touch of soy sauce),

The Chirashi Don $17.95 was fresh, big slices and excellent! 

Very attentive and friendly wait staff. Water refilled without asking constantly. Extra napkins dropped off. Low sodium soy offered. Etc

Clean and sleek look albeit a bit dark :P

Only drawback is this meal was $75 (tax/tip included), so come during happy hour and many items are 25% off OR get an online deal that they have sometimes.
author: Peter L.

description: My sister took me to this sushi place that was I her old neighborhood, I was impressed with it, lighting was perfect, not to dark not to light, and the serve was great. Always on top of it. Was a little warm in there but that was the only thing that I would say neg about that place. Other then that the rolls where amazing! Diff would go back there.
author: Nick T.

description: Food pretty tasty.  Dinners were reasonably priced with good amount of food (and came with miso soup and rice):  chicken teriyaki was $12.95, and beef teriyaki was $13.95.  I tasted my wife's beef teriyaki, and it was adequate.  My chicken teriyaki had a light teriyaki sauce which was pretty good.  Some of the sushi rolls were pretty highly priced. We had the gold mine roll for $13.95, which is quite pricey.  A diet coke was $2.50.  Order taken promptly, food delivered to the table quickly, waitress and waiter service was excellent.  We ate this past Wednesday night and parked on the block where restaurant is located, and there are parking meters there for $2.25 per hour, meters in effect up until 6 pm.  I give a 3 for food, and a 5 for service.  Overall I give a 3.
author: M T.

description:
I really want to give this place 4 stars but I can't because of the service. Went here last night with the bf before going to see the Nutcracker. I had a living social voucher so we used it up. We got the following

- Green Tea Mojito - they apparently use real matcha. it was ok but the price of $8 - it was really small!!
- Spicy Girl - its big size but eh not really worth the price. The tuna wasn't that spicy either
- Salmon and tuna Tartare - this was really good and full of flvaor. Nice presentation as well....
- Nama Kaki with Uni and Quail Egg - this was really good. I appreciated the fact that tehy didn't overdo it with the sauce either. They also had the big fish roe but was only a few. 
- 2 standard house salads - can't really mess that up
- Sashimi Combo - Huge slices and you get a variety of about 5 to 6 different cuts of fish. This was pretty good but I've def gone to places where you get more for the price paid. 

Onto the service, I'm not sure if it was just that day but once we got the menus, we seriously waited a good 10+ minutes before someone came to get our order. Food came out fast but they missed our order for a Sunrise as well so we ended up cancelling it. Finally when it came time for the check, they cleared our table but didn't bring it. We asked and the waitress brought out oranges and no check still. Had to ask again for it. Overall, good food but overpriced and service is eh.
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
Those $5.95 maki combo rolls----what a deal. Nigiri 2 piece orders: fish super fresh, but the rice ratio...did not hold together very well. Lacked s/th in ratio. Tried snapper, salmon, tuna, uni. No hirame ( halibut) in stock.

Agedashi tofu, skip. Cant get the tempura nice and light on there, and the tofu ended up being tasteless. The house wine was touted as $3.75, but we were charged $5/ glass in the end.

Ambiance: lotta lotttta Cantos everywhere. Bit too loud and tables close together. My suspicion: Chinese-owned joint.

Huge bar and HH area on the other side of the restaurant. Would come again if in the second Chinatown area!
author: Jana C.

description:
The food was great the service was very good. The prices and the portions were good. 
I would easily return but probably sit in the bar. The on,y bad feature was one loud woman running her mouth for the whole time otherwise it was a great experience
author: Stef M.

description:
Being a big fan of sashimi, I have been back a few times for their sushi boat. It's not a bad deal and the quality of fish is great most of the time! Although rolls are a bit smaller, portion wise, compared to some places. There's also livingsocial deals you can look for if you are looking for a good deal. That does not include the sushi boat though.

Their service is also pretty nice and attentive. You may need to flag them down now and then, but I've never had an issue. They also have a cool looking lounge area on one side with a bar and dart machines. I've always wanted to go test that out. Maybe next time because I'll definitely be back.
author: Amimee D.

description:
They do not know how to cock the ceviches first   and the mexcain roll is bad do not order it
1 star
author: Jacob S.

description: Birthday dinner w/party of 10. Everywhere else on the street had a 2 hour wait so we somehow stumbled on this spot. They seated us right away. They allow kids too even though it seems like a lounge environment. Food was good, served fast. Drink specials even on Saturdays!! $5 drinks, where can you find that? For the price this place is awesome. They have darts that the kids had fun with. The waitress was great serving our large party. Did these super cool rainbow shots for us too!! Pleasantly surprised by this place!!
author: Chayla G.

description:
Found this place on groupon. I think the place is abit overpriced. Very difficult to find parking on Clement for those coming into the City. The evening we came it was very crowded and we waited quite a while for our food. After trying a few eateries using groupon, i've come to the conclusion to just stick to non -groupon restaurants. :)

We ordered a ramen, some sashimi, and 2 rolls. The ramen was an epic failure. It was a small portion and it didn't look like ramen you'd find at ramen houses.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Went here on a recommendation from a friend's coworker.  It has a really pleasant ambiance, music wasn't not too loud, clean, open, ample seating considering the size. The food had such great flavor! 

-The 49'er Roll was my favorite, however it wasn't very big. Nonetheless, it was seasoned very well... It had a little bit of a salty / lemon zest which was strikingly delightful. No need for soy sauce. 

-We also got the "sunkiss" which was good but awkward to eat. Essentially it is a ball of snow crab with avocado wrapped in salmon. When you bite into it, the snow crab shmooshes out the bottom/sides making a mess lol. The other two rolls we got were the "Grasshopper" and "Gold Mine" . 

-The Grasshopper has a perfect blend of warm/crunchy and cold and refreshing. The shrimp tempura inside was nice and crunchy and the exterior avocado was cold and fresh.

-The Goldmine has mango on it and it was mm mm good !! More sweet so it was a good roll to end with since it was more "dessert" like.

Service was fast! The rolls seemed to have come out  within 10 minutes and one after the other in perfect timing.

All around very impressed. Would definitely return next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Jaclyn D.

description: This place is really really good. The food was great, but the service was even better. Our server, Jimmy, was super attentive and friendly. And on top of that our food came out really fast for what we ordered. Came with a groupon, but would still come back without one!
author: Ken B.

description:
Blue Fin is a quaint sushi bar on Clement where parking is a pain in the derriere. So don't make the mistake I made by wearing heels to walk up and down the hills of the neighborhood. 

My two cents: get the spicy girl and payroll! The spicy girl consists of a medley of white fish completely enclosed by sliced avocados. It was pretty much an avocado ball filled with fresh fish! I could have eaten a million spicy girls (no pun intended) because those balls of awesome goodness were to die for. The payroll is a simple roll of eel, avocado, and cucumbers but was pretty scrumptious. The kimchi fried rice was also pretty good but not as memorable as some of the sushi. The egg on top was a bit overcooked and not as delicate as it should have been.

Although the sushi is pretty decent, the prices aren't. It's a tad bit overpriced but not as steep as a few other hot spots in SF. But definitely go for the spicy girl.
author: Angela W.

description:
I was massively disappointed with their happy hour food.  Ordered a sampling of their $3 specials and a stir fried udon.  The crab rangoon was basically the stuffing of the california roll fried in a dense won ton skin.  I guess that IS what a crab rangoon is supposed to be but I didn't care for it.  Calamari was soggy and flavorless.  Stir fried udon was OK, but it was basically Shanghi thick noodle tossed in soy sauce with cabbage..meh.  The agedashi tofu was ordinary and soggy.  Servers were nice and left you alone most of the time.

Maybe their sushi is better but I really didn't care to find out.
author: Alice L.

description: Got a Groupon for this restaurant for dinner. First went into the bar side of the restaurant which was dark with a bar and dart board but was very loud and noisy. Decided to go to the restaurant side where it was well lit and not noisy at all. The restaurant had only one other table filled so we got to choose wherever we wanted to sit. The waitresses were very attentive and fast. We got our sushi within 10 minutes. The sushi was good but not so good that I'd want to come back without a Groupon. Especially since most of their rolls are around $13 and tasted like it should be $8. Would not come back without a Groupon but worth the money if you're craving sushi and get a Groupon.
author: Jessica W.

description:
My friend that I hadn't seen in years chose Blue Fin as the venue for our catch up date.

We ordered the ceviche appetizer, sake sashimi, and a couple other rolls that I don't remember the names of. The ceviche appetizer was pretty good as was the sake sashimi. I only remember that the other roll was a bit spicy.

For two people the food was very filling. The staff were quiet but kind and intermittently refilled our tea cups.

I'll have to come back to try the raw oysters with uni!
author: Mabel Y.

description: The sushi was excellent. We got a California Roll, a Spider Roll, a New York, a Unagi Lover's Roll, the Goldeb Gate and the Rainbow Roll. The fish was fresh. The seaweed was fresh. We had the Japanese Hot Tea. It was of course really good. It was a litte noisy but it was very busy. We had to wait several times to be assisted, which was frustrating. That is the reason for the 3.
author: Orleana P.

description:
GREAT value!  

Decent sushi, including $50 sushi boats with lots of yummy sashimi and oysters.  To be fair, I'm not a sushi snob, so read the other reviews.  

Don't get the non sushi stuff, or at least don't have any expectations. The unigi fried rice and chicken teriyaki was just so so.  The chicken teriyaki in general was just grilled breast meat with some teriyaki sauce, so was quite bland.  

GREAT place to hangout.  Bar scene, electronic darts.  Fun.
author: Jimbo S.

description:
I had a Livingsocial deal to use tonight, and since my usual sushi partner is AWOL, it's just me and my stomach here to do damage.  I got seated fairly quickly and was given free pickled veggies to nosh on before my actual meal. It was refreshing and tasted like my dad's homemade pickles *Pluses!!!*. I ordered 2 hot appetizers: the nasu dengaku (grilled eggplant with miso glaze and bonito flakes), and the black and white which is fried tofu and unagi rolls.

The nasu dengaku wasn't my favorite of the two. The miso glaze was saltier than I'm used to...I usually use a white miso for sweetness and light sodium flavor. But the eggplant was soft and nicely grilled. The Black and White was delicious. I liked the soft tofu texture that meshed up well with the unagi pieces. 

I ordered the Seaking Roll (Unagi, Uni, Ikura and Avocado)  because let's face it, anything with cucumber in it, is just filler to me.  The uni pieces were nicely portioned and the unagi was flavorful against the freshness of the avocado and the salty hit of the ikura. I'd come back here again just for this roll...super yummy!

For dessert they had a chilled orange segmented into fourths and held within it's own peel like a bowl. Very nice!

Service was brisk and courteous. Lots of smiles and I never felt neglected even when I'm dining solo. Parking around here is vicious. You have to have the patience of a saint and the luck of many rabbit's feet to find one out here...
author: Pauline L.

description: Sunday open from 5pm to midnight. Happy hour everyday bar next door. Friendly staff, used livingsocial groupon without a hussel, ordered volcano roll which was fresh and very good, the ceviche was ok but I accepted little bit more of a kick.
author: Magda G.

description:
This was the absolutely best meal we had in San Francisco. It was also a journey to get there. We started on Market & California st getting on the bus going west to Inner Richmond. Little did we know in a few stops the bus was jammed packed and I became a little nervous because I never been there and didn't want to get lost. We picked up a lot of Chinese people in Chinatown where we gave up our seats to the elderly. After that experience, which I won't soon forget, we got off the bus and walked 3 blocks in the rain until we found the restaurant. 

When we walked in, half the restaurant looked like a bar. In the other half, we were pleased to be seated next to an aquarium where I found Nemo. I was disappointed that they were out of the Live Aoyagi, Live Uni, Awabi, and Live Aji. The disappointment soon went away after we found out we arrived during happy hour. We started with $3 Anchor Steam, $4 well drinks, and $3 yakitori. Everything we ordered after that was amazing:

Ika Maruyaki ($10.95)- Grilled squid. although not the best I've ever had was still pretty good.

Kaki Special ($18.95)- The best oysters I've had on the trip!! Each oyster was bigger than what I got at Hog Island and was equipped with a slice of uni, ikura and a quail egg. I never imagined the textures and taste would go so well together. Amazing.

Kim Chee Fried Rice ($10.95)- I'm not a fan of Kim Chee so I never ordered this dish at other restaurants. This was my first time trying it and it was a success. I am now a fan because it is very very good. 

Takoyaki ($6.95)- Another item trying for the first time. These octopus filled balls were DELICIOUS!!

A few more happy hour drinks and a few more skewers of yakitori completed my meal. Blue Fin Sushi had made my night and exceeded my expectations. Good service, exotic & delicious food at reasonable prices is what I look for in a 5star restaurant. If only they were closer I would be a regular customer.
author: Tri V.

description: Portions are way too small  for the price you're paying, waiter keeps asking you to order more food. Sashimi is not fresh.
author: Samantha T.

description:
I've lived in the Outer Richmond for over a decade, and for most of that time Blue Fin was my favorite sushi place. But in the last few years, they've really lost some of the magic.  

They almost never have their really special dishes anymore, like the live uni (which came to the table still twitching, mmm).  And on more than one occasion my sashimi has been delivered with an overpowering fishy odor; one of those times I went ahead and ate it anyway, with unpleasant gastric results.

Having said that, I would probably still eat there again.  It's still far better than many SF sushi places.  But given the wealth of good sushi in the neighborhood (e.g. Kabuto and Wild Sushi), I just never really feel like giving it a try anymore.
author: Joey Y.

description:
I really like this place.

I go here to watch some sports events and do a happy hour here or two. BFS is a restaurant one on side and the other is a bar. If your trying to have a quiet night, I would reccommend the restaurant part- with friendly staff and comfortable ambiance.

Although, for myself, I enjoy the bar area. The liveliness of all its regular customers and the interaction with the staff, definitely makes the setting alot more welcoming. The food is pretty good. I've tried their rolls, udon, and cocktails- all yummy!
author: C M.

description: I love the sashimi here.  I always order the same thing every time and am never disappointed- I get the assorted sashimi and a house salad (which is a pretty decent size, so I usually split it with whoever is eating with me).  The atmosphere isn't too noisy, which I like, and it's never usually crazy crowded.
author: Ashley T.

description: A small restaurant, a little dark, with two wait staff.  We ordered sashimi, raiders rolls, ankimo and some sushi.  Overall the salmon Sashimi was the best, fresh and rich.  I have had better ankimo, this one was a little bland and the raiders roll was good.  Notice the plates were not too clean and the wait staff did not automatically refill our tea unless requested.  Overall, a nice experience.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I came here on a Yelp deal as I hadn't visited in a few years (I usually head to Shimo right down the block...) and was happy to see that not much has changed! The sushi chefs were very friendly, the waitstaff EXTREMELY friendly (likely because he was drunk), the sushi was fresh and delicious. They have innovative rolls and live uni! We drank sake and beer and when we left didn't even care that it was pouring rain and so windy it felt like I was going to blow over.

Rumor has it they have fresh wasabi (not the green paste) but you have to ask for it. This might still be true, but I forgot to ask. Next time!

Yup. I like this place still. A lot.
author: Brenda K.

description:
Came early and enjoyed a few beers at the bar during Happy Hour. Can't beat $3 pints of Lagunitas IPA. Easy to walk right over to the dinning side and sit for dinner. Small and intimate space. Service was excellent with our waiter. Food came out quickly and in a proper flow rather than all at once. Highly recommend Blue Fin Sushi!
Great location in the neighborhood and perfect for a walk up and down Clement after dinner.
author: Ryan D.

description:
I love this place. I feel like they always have happy hour here. Not too many places have happy hours on Fridays between 9pm-closing, but this place does. $3 corona, $2 apple puckers, and $5 Jameson and something else. 

The atmosphere here is a little funky. The crowd is a little older, maybe between 40-60's. There's a lot of entertainment here for those who enjoy people watching (especially the drunks). The night I went I saw a middle age guy getting drunk off of bud lights and having an awesome night. Everyone is really friendly and it's a great place to go if you're looking for a less crowded of a place.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Great deal on Chirashi (8 generous pieces for 15.95)
Deliciously fresh sashimi (especially the escolar/butter fish. Like butter! And don't get me started on their toro...)
Appetizers are filling and interesting, and they know how to handle their squid dishes.
They have a variety of rolls, and like a few reviews here, the first love roll is delightful- just the right amount of peach and scallop.
author: Sasha C.

description: Sushi boat if you and your friend have a big appetite then it's enough for 2. If not then share with 3 people. The sashimi was ok quality I don't like that chewy tough vein in it, it should be tender and smooth. The oysters were real good. It was ok for the quantity and price.  My friend and I finished it dying at the end so stuffed!!
author: Karen T.

description:
So I came in with a Yelp! deal and I was impressed: Excellent sashimi, tasty hot appetizers and personable chefs. And to round it out, a solid deal.

I almost never order hot items from a sushi restaurant (why?) but I had to try the miso scallops. They were perfect; not too done or underdone with sliced scallions and a healthy dose of tasty garlic. 

Then, I had a yummy 10-piece plate of sashimi and it was so good. The white toro with tiny bits of crisped garlic was to die for and the blue fin and hamachi, fresh and delicious. The slices of sashimi were generous and it was super-fresh. Heaven.

I finished with (yet another, so unusual) hot appetizer of the "mushroom stuffy" (portabellini mushrooms stuffed with snow crab and what was on top? tabiko?.. it tasted and looked like caviar so perhaps).

Everything was terrific. I couldn't find a single flaw.

Dining alone, I burned off the rest of my Yelp deal with an order of "to-go" beef shortribs and vegetables. The owners were fearful it wouldn't translate the next day but I had them prepare the beef "very rare" so I could pan-sear it without over-cooking it.

Even if I myself ruin that dish, I'm sure it'll be a stand-out. 

Yes, Blue Fin delivers.. but only up to Divisadero, no exceptions (sob). So if you live somewhere between Clement and 18th and Divis and whatever cross street, you're in luck. West of their location, I can't speak to that but give 'em a call to see.

And I'm sure delivery will be great and dine-in... 

PERFECTION.

Thank you Yelp! for turning me on to a great new restaurant find. I'll be back again.. and again.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Had:

- Spicy Crunchy Maki: Pretty tasty. 
- Hawaiian Roll: Not the best roll. Quite odd with macadamia nuts. It tasted a bit dry and needs some type of sauce. 
- 49'er Roll : I love lemon with salmon!
- Raider Roll: Not too bad, but not memorable. 

- Kimchi fried rice: Okay, a bit salty for me.

- Salmon sashimi: Yum and buttery. The boys loved it.

Would I come back? Most likely.
author: Mandy D.

description: Very artistic presentation sushi. The taste is absolutely good! And fresh.. The sushi chef is very nice. Very recomended
author: Shintya D.

description: Good food, pretty clean, service is ok, and the prices are very fair. But the BATHROOMS smell so bad that it almost knocked me over when I walked into the mens room. Total BuzzKill after spending 125 dollars on sushi. I like this place,  but damn, either someone is paying off the inspectors or they have skipped this place cause that smell is absolutely VILE.  Go eat there and enjoy it, but DO NOT use the bathroom unless you want to almost puke.
author: Brian W.

description:
The living social deal I bought brought me to eat here. Here's what we got:

1. Miso scallop: edible, can't really taste the flavor of miso
2. Volcano roll: meh~I had better before. I think they had it baked too long as the bottom of the rice were burned and stuck together with the aluminium foil
3.Cherry Blossom roll: looked pretty, but again..taste just ok
4. Miso Seabass: well...this is probably the only thing I love and would recommend if you come. You can definitely taste the sweet flavor of miso and the seabass was juicy too. love this one!

Overall, I think the sushi roll are mediocre, nothing really spectacular.
author: Patty L.

description:
Food came out with the quickness. Service was great, or maybe cause it wasn't busy that day? Came here at 7:30 Wednesday night with a friend. We ordered quite a lot for 2, but hey it's okay to treat yourself once in a while! 

The live scallop was amazing.. 
Live uni melts in your mouth, a bit pricey but was well worth it. 
Spicy salmon roll, delicious and fresh! 
Dozen oysters, no complaints! 

Overall was good, other than everything being on the pricey side.
author: Lena ..

description:
I don't know how this place got 3+ stars. We came here because of a Groupon special. So we made the reservations and ordered away. The place looks nice but the menu was hard to decided. Everything was really overpriced, but we still ordered a bunch of food to try. 

We ordered a few sushi, the pizza, couple of the rice and even a salad to name a few. The sushi was nothing special. The fish wan't that fresh because it was a bit on the tasteless and watery side. The salad was much the same, a few vegetables with some chunks of watery tuna. The unagi fried rice was OK. The curry rice from Volcano tasted better and is half their price, with their overcooked chicken. The pizza was the worst. It was like eating a fish sandwich, most of the flavors came from a sauce they drizzled on top.

What made things worst was a group of people that apparently knew the owners. These people were loud, I swear they were screaming like someone was trying to kill them.

Would never return here.
author: M C.

description:
My first time at Blue Fin.  I remember this used to be a sports bar back in the day, and now it's turned into a nice sushi restaurant / bar and lounge.  Came in on a Thursday night with a friend of mine who has been here several times before.

We started out with the tempura (on the house - Thanks Paul), kaki fry (crispy outside and oyster goodness inside - not overdone), hamachi sashimi (fresh buttery goodness), ama ebi (sweet and fresh - fried heads were also good), uni (divine), saba (yum), ikura (nice), and a nice bottle of cold sake to accompany the entire meal (Kikusui - light and slightly sweet).  We ended it off with the fried banana and mango ice cream (lightly battered and crispy on the outside, soft sweet bananas inside).

There's a nice mural on one side of the restaurant, and a cool fish tank in the wall when you enter.  They have a nice little vibe going on in this place.  All the seafood was fresh, and tasty.  Servers were nice and attentive.  The owner (Paul) was also super friendly.  Definitely recommend this spot if you are in the area.
author: Lawrence L.

description: Have just discovered this restaurant. Great place, great customer service. Very clean and cozy! The volcano roll and fried banana are the best!
author: Veronica T.

description:
I got the nigiri combo, and it was smaller than normal sushi portions. We supplemented our meal with the AMAZING mom-and-pop Chinese bakery across the street.

Service was good though!
author: Jennifer Y.

description: The only reason why I came here was because they had a $15 for $30 living social offer.  The GF ordered the salmon sashimi and the uni roll.  I ordered the curry katsu rice bowl.  The service is fairly good, but it takes a long time for the food to come out.  The food did not disappoint though.  The GF thought the salmon and uni tasted extremely fresh.  The curry bowl was flavorful as well.  Since, our first visit, we have come back twice, both times using the same living social deal.  If they ever take away the deal, I probably would not come here again.
author: Victor L.

description:
My definition of a good restaurant is when I walked out, I'd be thinking of coming again.  This was my first experience at Blue Fin today.  

Great service and enjoyable dinning environment

The Unagi Fried Rice (#511), Raider Roll (#321), Egg Plant (#111), and Wakame Salad (#126) were very good.

I am always looking for good Japanese restaurants and wish I knew this place sooner.  I look forward to coming again.
author: Cherry L.

description: Went to Blue Fin Sushi last night unexpectedly and walked in with six people, no problem. The staff was attentive, although all of our dishes were served at different times, the Nigiri not arriving until we asked for it and the rest of us were finished.  I had the Dragon Roll, edamame, miso soup and tried the roll a friend had which was "The spiciest on their menu". All were very tasty!
author: Kristina C.

description: japanese smorgasbord...nigori sake to start...an everything menu...fat rice filler jumbo rolls...touristy names of 49'er, b-52, seaking, grasshopper...quantity over quality with $ten to $fifteen price tags...compressed tight and chewy rolls...soft shell crab battered thick and greasy...similar fate of heavy agedashi tofu and doughy skin from broth...$two miso soups finding nickle-and-diming..$eleven kimchi fried rice decent, but could have done better...$eleven katsu curry over rice good...blue fin possibly better choice for low-key teriyaki or curry meals...$one-hundred.ninety-six dinner for seven with light drinking...$twenty-eight per person...rice roll filler dinner, but tummy full...
author: Hen A.

description:
The rolls were delicious and the wait staff were very kid-friendly.  I know this because we were in a large group with three babies/toddlers.   Not even one "stare down" because it's SF and OMG you brought three kids?!

Reserve on open table.

They are reputedly one of the few places with wasabi made in-house. 

Get the volcano roll!  (purists, stop rolling your eyes at me)
author: Mytoan N.

description:
I seldom order delivery, but when I do, I order Blue Fin.

You have order carefully - consider what travels well (i.e., the hot appetizers may need to be reheated...which doesn't translate well for, say, scallops, but is just fine for the delicious Mushroom Stuffy, which is delivered in foil.  Pop it into the toaster oven and it comes out all delicious and yummy!) 

We get the First Love roll every time - needs no soy sauce and has a delicious bit of peach.   The Sashimi is a good bet as well.   And the salads with fish have been a good bet, for the most part - Poke! Yum!

The timing for delivery has always been reasonable (usually within an hour!)  and the delivery people now know me enough to remember to knock on the door rather than ringing the doorbell and having to listen to my crazy dog bark. 

Either my appetite has diminished or I'm just a little more reasonable with my order, but we usually find that $35-50 is the price to get us enough to eat without feeling like it is a total binge.
author: Maria C.

description:
Not bad, not great. The food was decent and the decor is pretty neat, but the service isn't all that great. It's pretty slow, and I'd understand if these servers are busting their ass waiting a full house, but it was halfway full and most of the time, the servers were standing around talking to each other instead of talking to their customers. You have to constantly ask for tea and water refills. It's a nightmare to order beer. You're better off walking over to the bar yourself.

The food isn't bad. The fish is fresh enough, although the prices are a bit high for a small amount. I think in some aspects, they try too hard to be a ritzy Japanese restaurant (funny since everybody here speaks Cantonese) with all the fancy roll names and silly concoctions.

Parking is a pain in the ass, to say the least.
author: Sara K.

description:
I really like Blue Fin.  I kind of OD's on sushi eating 3 or 4 times a week.  So now I am really picky.  So many places have watery tasting fish and are imaginative.  Blue Fin is the opposite.  The fish is always fresh, they have interesting and very tasty rolls (you have to try the Spicy Crunchy Maki Roll).  

I hadn't been in awhile and went last night and it was as good as ever.  It's back on the top of my list.
author: Carrie B.

description:
I really did want to like this place. I even gave it a second chance. Don't get me wrong, the food was really good. I loved the seaking roll, sashimi, rock and roll, raw oyster appetizer among other things that my family ordered but I swear this place always gives me a stomach ache. The first time I went, I had food poisoning for an ENTIRE WEEK. I think it was the tuna tartar which really messed me up. This happened twice so I really question the cleanliness and skill of the chefs! I was lucky that the second time didn't hit me as hard as the first but it was still really bad. 

This is why I really hate visiting non authentic japanese restaurants without skilled chefs. I'm sad that this hurt my stomach both times because I actually liked how everything tasted. I would've given it one star if the food wasn't as good. Also, the wait time is extremely long. If you're planning on sitting in the lounge area, be prepared to wait 20 minutes to place your order while you watch the ONE bar tender/waiter make everyones drinks before noticing you. Even on the other side, I swear we waited 10 minutes before my family even received menus after being seated. They didn't even notice nor asked. I can't say that the prices were very worth it either. Go somewhere else if you want a good experience.
author: Joyce L.

description:
Just finished eating so the review is fresh.  We used a Living Social deal here as the reviews were pretty good.

We arrived early 5pm and were seated quickly since we were the only ones there.  Our waitress never once smiled which if she was even remotely friendly would have gotten them another star.  She only walked up and said are you ready which were her only works spoken to us.  Several other staff said hello and were courteous.

We ordered only Sushi though the appetizers looked quite appealing.  Only so much room.

The Mexican roll was very tasty.  Wanted to try another of the Chefs recommendations but we opted for a Tempura roll and the Spider roll and were pleased by both the selections.

Lastly we got a Shitake roll which are small pieces and really had no taste so this one disappointed.  

We finished with the Tempura Ice Cream which we could have skipped.

Interestingly we asked another waiter (as our waitress was not around to ask anything) about a few dishes that looked quite good on an entree page but he said they don't have them a lot of the time - we found this quite curious as we plan to come back.  

I wouldn't be pleased though if I went and some of my selections weren't on the menu.

Bottom line food we ate was excellent for the most part as noted above and we will try again.
author: Tom L.

description: Me and my fiancé were the first to arrive at the restaurant side and had to wait in the bar until 5pm. The bartender was and older gentleman who was rough around the edges but managed to get out bottle of sparkling sake. We waited until 5 pm and moved over the the restaurant. We ordered the fried crab Rangoon, very good, hot and fresh. The seafood ceviche was also fresh and tasty. We ordered California Roll, New York Roll and Volcano Roll all of which were fresh and delicious. I will come back.
author: Crystal G.

description:
This place was definitely not what I expected! The restaurant is connected to a bar, and the music here is very loud top 40... We made reservations for a Sunday night and most certainly did not need them. There were just 2 other parties in the restaurant.

We ordered what we thought was enough food for 5 people, but be warned, the rolls here are small! We ended up having to order more.

The biggest challenge was our waiter who would just nod when we asked a question. I'm not sure he understood us. But he refilled our tea frequently and was very attentive so service was ok otherwise.

The food was pretty good - nothing really stood out as great although they do have a lot of inventive dishes on the menu!  In the end it was pretty pricey for just ok sushi and strange atmosphere. It was fine but I will not rush back.

Last note: parking is a HUGE pain in this neighborhood.
author: Rachel E.

description:
We always wanted to try this place.  Finally got the chance with the Living Social coupon.  From what I had heard about the sashimi and rolls from another friend who dined there earlier in the week, I was warned to skip the rolls and sushi.  

Like huh? How can I do that when it's a sushi restaurant but, I heeded her warning.  Was told that the sushi was bland and not very fresh. 

Really sad considering I love sashimi and sushi.  Ok, I lied.  I did have a tuna/salmon tar tar appetizer.  Had to feed my salmon craving somehow.  The presentation of the tar tar was rather sloppy.  There was an attempt to make it look presentable but it missed its mark.   Just staring at it I was hoping and praying that I wasn't going to get sick after eating it.   It really didn't look appetizing.   It looked too slimy.  Looks aside, I  will say it was tasty though and I can happily report I didn't get food poisoning.

We ordered  2 entrees which I had an inkling was a huge mistake.  It was a semi-mistake. OK, a mini mistake.  Screw it - it was just a mistake.  We ordered beef sukiyaki and miso sea bass.  Our server informed us that they were out of sukiyaki.  Huh?   How can you be out of sukiyaki?  Strange.   Worried now.

 So we ordered beef teriyaki.  While the steak was ok, they were rather skimpy on the teriyaki sauce.   The menu described it as a steak basted with sauce.  They really should say  - it's a steak lightly drizzled with sauce.   Even after we asked for more sauce, it came in a tiny ramekin and the kicker was that it was cold.  Really?  Couldn't warm it up in the microwave for at least 30 seconds just to heat it up?  You would think that an entree that is costing $15 would get sauce that is at least warm.  

On a good note, the sea bass I have to admit was cooked perfectly and was quite flavorful and moist. 

The overall presentation of all the entrees that we ordered can be summed up in one word- sloppy.  Seeing boiled carrots sliced haphazardly Flintstone style with broccoli as a garnish on each entree was a major turnoff.  At least cut the carrots like you care people.  Slicing the carrot on a bias might have saved my overall disappointment with the appearance of each dish placed before me.   Even our rice was sloppy looking.  Hard to do but they did it.  Rice was sticking off the edge of our bowls and not even mounded correctly.  It was really rather disappointing.   Blue Fin needs to understand that part of the thrill of going out to eat is to feast with the eyes.  Presentation and dare I say looks are everything.  

On the whole even though the sea bass was good,  it will not be enough for me to set foot in this place again.  My long time curiosity about this place has been cured for good.
author: Cris H.

description:
I should've learned my lesson three Living Social deals ago. My boyfriend and I like to use Groupon or Living Social deals to try new places. I mean you can't really beat paying $15 for $30 worth of food for a place that you're not even sure you'll love, let alone like. But I'm going to reiterate, I should've learned my lesson three Living Social deals ago...

We came here last night for dinner excited for some good sushi. We had heard some good reviews and when we arrived, the place was busy. It took forever to find parking (but that isn't saying much when you're looking for parking in the Richmond District.) Another thing was, we made it just in time for happy hour! Cheap booze and good food? What a lovely combo. 

For me, if all started with the menu. There was so much going on! It was difficult to read, not to mention difficult to turn the pages. Those things need to be wiped down with a CLEAN, UNUSED towel every night. The pages were black and the text was purple and blue. IMO, text should've been neon to make it easier for people to read.. .Strike 1!

We didn't order too much, just some pretty simple dishes. We wanted to start with the grilled whole squid as an appetizer so we ordered that as well as some Walu (butterfish/escolar and if you've never tried it, go find some because it's to die!), a 49er roll, Poky Salad, yakitori, and some hot sake and a cold sapporo (not on the happy hour menu.) Keep in mind that we wanted the squid first. 

As we're waiting for our food, our lukewarm "hot tea" came out. It's called HOT tea! Serve it hot or serve it over ice, come on! ...Strike 2! 

Waiting...waiting...waiting... Walu, 49er roll, and poky salad all come out at about the same time. Yay! But wait, where's my squid? Anyway... We're eating, eating, eating when we realize... This food is warm? Raw fish is warm? What's going on? So the temperature of the food was an issue. The only things that came at the correct temperatures were the beer and sake. Actually, the sake was 10x hotter than the tea! ...Strike 3!

My boyfriend decided to add an unagi handroll. Yum! While we were waiting, the yakitori finally came out. Ok, this was when I wanted to walk out the door. Yakitori is chicken and you should ever eat chicken raw. IT WAS NOT COOKED ALL THE WAY THROUGH!!! A real chef would know not to serve raw poultry. Get a real chef in that damn kitchen or be ready to fight some really angry people when they find out that you're chicken is the reason why they've got salmonella poisoning! Disgusting.. .Strike 4!

Immediately, we sent back the nasty yakitori. Our waitress was very nice about it, apologized, and brought us a bowl of wakame salad on the house. Sweet because I love wakame salad! ...It was room temperature. Unagi handroll came out. Looked pretty good, boyfriend was happy, we were both happy. Cool. So what's next? What are we missing...?

SQUID! Finally. Came out with no explanation as to why it took so long. It tasted like it had been sitting, waiting to be served. At this point, I was sort of done with the place. Finished by sake and beer, got the check, and got the hell outta there. Waitress offered us some free dessert, but we just wanted out.

You're going to get mixed reviews about this place. People obviously like coming otherwise it wouldn't be so busy, but I'll never come here again. 1-star for the pretty fish I got to sit next to and 1-star for how nice out waitress was. I wish I remembered her name. -3 stars for the nasty food.
author: Katie P.

description:
LOVED IT. 

I love sushi, and this place just has what it takes to make me come back!

I would highly recommend: Volcano Roll, Spicy Crunchy Maki Roll, Grasshopper Roll,  and I think one or two more (I just can't recall on the top of my head). DELICIOUS.

Service was all right.
author: Brenda S.

description: This place is alright. Decided to give this place a try since I've seen my friends checking in here. I made a reservation and man, they only gave us two options for tables even though the restaurant was pretty empty with pretty of options. We went with the Alaska Roll, California Roll, Rock N' Roll, Volcano Roll, and the New York Roll. They were all pretty decent, a bit better than Kitaro I'd say. The service was pretty decent as well except they were a bit over-friendly. Three waitresses came by every 5minutes to check if we were ready and there was this one waitress that keeps saying "Yeah" to everything we asked/said.  Probably will not be back since there are so many other sushi options in San Francisco. They do have happy hours which seems appealing.
author: Shanna C.

description:
I am a person who expects good customer service. This place definitely wasnt the place to get that! 

Couple friends decided to order the Love Boat which was an assortment of sashimi and nigiri with a roll and some fresh oysters that served 4. Miso soup was very salty although the salad that came with the Love Boat was good. We aldo ordered off their cocktail menu which we all enjoyed. Overall freshness and quality of the everything was ok. 

Once our server dropped our Love Boat, not lying, she didnt stop by once to check up on us. All of us started getting annoyed because we wanted our table cleared from clutter and maybe get some refill on our tea and order more drinks, but I guess she didn't care to take care of us. Maybe service would have been better if we sat by the restaurant side and not the bar side. Still, thats no excuse to not serve us. 

Bill was a little shy a bill. Did we leave tip? Of course! 

Tip 1 : $5.00
Tip 2 : "where is the customer service? "
Tip 3: " need to come by the table at least once. Our server was no where to be seen"

Seriously, the manager who train the staff should make sure the servers are taking care of their guests. It was our first time here and we wont be returning customers. See-ya bluefin!
author: Ella A.

description: Came here fo a birthday party for one of my friends. It's two places since they split to half bar and half restaurant but the drinks are affordable and the food is good. The teriyaki pizza is my favorite so far and the sushi rolls were fresh which makes this place worth a repeat visit.
author: Norris T.

description:
Edible food, nothing very spectacular, nothing very bad. 

My bf and I came here for dinner with a living social deal.  For $50, we ordered edamame, miso soup, two rolls, and a half dozen oysters with quail egg and uni.
