The oysters were small, not the freshest, and pretty tasteless. They needed some ponzu sauce or something. The rolls were pretty small and were more rice than fish. Miso soup is pretty hard to mess up, and the edamame may have been the tastiest dish we had that night, probably because we were so hungry. 

The food was pretty pricey for the lack of flavor.
author: Le T.

description:
Service, service, service, people. After being seated for over 20 minutes, we have no water and zero attention. I don't think that's acceptable no matter how splendid their food is. Aside from that, this is totally one of those places where they're selective about their "good" service. Throughout the meal, not once did our waiter come by and check in. Table next to us, judging from how they're just speaking Cantonese with them and constantly bringing out drinks and complimentary stuff, gets undivided attention. I mean, they're even there longer than I'd been there.

And the food. I don't think it was terrible, but I wouldn't go back. To say the least, getting a stomach ache from mediocre food and horrible service isn't all that worth it to me. If you're in the Richmond, there's way better Japanese than this place. That's for sure.
author: Antoinette S.

description:
This is by far the worst sushi place I have ever been to and the most horrible service I ever had in my entire life. The rolls are small and filled with rice. They didn't provide each person a water and menu and even after we requested it, they still managed to miss some people. They gave us forks to eat the ice cream... The fried banana was good but not good enough to give this place more than 1 star. Two people ordered a drink recommended by the server and they come out with 2 different ones and said they ran out of the other so here's this.
Not returning. Not recommending. Thanks for that unique experience.
author: Tina D.

description: They have a paper-bowl shabu that is super cool and delicious. The beef was very tender, the broth tasty, and the service was very good.
author: Kris F.

description:
In the search for the city's best and most fun sushi spots, I'm always open to hopping around town. Hence, the travel to Blue Fin.

It's interesting that some of the reviews note the service. Sushi service in my experience is supposed to be unobtrusive. You order, you get your food, they leave you alone, you eat. This is exactly what we experienced at Blue Fin and can't imagine it any other way. It ain't Hillstone or Blue Fog Diner, people. No one is going to come and kiss your butt and ask you how your sashimi tastes. The two servers that worked our table were perfectly friendly and efficient. We asked for our check, big deal, she saw we were having fun, good for her. She got her 20%.

On to the sushi: very good! Excellent menu, lots of creative rolls (Maui Roll, Hawaiian Roll and much more) and all the simple ones you can think up. Their walu sashimi was excellent. Their cocktail menu rocks, lots of creative options including a grape concoction that should I have been 22, I would have ordered it in a heartbeat.

Ambiance: awesomeness! Who knew? For such a sleepy neighborhood, this place is rocking. The place was packed when we walked in at 8. Definitely worth the drive. Great date place, too. Very hip, modern, lots of options/spaces to sit.

Arrigato!
author: Meredith R.

description:
I may be giving Blue Fin a lot of credit just because it's a short walk from my boyfriends house in the Richmond, but if you're out here this is a pretty decent sushi place. And it's simple enough, clean enough, good enough, and fun enough that I am a fan! 

Nothing stands out as "OMG you have to get this" but they have a creative assortment of specialty rolls and they do things like salads and sashimi very well. The freshness and flavors are definitely there. At average prices it's well worth it.
author: Luke M.

description:
Meh. Just...meh.
We were too lazy to walk the 8 blocks to Minami but really wanted sushi so we decided to order delivery sushi...bad idea.
I like that you can order online (since I always choose to NOT talk to other humans when given the opportunity) and they delivered in a reasonable amount of time. The praise ends there.
We shared the Romeo & Juliet roll, the spicy tuna roll and the seafood yakisoba. The rolls came in 5-6 small pieces instead of 8-10 (like any other sushi bar that charges $10-13 for a roll). The fish wasnt that fresh and the spicy tuna seemed so spicy they were masking old fish taste. The yakisoba was greasy and boring, a few sad pieces of shrimp & squid with some tasteless cabbage and carrots. 
$32 later and we're still hungry. BOO!
author: Lauren T.

description: We went there yesterday . Food is super good . If you go make sure you try the fried ice cream :)
author: Ericka F.

description: Four of us went for dinner. Non attentive service, they did not listen to our order and we got the wrong meal and request not listened too. Substandard meal and expensive for what we didn't get.
author: Jocelyn D.

description:
Arrived late night to the lounge, which closed at 1:30 a.m., which is a bit later than when the restaurant closes at midnight.

Ordered a regular mojito, which was probably one of the worst mojitos I've ever had.  Maybe I would've enjoyed one of their flavored mojitos more.  Oh well . . .

Felt like getting a late night snack, so when I heard, "Last call for sushi!"  I ordered a Volcano Roll, which didn't come for more than 20 minutes.  Then, when I asked about it, the bartenderess/waitress informed me that she thought the order went it, but then it didn't, and now it was too late.  Frustrating.

So, I ordered fried calamari.  The calamari was either old (not fresh) or overcooked.  It was no good, but I won't lie, I ate it all because I was hungry.  At that moment in time, it was good enough that it was something battered and deep fried.

The late night snacks (fried calamari, garlic fries, buffalo wings, etc.) at $4 each weren't bad.  Small serving sizes, but that's why they're "snacks."  But, the drink prices were on the high end.
author: Christina L.

description:
Fresh, fabulous, modernized sushi with a twist.  Some of the BEST seaweed salad I've had in AGES.  I'm a sushi guru and I've been searching for a place like this for a LONG time.  Picked up the livingsocial deal and hoped for the best and they delivered with the food!  Fairly decent priced for the quality I'd say.  

Now onto service............................................

Only down fault, they NEED to stop being stingy with the service!  Hire another waiter/waitress or two for weekend service (or busy nights for that matter)!  Geez!  It was ridiculous how long we waited to order, etc.  I felt bad for her because I knew the restaurant owner(s) were trying to pocket as much as possible and overworking them with too many tables!  I hope they read at least some of these reviews!!!  They could lose customers on that alone possibly.  

There's a bar next door and we didn't go there so I can't vouch for that but it was loud.  It's all loud but it's very modern and colorful.
author: Maddy B.

description: So I decided to give this place a second go, I do have to say  this time the service was much better and we got seated within two minutes even though they were once again packed. The food was once again amazing however my wife and I asked for no tobiko on any of the rolls which they unfortunately forgot to mention to the sushi chefs.  We ended up waiting for both of the rolls to be mad once again which they had no problem doing. Glad to see their service catching up with the quality of their food will definitely return here again.
author: Vlad M.

description:
We came here with a groupon, an expired one at that, but they extended it an additional week, sweeeet :)

Started off kinda rocky, i got a sticky, stinky menu. literally. it was sticky and smelled funny. The waitress noticed later on and did offer to exchange it for me, thanks! 

We were starving, so maybe our judgement could be a bit off. We were early for the dinner hour and literally one of maybe 3 tables. 
Ordered 3 rolls and probably inhaled them within 3 minutes... 

the rolls were pretty unique, romeo and juliet were our favorite. We tried several other ones with soy paper, pretty good, i was impressed. 

the service, was also hard to really review, since we were 1 of 3 tables. 

nice, but I would only come back if I were in the area.
author: Jen L.

description: I gave this place a second try since the food was pretty decent last time but oh boy, I will not ever go there again.  They gave us unfresh oysters and uni.  When we returned it, they charged us for it anyways claiming that we ate it.  Do yourself a favor and avoid the runs.
author: Kris H.

description:
The last few times I have been here the service sucked. Couldn't get refill of water for the life of me. I would say its okay if your just looking for a quick bit to eat without high expectations. Sushi is mediocre. 
Parking is a royal pain in the butt so beware when coming here.
author: Kehaulani K.

description: I came here because I'd purchased a Groupon, so I met a friend for dinner.  The fish was fresh and delicious, and the decor is really quite nice.  My only issue was that it was impossible to tell who our server was.  I had read some reviews that service could take a while, so  as soon as I saw any server near to our table we grabbed them to take our order (this was after placing our drink and appetizer order and waiting an inordinate amount of time for either to arrive OR for our server to take the rest of our order).  Once we ordered our actual meal it came incredibly quickly.  I had a strawberry mojito cocktail - would not get that again, as it tasted very syrupy - almost like cough syrup.
author: Cori D.

description:
Pleasantly surprised by this place! I feel its difficult to find a sushi place I'd return to among the plethora of "meh" ones in SF. 

We sat in the lounge side of the restaurant and we were able to order both from the happy hour menu (until 7pm) and the regular menu. Semi modern decor and very chill environment. The waitress/bartender? was helpful and gave us her honest opinion on rolls and appetizers (we ALWAYS ask for recommendations since we're indecisive) 

Food we ordered:
-Two happy hour well drinks (pineapple/cranberry vodka) $4 each 
-Crab ragoons: not as cream cheesy as expected, had some sort of filler that tasted like potato, not to my liking, but B liked it. $4 
-49er Roll: topped with salmon and lemon slices (super fresh!) $9.50 
-Seaking roll: unagi with avocado roll topped with Uni and roe (loved the combination!) $15.50
-Cherry Blossom Roll: can't recall what exactly was in the roll, it said it was deep fried but didn't taste too greasy or too soggy, really great if you like a bit of crunch in your roll $12.50 
-MONK FISH LIVER!!!! It may sound odd but the way I would describe it would be as having a fresh fish patte taste to it? It melts in your mouth like butter! If you don't like it, I'll gladly take it off your hands! :) $8.95 

~M(onkfishliveryum)
author: Brilissa T.

description:
My boyfriend and I went for Happy Hour last week, only to be horribly disappointed. What kind of a happy hour menu doesn't offer any raw fish...at a sushi restaurant? All of the appetizers were deep fried and coated in flour, which I can't eat because I have a gluten allergy.  The restaurant's rave roll, The Volcano, was unpalatable, to say the least, and there was nothing spicy about it. I passed on my share. They also don't offer any happy hour Sake, which I also think is odd.

The pluses: The service was good, they kept coming by to refill our drinks and bring us more beer and sake. The only thing that we actually enjoyed was the Spicy Girls off the Chef's Special portion of the menu. 

Apparently this place won a Happy Hour award back in 2010. The reviewer must have been drunk or screwing the owner.
author: Aubree R.

description:
Happy hour ends at 7pm, bummer.  I ordered the Raider Roll because I like Salmon Skin, and to have it crunchy in my mouth was actually yum!  We sat in the brighter dining room, but there's also a sexy intimate room and a more ambient area that looks to be a sports bar.  Our table ordered Sake Bombs for birthday purposes, but didn't know the Sapporo would be 3x as much beer, and the sake was basically an entire plastic cup filled.  Sake was hot, beer was cold, went down un-pleasurably.  The whole set was ~$11, but became a waste.  Try to share one set amongst 2-3 people.  Don't get gypped like we did.

Our orders of Unagi Fried Rice, Chow Mein, Volcano, and Tempura came out later than all the rest of the sushi.  All in all our bill came out to be anywhere from $44-$90 per couple!  Make it to happy hour to save your pockets from burning a hole in them.
author: Janet T.

description:
Edit: Due to a special request from a teammate celebrating her birthday, we gave this place another chance.  The previously grumpy bartender could not have been more friendly! What a lovely new leaf to turn over. We will be back soon.

Original review: We go to this place on tuesdays after playing in a nearby league. The sushi is okay and the pitchers of beer are pretty cheap. The worst part about this place is the grumpy bartender.  Each time we have gone in we think he couldn't get any more rude.  But sadly we have been mistaken.  He has definitely lost the business of this team!
author: Katrina G.

description:
5 of us came for dinner tonight.  No, we didn' have any coupons to redeem.  One of our friends says it's one of her favorite places for sushi.

We ordered many happy hour appetizers, e.g. chicken wings, calamari, etc. in addition to ordering our individual entrees. 

#1 highlight - the wasabi seafood pizza.  That had the "wow" factor.

I had the rock'n'roll which was good; however my ahi tuna salad was not so good.  Kind of blah.

Major con - one friend ordered beef sukiyaki but it came way after the 4 of us were done eating.  The wait staff claimed it takes 20 minutes to cook.  It was way over 20 minutes.  Better to say the order was overlooked than about cooking time.

I may come back.
author: Shirley N.

description: Not a good service. The drinks were not that great. Would not recommend it. There are plenty of other bars around. Parking was difficult.
author: Kas M.

description:
In a last minute effort to ditch the Valentine's day rush, my bf and I came to Blue Fin the day before. I was able to make a reservation at my desired time via yelp! I definitely had a great time here as I was able to enjoy my food, company, and time without wasting it away on rushed v-day service and shortage of food? 

The restaurant wasn't too crowded and I was able to be seated right away. There are two tvs and they play ESPN for all you girlfriends trying to drag your bf's out the house to eat! It was great because we both got to enjoy the game! 

I ordered the Pay Roll ( $14.95) and it comes with Soft shell crab, snow crab, eel, garlic, avocado, cucumbr, tobiko & green onion. It's what I call a jumbo roll because the size is huge compared to my next roll. 

Our second option was the Ice-Land Roll ($11.50) with Spicy tuna with avocado, topped with butterfish, tobiko. It was certainly petite but enough for us two. We also ordered 2 pcs of butterfish and 2 pcs blue fin and it definitely hit the spot. Both were perfectly chilled and fresh in color. For the butterfish, as the name suggests, was buttery smooth in texture and easy to chew. The blue fin didn't seem to make the same impression on me but was still good. 

After applying the $30 Livingsocial coupon, we only paid $28. The service was superb and I can't wait to come back!
author: Connie C.

description: The bartender Cindy on the bar side is great! Great service, ambience and food! The special cocktails are really yummy and take advantage of the special appetizers and secret menu!!!
author: Jessica A.

description: Good food but bad service and super loud. When I ordered I couldn't even hear myself. If you want a quiet date night at a  sushi restaurant with great food  & great prices then this place is not for you. I thought that the food were way overpriced. Don't get me wrong the sushi was good but not for that price. You can find better in the city!
author: Michele T.

description: I have to say I was a tad disappointed in this place. It is beyond over priced for what it is. I came here for happy hour with a few friends and we got a few drinks and some rolls. The rolls were tiny... for the $10-$14 dollar price I expected at least a decent portion, this was 8 tiny pieces... Besides that, the spicy tuna tasted a bit funky. At what ended up being $40 per person, you would expect better quality. On the other hand however, the service was great.
author: Larisa V.

description:
I used my Yelp deal to take some visitors here. From the reviews I thought it would be better. 

I'd sum up this review with something Woody Allen said: The food's not very good and they don't give you enough of it.

We had mainly sushi, plus an udon. Everything is just so-so. The taste is along the line of sushi you get from Safeway. There are so many better alternatives in the city like Ebisu and Yum Yum and Mifune for udon.
author: Andy G.

description:
My first experience at Blue Fin was amazing. My friend and I accidentally stumbled upon in while searching for a sushi place. We ordered lychee martini, blushing geisha, hawaiian roll, romeo and juliet roll and 49rs role. The sushi was fresh and rice was minimal, just how we like it!

However, I decided to take my boyfriend here, but the second experience was not so good at all. The rolls were mostly rice, no fish or vegetables in them. Not to mention that the service took forever. First they couldn't seat us, then the waitress seemed to help every other table that came after us, except for us. Then, we could not get refills on tea and like I mentioned before the sushi was "rice cakes" instead of what it's supposed to be.

I don't think I would come back here again after my last experience.
author: Karina A.

description:
Their rolls = "RICEBALLS"

I never knew sushi could get this way.  We order a few $10 rolls and each of the rolls had just a SLIVER of fish, avocado, etc.  When you eat each piece, there's so much rice in it that you don't taste anything else.

THIS PLACE IS SOOOO CHEAP.  Even Kiki (frugal sushi) is not as stingy as this place.  

I would considered myself a well verse sushi enthusiast.  This place is the most STINGY sushi place I've ever been to.

Just to give you an example:  I've had tons of 49er rolls in many places, but never have I seen the fish so thin on the top  The rice was 90% of the roll with 10% the real ingredients.  It's so ridiculous.  I'm going to upload the picture from this place (next to the 1 star, you'll see a hyperlink "1 Photo") and you shall see what I mean. 

When I walked in I was impressed with the layout, decoration, but was puzzled why at prime time on Friday night (7pm) and the place was mostly vacant.  After the food arrived, I understood why.  Disappointing. 

Btw - here are my favorite sushi place: Koo & Kubuto & Ebisu.  Best bang for your buck is Nara.
author: Sandra L.

description:
The rolls and kim chee fried rice here is delicious! The rolls do run pretty small but the fish tastes fresh and it carries a healthy feel. If you plan on drinking I recommend coming during happy hours because the drinks are 8 dollars each when happy hour is over and the drinks run small!

There are these comfy lounge seats that are kind of near the window, it looks great but DON'T SIT THERE! My party made that mistake and our backs started hurting like 15 min into our meal. Very un-enjoyable =(
author: Jenny N.

description:
Ambiance - 3 1/2 stars
The space is cool at Blue Fin.  To the left is the dining area and sushi bar, while to the right you can enter a separate room to the lounge with a full bar.  The night started off in the former, with my boyfriend and I enjoying a casual dinner in the modern restaurant.  The night ended in the latter, with a DJ playing and our friends crowded around and enjoying some libations.  I would definitely go back to Blue Fin for the lounge experience and happy hours (regular and late night), but I would probably not choose to return if it were just for dining. 

Cocktails - 1/2 star
So although I said I would go back for the lounge experience, that does not mean that I enjoy their cocktails.  Let me make this very clear, Blue Fin has some of the worst signature cocktails I have ever tried.  The two that I tried, lychee ice salt and blushing geisha, were weak and tasted bad.  However, the lounge has a full bar and beers on tap, so that was what I stuck with after I realized that my first crappy drink wasn't a fluke.  

Sushi - 3 stars
The sushi is just okay.  It's not bad, but it's not amazing.  I actually think I'm being generous with 3 stars.  Based on flavor, or lack of, I would give Blue Fin's sushi 2 stars, but the presentation bumps those 2 stars up to 3 stars.  

Based on my calculations, I can only give Blue Fin Sushi 2.3 stars, which I have to round down to 2 stars.
author: Sandy K.

description: I was there yesterday during happy hour. The restaurant side was packed with people and very hot. I moved to the bar instead where it was a bit cooler. The food is very good here. And so are the drinks. Last night's bartender was Nikko. She was amazing. Though she was the only bartender that evening, she remained cool and collected as she tended to everyone at the bar and a party of 20 celebrating a birthday. Job well done young lady. I can see why everyone was there during happy hour... $4 & $5 appetizers and designer cocktails for $5.
author: Me Like Good Food S.

description: My favorite Japanese restaurant in the city. Staffs are friendly and nice. Sashimi are fresh all the times.
author: Lori T.

description:
I WISH I LIVED CLOSER!!!!! 

Went here with the Yelp Coupon and not sure what to expect from the reviews. I must say I am glad I gave it a chance. At first when I walked in I was kinda let down because they did not have my reservation! The hostess quickly made sure there was a place for us to sit and we enjoyed our meal in the Lounge Area. 

We started out by ordering the Fried Crab Rangoon's which were very yummy. 4 pieces so a great starter dish. Then we ordered some rolls... Which were the best!!! We did the Mexicano Roll (who would have thought guacamole on a sushi roll would be so good?!?!), Grasshopper Roll, and Volcano Roll. The only let down was the rolls were not that big. Not the best if you are sharing. 

But the reason I HAD TO REVIEW THIS PLACE was for the White Peach Bliss!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! OMG I am not a fan of alcohol so I do not drink much but on occasion it is nice to have a drink here and there. Since it was my first time out after having a baby 4 months ago I thought it was the perfect time to enjoy a cocktail! So I ordered the White Peach Bliss and it was BLISS! I had 4 of them! I would go back just for the drinks if I am ever feeling the desire to enjoy a drink or 4 LOL 

**Also on a side note - on the yelp coupon it states the deal is not valid with happy hour... I made sure to ask so we were not billed differently since we were in the lounge before happy hour ended and the great waitress we had, checked and said it is off the total bill so we were able to enjoy a few happy hour prices with our yelp deal. We just showed them our email confirmation on our cell phone and they checked us out. This place seems to be the place to be in the area. A lot of people were coming and going so I suggest to make reservations and maybe call the day prior to confirm just in case they are not able to accommodate you in the lounge area like they did for us. Parking isn't the best but the food and the White Peach Bliss was worth the tiny walk around the corner.
author: Michelle B.

description: This is going to be a short review and to the point... I have been here twice - once was an evening with one of my girlfriends and once for my birthday. Both times have been pleasant (fast/friendly service, fresh food, etc.) and the delicious food satisfied my cravings. FYI, it was easy to make my reservations for my large group (20+ people) on my birthday and were honest in their opinions when we had questions. This is a place I definitely like coming back to!! :)
author: Christina L.

description:
Disappearing act.

Start of a sushi tripleheader.

Hawaiian roll was quite possibly the best of the night. Mango topped with tuna with the unique addition of a macadamia nut. Loved it.

B52 roll with spicy hamachi and cucumber was less my style. Then again neither are the B-52s.

Each priced just right at $10.

Star lost for the service. Exceptionally long wait for the check. Too long. If only the music were as polished as the decor. '90s music made the wait seem ever longer.

Another star lost for being out of edamame. How?

Shaky start to the trifecta. Continuing on:

Part two: http://www.yelp.com/biz/drunken-sushi-san-francisco#hrid:odudqKHmU_iRn1xtnSU-Ug

Part three: http://www.yelp.com/biz/shimo-san-francisco#hrid:jxn4bQWkp8ZQvy_5eyz32g
author: Jason B.

description: This is my favorite Sushi spot in SF. I love their creative rolls, and sauces. They are a step above normal sushi!! Great ambiance, we always love the fish tanks :)
author: Roberto J.

description: Meh. Food is not great here, the only good thing I like about this place is the bar area.
author: Ty N.

description:
This place was great. The sushi was fresh and tasty. We had a couple of their rolls and each was good, and a decent size. I look forward to going back again. 
Service was nothing special but friendly enough and it was a little funny the restaurant is connected to a lounge but it looks like two different places.
author: T S.

description:
Let's not give a sushi restaurant many stars based on it's "specialty" rolls. It's not about how many fish they can pack into a roll, or how many "unique" sauces they can douse over the roll. To truly judge a restaurant is to look at it's raw fish; quantity and quality. 

Came here on a Saturday night around 6pm, still relatively early in the night, and the beginning of the weekend. 

Sat down, looked at the menu. Yes they offer a lot of things, yes the menu is full (by the way looking at the menu hurt my eyes because of all the colors - where's the simplicity?), however they some how ran out of uni and fresh sea scallops. Are you kidding me? On a SATURDAY NIGHT, EARLY Saturday night. All we wanted that night was uni, sea scallops, oysters and hamachi kama. 

Needless to say, we left $3 for the didn't-touch-tea, and the semi-eaten-edamame.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Found a deal on www.buckslive.com. $2 for $20 voucher.  First time here. Awesome butterfish!  Will definitely 
come back again.
author: Deb L.

description: Really good sushi.  I loved the vegetarian dragon roll.  I'm not a fan of eggplant but I liked the eggplant on this sushi roll.  I'll be coming back.  Parking is a bit tough, if you are driving.
author: Liz D.

description: We were here for dinner while vacationing in SF from NYC. We bought a living social deal and I would have paid full price for our meal, no qiestions asked. Tammy is a server/bartender and did a fantastic job. The food was DELICIOUS and the Green tea Mojito was amazimg. Cany wait to come bavk out west and eat here again. A must for Japanese food lovers. The Goyza were mouth watering, and the Volcano salad was...just Wow.
author: Anthony C.

description:
Sorry but it's a mediocre place that could and should be better.  I visited this place many years ago and was there just last week.

The staff is very friendly and attentive, if not a little too attentive.  Maybe it was because we were very early in dinner service and the staff didn't have as uch to do or that's just how they are...either way, they need to dial it back a little.

Right off the bat, the sushi rice was a little soft and bland when it should have been a little firmer and had a very subtle taste of tang and sweetness.  The fish itself was fresh and well cut but the rice...

I had the raw scallops which usually comes with a plate of fried bits scallops and onions.  Unfortunately, it came as two large clumps when it should have been looser and more delicate.

It's been less than a week and I can't remember anything standout about it other than the raw scallops but that's kind of a gimme with the slice of lime, etc.
author: Keaton N.

description:
Service was not very good, but they had a good attitude about it. They just didn't really have it together. Host got yelled at by supervisor in Chinese, for asking whether we wanted to sit in the restaurant side or lounge side. Apparently, he was supposed to just seat us where they are seats instead of asking which side. 

The restaurant side has more comfortable seats for dining. We were okay with a table in the back of the lounge, where the tables were a little higher and seats didn't sink. 

Later, a waiter got brought our food the table next to us. The table said it wasn't theirs, I tried to call after him, but he had already dashed off. He later came back with our food. 

Food took awhile to come, but overall good food for the money.
author: Erika C.

description: Omg!!! Really great sushi here!!! I love  their ahi tuna salad and all their sushi specials!!! Uni, mirugai and oysters are always so fresh and yummy ! The manager name Kiko is the best! She always greets us and makes sure we are satisfied! We will keep coming back for the beautiful Kiko and the sushi!!!
author: Em C.

description: The food here is pretty decent, but they used to have a good website that you could order from, but it went down months ago and now you're stuck ordering through Eat24, who marks everything up.  I've called these guys and told them *multiple* times to get their website back up so customers can order online, but they don't seem to give a crap.  Good food, lame management.
author: David P.

description: My 2nd time returning to this gem of a sushi joint did not let me down. The rolls are impeccable and so eloquently presented. This is now my favorite place for sushi and other tasty dishes in SF. I have a hard time believing there are many others that balance cost and quality so well. Kimchi fried rice, spicy crunchy roll, volcano, lady fingers were tge dishes of the night. I wish I could have had more of the menu... until next time. Living social deal makes this a no brainer.
author: Moses A.

description: YOU WILL GET SICK FROM THE UNFRESH OYSTERS AND SASHIMI!!! Sure, they may have the cheapest boat of sashimi you will ever find, but you get what you pay for, thus quality is forgone. Consider this prior to selecting the $65 sashimi boat.
author: Dave M.

description: We came because of a living social coupon.  We ordered volcano roll, spicy tuna roll, grilled scallop, grill miso eggplant, etc. Food was mediocre. The scallop was a bit chewy. Please don't tell scallop is supposed to be chewy. I had good scallop before. The grilled miso eggplant was a bit burned and tasted bitter.  We came on a hot day. It was a bit stuffy inside.
author: J L.

description:
Had a good time dining here for a birthday celebration. We had a party of 18 on a friday night so we were seated in the private room they had in the back. The restaurant is pretty small so I would imagine large parties only being able to fit in the room in the back, so reserve ahead of time if you plan to have a large party. The room in the back is separated by curtain blinds so it's not completely closed off from the restaurant which is nice.The decor was very modern and gave us enough privacy so that our loudness wouldn't be disrupting to other diners. They did play top 40 music throughout the night as well and it gets louder later on in the night when more people start coming in for the bar/lounge feel. Our dining room was right by the bar too so you can have the option of ordering your drinks at the table or ordering at the bar separately.

The service was very prompt and the waitresses were really friendly and efficient. Our table was ready by our reservation time, they came in and took our orders shortly after everyone settled in, and the food came out fairly quickly with no mix ups. As far as the food, the food was just okay - nothing to write home about. Pricing is a little higher than standard Japanese restaurants but reasonable. But the place gets four stars because it's a great place to dine with a bunch of friends, has a good variety of drinks from beer, sake, and mixed drinks, and plays music. But beware, parking is a major pain though!
author: Thao V.

description:
Review is for dinner, not drinks/happy hour:

Just paid a visit tonight for dinner to help my family blow a $200 gift card that we had to use all in one visit. Parking is pretty troublesome; restaurant decor is modern and the screaming happy hour deals are a sign that patrons aren't exactly rushing in over the quality of the food. All $200 was blown on food so I like to think I've tried a fair sample of what blue fin has to offer. 

There were a few memorable dishes; Nama Kaki w/ quail egg and uni - pricy but not bad for 6 oysters on a half shell plus extras. The Seab(r)eam Tataki was also a pretty fair combination of flavors that I enjoyed. Finally the butterfish sashimi was something I've never tried and tasted fresh and clean. 

Most items however left a mediocre impression. All nigiri & sashimi (excluding the butterfish) looked (in the display at the sushi bar) and tasted a little old. Some were slightly grainy, some had a tough texture, and all simply did not have a fresh taste. Most disappointing was the uni: the quality was poor; the sacs were destroyed or simply purchased as low quality. The taste was slightly metallic-like and utterly disappointing. December is supposed to be the ideal month isn't it??

The takoyaki was average, not scalding hot as it should be, and scanty on the octopus; the miso scallops were overcooked; the poke salad was poorly balanced, the rolls were just a mush of flavor, etc. etc. you get the idea, the meal came off in the end as mediocre and slightly disappointing- that should earn a place 3 stars. 1 more star off because as I lie here writing this review, my stomach is churning and definitely not happy. Confirms fish not fresh.
author: Chris D.

description: Blue Fin Sushi got the job done!
author: Rafi K.

description:
I am pretty demanding in terms of my expectations of service, or so people tell me.  I think it is not too much to ask for waiters to be polite and not roll their eyes if I ask for a refill on tea.  And I certainly should not have to ask for my sushi three times and be given that same blank stare as if it is the first time I am inquiring about it.  

Enough about that.

The sushi is OK...fresh enough, but nothing special.  I should also mention that I am extremely picky with Sushi or any Japanese food.  This place is not authentic, but they serve up some very Americanized Japanese food, if you're in to that short of thing (which at times, we all are).

If you are looking for authentic Japanese Sushi (and Izakaya!), go to Oyaji and sit at the Sushi bar!!!
author: Jessyca M.

description:
The sushi rolls I've had here have all tasted fresh and delicious.  

I've never had to wait for a table but I guess I've eaten here at off peak hours.  The staff is friendly and the service is pretty quick.

The music from the bar is a bit loud but it doesn't prevent you from hearing your friends at the table.  Not sure I would frequent the bar but the restaurant is a good option for dinner.
author: Mark J.

description: I could eat the "sunkiss" every day!!! We drive all the way from Novato to have sushi here. Always fresh, delicious!!! The servers are all amazing. I'm actually eating here tonight. Not giving 5 stars only because the dining room could use some new decor.
author: Gimena G.

description:
I came to this restaurant this past Monday night using a LivingSocial voucher I purchased a few weeks back.  The decor here is pretty nice.  In fact, on my way out after dining here I noticed one section where they put a see-thru panel on the floor, and underneath were something like a star fish display.  Quite nice.

The sashimi combo was overall decent.  I very much enjoyed the hamachi and the white fish.  The others (red tuna, salmon, albacore, and one other) were more run of the mill but not bad.  Also for around $8.99 the ankimo (monkfish) appetizer came in a pretty sizable portion (eight pieces, as I recall).
author: H K.

description: This is one of our favorite sushi joints when we lived in the Richmond district. Great Asian inspired cocktails to wash down fresh and deliciously prepared sushi. Their small plates are delicious and their nabeyaki udon is so filling and comforting.
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
I really like the sushi at Blue Fin. It is nicely made and presented. It taste so good as well! My favorite is the sunkiss which is avocado wrapped in raw salmon. Cannot remember all the rolls I've tried, but it was all good. No complaints about the sushi.

Do not order the ramen. It is a huge disappointment.

Service, atmosphere, and decor are all good.

RECOMMENDED!
author: Chatree T.

description:
I've been here for happy hour and for dinner. Friendly service and fun atmosphere but these did not make up for the mediocre food

Lychee martini- frozen martini, pretty fresh and light
Nasu dengaku- decent if you like eggplant. have had better at izakaya sozai
Yakitori- dry and flavorless, would not recommend
Dragon roll- from everything ordered, this was the best. pretty good
Maui roll- good
Kimchee fried rice- maybe it's the korean in me, but i thought it wasn't anything special. would probably go to any one of the nearby korean restaurants on geary for this

Go here if you want good rolls with a cocktail, or happy hour drink specials. The happy hour food is not good and somewhat random (crab rangoon, garlic fries, yakitori?)
If you want awesome sushi/rolls, I would go to Shimo 5 blocks away.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Fantastic experience at Blue Fin. The happy hour menu features 25 percent off all rolls on the menu. The Volcano roll and 49er roll were especially tasty. I didn't get a chance to sit at the bar, but it looked like the patrons were having a great time. The service was impeccable too. Never had to wait for water refills. We also had sake and tempura battered ice cream, which I would recommend only if you plan to get on the treadmill for a few hours.
author: Gene W.

description:
i just moved to this area, and sushi is one of my favorite food.
Today, i have tried this place out, over all that have very good. All the staffs have friendly attitude and they treat the customers with smile. Fantastic food. Fish is absolutely fresh, and the presentation is so pretty. There are weekly special and Dine-in sushi Happy Hour which starts from 5pm to 7pm. Strongly suggest the $2 blue fin Toro (limited one piece per person), which is usually $14.95.
all different kinds of fish that they just got from the fish company, which is directly from the fish market. therefore, we can taste the freshness. 
they have the live shellfish such as the live scallop uni, and oyster. 
for the drink, they have full bar which means that you can order strong alcohol drinks.  
the environment is pretty quiet.
the location is very convenient, right at the corner of 19th ave and clement st. furthermore, they have a huge parking lot located at Geary and 18th(right next the the theater)
author: Wade W.

description: This place is good! The sushi is delicious and the service is on point. My glass was never empty and our server was very attentive.
author: Heather R.

description: Interesting menu. Sushi chefs are great and accommodating.  Fresh sashimi.
author: Kitty M.

description:
i don't really know where to start.....my friend was taking her parents from out of town for sushi, it was their first time....and i tagged along....

the food is very expensive, small plates and ok, not as i had expected....my friend has talked about this place many times, and very highly....

but i think it is overrated....you will have to see for yourself....nothing gave me that wow feeling....
author: Leslie Y.

description: We went for dinner twice and both times we were very happy, food quality, prices, service. A place to go back :)
author: Laura D.

description: Great service. Fresh and reasonably priced rolls and sakè.  Will be returning soon for sure.
author: Katheryn M.

description: Came here with the man friend friend 2x's already, only because we had a Groupon for it.  The atmosphere is weird.  Being in the Richmond, one would not expect a really modern sushi bar, playing Macklemore (spelling?).  Sushi was alright, although I did feel like the rice to fish ratio was kind of skewed.  Tempura was good.  Kimchee fried rice was relish.  Service was alright.  Since the servers knew that we had a Groupon, we kind of felt as if they were treating us a little different in comparison with other customers.  Would we go back?  Probably not.
author: Tracy C.

description:
WORST F'ING SERVICE EVER!!!

I came here for a birthday celebration on a Saturday night and we reserved the special room in the back since we were a group of about 20 people.  The key word there is reservation, meaning we called in advance and gave them a heads up about our group.  Why did our dinner take 3 hours from start to finish?  I wish I could say that it was 3 hours because we ate our food and proceeded to sake bomb the night away, but instead, we left sober with frowns on our faces from the frustration we felt at this f"ing place.

Let me break down the chain of events that went down here.  
8:00pm - arrive for our reservation
8:30pm - receive menus
9:00pm - receive waters and waiter takes drink orders
9:15pm - wrong amount of beers arrive
9:30pm - orders are taken
9:45pm - wine ordered at 9pm arrives
10:00pm - food starts arriving sporadically
10:30pm - food for the birthday boy finally arrives
11:00pm - everyone is finished eating and waiting for bill
11:30pm - idea to ditch bill surfaces due to impatience in waiting for bill, but bill finally arrives 
11:45pm - attempt by restaurant to save face by giving us 3 orders of fried banana ice cream fails as everyone is ready to just leave restaurant already

Also, while we were waiting around for random things to be served, like our food or drinks, we noticed all the servers just looking into our area like we were in some type of quarantined area for SARS.  At the end of the night, one of the servers buddies walked in and he decided that giving his friend a pound and hug and ask him what he was doing there and shoot the sh*t with him was much more important than getting us our bill.  Thanks for the excellent service Mr. Dragon BallZ.  Maybe he was in celebrity shock since his friend did come in with all Lakers gear on and his last name screen printed on the back of his jersey.  But the last time I checked, Jeremy Lin played for the warriors and wasn't a short, chubby asian guy.

I'd never go back here again.  The service on this first visit was so bad that I dont think it deserves a second chance.  The worst part was that the place wasn't even that busy to begin with, and there seemed to be an adequte amount of staff there.  Horrible.
author: JP T.

description: Hate to hate, but this place sucks.  Sushi is weak and, not big sexy and memroble.  There are far to many sushi places in SF that are excellent, there are numerous on Clement (Shimo's a few blocks down!), this place is fake sushi.  However, the full bar and private room make it stand out from other places.  Service sucks too.  Sorry.
author: Chelsey G.

description: Best sushi in SF. The volcano roll is amazing and they deliver!!!
author: Page F.

description:
I came here with a Yelp deal and was very happy! The food was delicious. 


The owner stopped by to see what we thought and told us that they get really busy on weekend evenings, but not to worry, they have a parking lot arragement just down the street!
author: vanessa e.

description:
Great things about this place:
1. Happy hour every day from 5pm - 7pm. Who wouldn't be happy for a $4.50 glass of wine that is filled to the top?
2. Very tasty rolls. Some of them are pretty unique which keeps things interesting. 
3. They deliver! Makes the lazy person in my happy. 
4. They have flat screen televisions in the bar area and the dining area. Now I never have to miss  a Giants game while I eat. 

Things that are not too great:
1. Some of the rolls are a bit overpriced for the amount of the ingredients that are in them. 
2. If you go with a large party, they are not as attentive (based on my experience). 

I've been numerous times and will continue to keep on going!
author: Holly F.

description: The place is nice, the food is just as good but frankly speaking I go here to chat with the most beautiful bartender I've ever laid eyes on... Tell Cindy I said hello when you visit!
author: Alex M.

description:
I am definitely a Blue Fin fan! :) I love that they have sushi and Japanese fusion food (LOVE LOVE FUSION!) They are also pretty reasonable priced and I love that they are open late! This place is also a great place to have some sake and beer with friends! 5 stars for Stanley!

What I recommend:
Albacore Tataki 
Ahi Tuna Salad
Spicy Crunchy Maki (favorite roll there!)
Grasshopper Roll
Spider Roll
Yaki-Udon Chicken (the seafood one was okay)
Asian Style Duck Breast (nom nom nom)

What I did not like that much:
Sashimi Salad 
Dragon Roll 
Raider Roll
author: Annie L.

description:
Oh, Blue Fin. How I adore thee. Let me count the ways...

1. FRESH fish for the sushi rolls
2. Great ambience 
3. Not on the cheap side, but definitely not on the expensive side either. Fits the "casual fine dining" category. 

The only reason I docked one star is because the service could be a little better.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Came here with my Yelp deal, and I'm so glad I purchased one! Parking definitely sucks around this area or we just had really bad luck when we came, spots were being snatched up right in front of us. 

This place was surprisingly a lot smaller than I expected, especially from seeing the outside storefront. But half of it is a restaurant and the other half is a lounge. Not sure what the lounge offers other than drinks, or if you can also get food there? I didn't read the other yelp reviews that closely before going. 

My husband and I came on a Friday night at 7:30pm, but we called ahead and made reservations figuring it would be PACKED on a friday night. I think we got lucky on that note because it wasn't packed or as busy as we thought it woudl be. It's a small place so it doesn't hold a lot of tables, but there were a few empty tables when we arrived. 

First off, they give you a bowl of complimentary edamame. A total plus because hardly any sushi places that I've been to ever gives complimentary edamame. Downside is that the edamame wasn't fully cooked, it was hard to pop the beans out of the pods. You should be able to bite into it and slide the bean out easily. This one you had to gnarl on it to get it out. But hey it's free! 

We ordered the Chicken Kara-age because it looked different than the normal chicken bites, this one was on the end of a bone, like a chicken wing with the meat pulled down to form a lollipop. It was very yummy and crispy. Mhmm good. 

Another appetizer we ordered was the Salmon and Tuna Tartare. It came with a side salad on the plate which was yummy to have some fresh greens with japanese food. The tartare wasn't as fabulous as I would've thought, it was still good but I could hardly taste the salmon in the tartare, the tuna was overpowering it. I would've loved just a salmon tartare by itself. Still good, it's just a personal preference. Also in typical-tartare fashion, it came with wonton chips to spoon the tartare on to eat. But oddly it also came with shrimp chips. 

A definite plus side that my husband and I totally appreciated was the price for sashimi. Usually sashimi for us is super duper expensive that we can't justify getting as an appetizer. Here at Blue Fin Sushi, this wasn't an issue. Super reasonable pricing. And the sashimi was fresh too. We ordered the Salmon sashimi and the Shiro Maguro (white tuna). Mhmmm both yummy. 

We also ordered a few rolls - yes we were being heffers, but we had a $60 yelp deal to use up. The rolls were all awesome, we got the Romeo & Juliet, Ice Land Roll and the Volcano Roll. They were all soo soo good. The only slight downside is the Volcano Roll was stuck to the foil after baking it, so it was a chore to get it off the foil. They need to use spray-on oil before baking, it would help a lot. 

Overall, great place to eat, great service, great food, parking sucks! And prices about reasonable. 

At the end of the meal, they give you an orange for palate cleansing and dessert. Also another point to note, great service! Anytime we had a plate that was empty of even chopstick wrapper, there was always someone to swoop by and pick it up. They were super diligent! Love great service! If only more restaurants were like this.
author: Grace L.

description: Went two nights in a row during my visit because they have DARTSLIVE dart boards!  So much fun to enjoy delicious food and drinks while playing darts with my friends!
author: Meradith M.

description:
REALLY love this place. It really is the most innovative sushi place in terms of taste and presentation as well as everything else on their menu. 

For instance, they have unagi fried rice. Who would have thought of that? And it tastes amazing! Their rolls are extremely creative as well. And their sake selection is well thought out. 

Everything I've tried here is out of this world, and it's very nicely put together in terms of decor. 

I go to Blue Fin when I know I want to treat myself to a top notch sushi/contemporary Japanese fusion dinner.
author: CeeCee Y.

description:
Came here for drinks and found out Happy Hour goes til midnight?!  Something like that....  $3 Corona's, $5 Grey Goose Vodka's, and $3-$5 appetizers.  The appetizers were effective in absorbing some of the alcohol so we wouldn't get too tipsy.  Actually, who am I kidding...  

The garlic fries, calamari, and the dumplings were good though!  And the drinks?!  Well, those got stronger throughout the night as we drank more... And as the bartenders drank more too.  

Who knew there were hot little spots like this on Clement?!  Much better than the options on Geary.
author: Danny L.

description: Very Expensive for a neighborhood restaurant.  Kitchen was slow in dishing out our entrees.  Ordered 2 ramens ($12 ea), 1 Gold Mine sushi roll ($13.50), and a grilled lamb chops ($16).  The sushi roll came out really quick, but there was nothing special about the roll at all.  It was basically a fancy California roll with sashimi on it and a lot of roe.  The 2 ramen bowls came out about 10 minutes after the sushi roll and was basically pretty good...however, the grilled lamb chops ($15) took over 40 minutes to come out of the kitchen and not only did we get only 3 chops, they were 3 VERY SMALL chops.  Trust me, there was not $5 worth of lamb meat on each of the ribs.  When the bill came, it included an 18% service charge already - not sure why when the service did not deserve it at all.  Total bill of the 4 items consumed with tax and tip = $68.  I'm going to stick with Kitaro and Sake Bune from now on...
author: Kid N.

description:
Everytime Ive been here its always been good...

There is this dish with mushrooms and pistachios, this dish is very tasty and supposedly it accompanies a different dish. What i like most about this dish is that it remind of a dish my grandma used to make when i was younger.
There is this uni with oyster wrapped in shiso and fried. Lightly fried so its doesnt cook everything up. Just so it gives a nice crunch which leads you into the goodness inside.
Chicken Kaarage is quite good, fried juicy goodness..becareful its hot and the juices spraying you lip wont feel good.
Raw Oysters - simple freshness...add Tabasco and lemon please
Amaebi and Hamachi - fresh deliciousness...
Salmon tatare on a shrimp chip - eat it when it comes out otherwise the chip gets soggy..not that it wont taste good but shrimp chips taste better crunchy!
Fried Ika - tasty fried squidy goodness..

Ive had a couple rolls here too and they were quite good..cant remember the names but usually with rolls you cant really mess up unless there is like cream cheese or something...I really dont get why people like that in their sushi..

cream cheese? come on....

anyways, blue fin is a tasty place and Ive met wonderful people and made lots of fond memories here...
author: phillip w.

description:
I am re-reviewing this place. I have been coming here for 7 years since they opened. After the first 2 years the went down hill. I bought the yelp deals they offered because I knew the place and it was a good deal. 

The yelp deals reintroduced me to this place. Wow am I glad!!! 
They have the best specials and super fresh fish. The staff is very helpful and the chiefs are very nice. 

They have a full bar and great for a couple, quick snack and large group. 

Cant wait to go back!!!!
author: Andrey P.

description: Yuck. If you truly love sushi, and by sushi I mean GREAT fresh sushi, Do not waste your time here. Coming from someone who eats sushi often. Wish I would have read more reviews first. The people who say it's great, must not have gotten around much in the sushi world. I just puked a lil in my mouth no joke. Never again.
author: Nicole E.

description: I really love sushi, but after coming here, I stopped eating sushi for about 2 months. The fish didn't taste fresh and I felt pretty sick after I left. I came here on a Sunday night and it was pretty dead, but the service was still horrible. Will not be coming back.
author: Nancy T.

description: We are visiting San Francisco for the first time and wanted to find some good sushi! We found a groupon for Blue Fin and were very satisfied! The rolls were delicious, the food came fast and the staff was friendly and accommodating! We would definitely return here if this was back home!
author: Rachel G.

description: Got ripped off on a delivery and Blue Fin's excuse was that it is Valentine"s Day. Very disappointing to pay for a tip and incomplete delivery order.Valentine"s Day is not an excuse - it happens every year and they should be prepared for it. Also food that was delivered was not as promised on the menu. I have been eating there and ordering delivery from them since they opened but I need to find another option.
author: Christine P.

description:
I cannot come back to this restaurant for a while even though it's very close to my house.  Last time I was here, the mafia like sushi chefs and waiters were dining and wine'ing their friends who occupied a large table near the sushi bar.  I kid you not -  the sushi chefs kept bringing over sashimi and then down a shot of sake with the people at the table.

Meanwhile, we had been waiting 30-minutes with no sign of any food.  Finally, I have to wave down a waiter and ask before their realized that our order had been neglected, even though our waitress passes our table a ga-zillion times in those long 30-min (but never checked in abour our order).  We didn't even get the sashimi salad all the dishes arrive, then the salad turned out to contain a bad piece of sashimi, which made me spit it out.  We canceled the dish but I was furious by then.  

If you want to chance it - go on a quiet night when you will get better service, more attention and food more quickly.  Good luck!
author: Bessie T.

description:
I was not completely impressed but this place.  The sushi was decent and there were a few creative rolls but in a city with several top-notch sushi restaurants, this one doesn't stand out.  It is a bit overpriced for the portion size and quality.  All in all this place is kinda run-of-the-mill and there are other (better) local options.

I don't think that I will return here.
author: Jessica J.

description:
I really wanted to like this place since it is so close to my apartment, but unfortunately it fell flat. The food was actually pretty decent but the 45 minute wait for 3 sushi rolls was ridiculous. My wife ordered the salmon teriyaki which came out in about 10 mins, but apparently raw sushi rolls take longer to prepare. 35 minutes longer....

I went right after they ran their Yelp deal and maybe they weren't ready for the rush of business, but c'mon 45 minutes for sushi rolls on a Wednesday?? They seated us in a side room adjacent to the bar so we thought maybe they forgot we were back here...make sure to sit in the front dining area. Also, if you've purchased a Yelp deal make sure you print it out, I had to go back and forth with the manager since I only had the code on my phone (which should be all they need). I'm going to order takeout or just drink at the bar with my next deal....
author: J S.

description: Very good sushi rolls, and discounted appetizers during happy hour.  Great service from a welcoming staff.
author: Donna R.

description: Nice staff, good atmousphere but slow service and mediocre sushi.  The salads and rolls with dressing were drenched and the edamame was under cooked.  The best part about Blue Fin was that they reimburse you for parking at the 18th st parking lot.
author: Evan M.

description:
Went here for dinner today. Very nice and small place. The service was quick and the place is very clean and has a nice decor. The food was very fresh. We got:
- friend calamari: typical
- miso soup: typical
- pay roll: my favorite! huge pieces and rlly intricate
- dragon roll: bonus points for cool shape
- volcano roll: really good
- 49ers roll: similar to dragon, also good
($60 total w/o tip, reasonable)
Will definitely come here again soon. I really want to try the meals.
author: Nikita K.

description: I came here with my yelp deal, and it was totally worth it. Started out with the Happy hour - $3 draft beers and $3-$4 appetizers. The sushi selection was really good and fresh. I particularly like the sunrise nigiri and Uni, however, they are on the pricey side. I would only be able to return if I had another coupon deal. However for happy hour, I would definitely return.
author: Minette C.

description:
Located in a neighborhood more well known for ho-hum Chinese food, Blue Fin Sushi is a breath of fresh air for the Inner Richmond.  

The menu features numerous salads, hot and cold appetizers, and noodle dishes, as well as nigri and innovative maki (rolls).  Featuring Hawaiian-style spicy white tuna over mixed greens, the Poky (sic) Salad packed plenty of heat.  The B52 Roll, with spicy hamachi, shiso leaf, cucumber, and tobiko, was also a winner.   The hamachi (yellowtail), tobiko (flying fish roe), unagi (barbecued sea eel), and shiro maguro (white tuna) were all super fresh and tasty.  Blue Fin even had live hotate (scallop), which was melt-in-your-mouth good.

With the associated bar, there were many American craft beers, but no Japanese beers, on tap.  The limited sake list could use some additions, but it did offer sufficient selections to complement the food.

The expert sushi chefs are knowledgeable and fun:  be sure to share a glass of sake with them.  The wait staff is top-notch:  friendly, attentive, and fast.  Prices are reasonable (for The City):  sushi for two with plenty of beer and sake came in just under $100.  As a nod to the poor economy, Blue Fin even features a special dollar menu on certain days:  for every $30 you spend,  you can get one item off the dollar menu for $1.

With a cool bar on one side and awesome sushi on the other, Blue Fin has it all.
author: CJ G.

description:
decent sushi. And extra points for delivery! BUT why the F can you choose the delivery time if it is going to come 20 MINUTES early?!!

Today the maguro was quite good. Edadmame was good (but those beans are hard to mess up). We had the B-52 and Romeo & Juliet roll - both are very good. The b52 was VERY spicy - yum!!! Also the scallop on the R&J was delicious. 

I had ordered from here about 2 years ago and it was awful - apparently new  menus mean better sushi.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Honestly, it was the customer service that we got that made this a 4 star review. The ladies who served us tonight were amazing, they immediately brought us water every time our cup was empty, they asked us if we'd like a more spacious table rather than in between two groups and they were very attentive! That's five star service :)

However... the food was pretty disappointing.

What you should pass on:
-California roll should be a basic goodie, instead it was super chewy.
-New York roll seemed like the avocado was hmmm not the freshest...
-Miso soup was just awful...
-Edamame was cold, had no salt on it and just blah
-Volcano roll was decent, definitely not the best hot roll i've ever had

What was good?
-Chicken teriyaki was surprisingly good!
-Kimchi fried rice was amazeballs! A MUST!

Used our Yelp deal ($30 for $60) and had a blast ordering a ton of food. Left a very gracious tip and we were on our way home.
author: Matthew H.

description: I got delivery from here again last Saturday.  I was surprised by how they kept the cold sushi cold and the hot sushi hot.  That was my issue with this place last time.  I've actually eaten inside the restaurant and it is a good place to grab sushi.  A little on the expensive side, but it's worth it!
author: Elena N.

description:
I only went here because there was a living social deal for half off.
Made a reservation at 8, arrived there a little early at 7:30, waitress was bitchy and told me I needed to wait half an hour (despite there being at least 4 open tables and an open sushi bar). I had called ahead and was told by another employee I could sit in the lounge (first come first serve) and still use my living social deal, but the mean waitress shot me down and said no. Eventually I got to sit at the sushi bar.

Sat there for 10 minutes at sushi bar until the same waitress finally came over and asked if I wanted water. Proceeded to wait another 5 minutes for that. When she finally came back I told her I was ready to order and she said, well tell him (the sushi bar chef) yourself. Way to have friendly service... Only after the sushi chef told her he was busy did she take my order. 

Also, never received soy sauce until I asked and waitress never asked us if we needed anything.

Ordered the sashimi combo platter with 18 pieces of sashimi and 49er roll.
Sashimi was decent, but not worth the 29.95 and the 49er roll was definitely not worth the 9.50.  The roll consisted of 6 of the tiniest pieces of sushi with just a smidge of avocado and the tiniest piece of salmon on top and a sliced lemon on each piece.

Was tired of waiting so long just to get the bill so I went up to the front to pay. 
Would not go back again with bitchy service like that. She ruined the whole experience.
author: Anonymous A.

description: Went here a couple time with my coworkers and boss, the service is good. The stuff are a bit pricey but the food are delicious, there is also a bar section in this restrauant. My favorite has to be their Fried rice. The Orange design for dessert is so good!
author: Christopher G.

description:
After almost a year on Yelp (and longer lurking), I'm giving Blue Fin Sushi my virgin review.

What can I say? I want Blue Fin to have my babies. I'm pretty sure they would be delicious.

The bar/lounge is my current favorite haunt. It has style, mood lighting, fun music, flat screen TVs with sports to entertain your date, reasonably-priced and well-made drinks, oh AND SUSHI!

My favorite roll is the Grasshopper. The Volcano is must-try hot and tasty goodness. You can order from the restaurant menu in the bar, or take advantage of their award-winning happy hour munchies and drink deals. The happy hour calamari is delish, as are the garlic fries.

And, if you're feeling extra lazy, you can even order online and have it delivered to your door! Oh how I love thee Blue Fin.
author: Meg W.

description: I never wrote a review nor cared to look at yelp until today; this place made me sign up... and not for a good reason. The food was OK, not bad, but the service was unbelievably poor. I asked for hot house saki and they delivered it without a cup and told me they were cleaning them. I waited 10 minutes till I reasked for a cup. Same story when it came to water; I asked for a refill when they had a chance and close to another 10 mins later had to reask when they asked me how things were. To boot, I was one of four customers in the restaurant on a Tuesday evening. I personally would not recommend this restaurant to a friend. Sad, it is close to home.
author: Brent W.

description:
We purchased a Yelp Deal for Blue Fin Sushi and redeemed it last week.  This was our 1st time there.  Parking on Clement street on a Thursday evening 7pm was a pain.

The wait staff was friendly, dining room was smaller than I imagined.  The crowd that evening was mostly Asian (HK).  The World Series was on all the flat screens bar/restaurant.  

The sushi was fresh, the cooked food was tasty (Cali roll, spider roll, Dragon roll, Spicy Tuna, Curry Katsu, ..).  The only downside, we asked the busboy to wrap-up our unagi dombori - he disappeared for 15mins.
author: Rich W.

description: Great happy hour and fun, laid-back atmosphere.  The bartender was super-friendly and we got great service.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Parking is a pain in the ass.
Over Priced Dishes for small servings. 
But interior is nice.
Unless you have the wallet and the girl is worth it, look else where.
author: Eric C.

description:
This place is pretty chill. The sushi is decent and they give you free edamame while you wait. A decent plate will run you $10+ but then again... that shouldn't be much of a surprise. 

Overall, I was pleasantly surprised with this place. It didn't knock my "socks off" but I'd definitely consider a second visit. 

If you haven't been and are looking for someone to make the call for you, I say "go." I mean how bad could it possibly be? lol...
author: Jimmy B.

description:
2 years later, still giving this place a 5-star. Went here a couple of weeks ago, and a few times in the last 2 years. They've revamped the place, and I still love everything about it.

People keep complaining about the service. I don't know if it's just us, but we always get great service here. The orders come out fast, they check on us to see how everything's going, and they're always very friendly. Maybe it's because we're sort of "regulars" here, but the servers/staff seem to be different everytime we come here so it can't be that reason...

My only complain is that we order too much. But that's not their fault...
author: L O.

description:
Volcano roll is a must! 

If you want you can watch the game at the sports bar next door and eat your sushi there. Service was very friendly but slow. Fish was fresh and good quality. 

This place can get pricy if you order the stuff that are in season and you can shell out $135 for two people.
author: Carol Y.

description:
I love this place especially the Teriyaki Pizza! I love it. One of the best pizzas I have eaten and come here repeatedly just for the pizza.

I'm usually on the bar/lounge side hanging with the lovely bartender Young. She has a great mix of drinks under her belt that my female friends love. I am a Jameson drinker, neat and straight so I can't vouch for the drinks myself but a lot of my female friends are pretty anal about the type of cocktails they drink.

The sushi/sashimi seems to always be fresh along with the oysters they serve on a half shell. I think I have had all of the rolls on the menu and all are good. The oysters are a must. The have this special sauce they put on it. or you can be more adventurous and try the oyster they top with a raw quail egg along with Uni/sea urchin. Definitely love this taste.

Always a pleasure.
author: Marc T.

description: The fish is delicious especially the live scallop.
author: Julie P.

description: Not bad, but not very good.  Had reservations in the restaurant, was seated in the bar. Rainbow roll was served without wasabi. Soup was room temperature.  Too many other sushi restaurants out there to go back.
author: Ted H.

description:
The food that I had at Blue Fin Sushi was dandy and the restaurant is kind of cool looking. My great company and I had the Grasshopper roll and a salmon roll--both were good. We had the crab rangoon for an appetizer, which was fine.

However, there are a few things to be said about the service we received while we dined. I have never been served by waiters that were this awkward as the staff at Blue Fin. The fact that they waited table-side for our order decision to be made is just poor etiquette. Who does that?! We had clearly stated that we were not quite ready to place our order and it was like that statement went in one ear and out the other?! Overall, amateur serving mistakes were being made throughout dinner. It seemed as though they had just opened and were all learning the ropes. The whole staff starred at all the tables the ENTIRE time that you are trying to eat... I appreciate attentiveness, but this was just plain weird. I don't know what we did to be treated the way we were, but Blue Fin Sushi's servers need to snap out of it--geeez!
author: Nichole P.

description:
My visit to Blue Fin Sushi was...awkward. 

I role into a mostly-empty BFS and I'm soon delighted that this place serves complimentary edamame. That's a big plus in my book, so I was in a fantastic mood right off the bat. 

Then I ordered. Then the waiter just stood there. And stood there. And kept looking at me. 

I checked my face for boogers...clean. I checked my fly...zipped up. Given that I don't resemble a celebrity and had not (to my knowledge) committed a giant faux pas, I was confused. 

In the immortal words of Dr. Tobias Funke: Douche chillllllll! (for those of you new to Arrested Development, you can see what I mean here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y1i-Yw7s-Pw) 

The meal (which was good) was completely ruined by the wait staff. I don't know if they're new, if they were all in a bad mood, or what, but they made the dinner unbearable. 

Good sushi, but I won't be back anytime soon.
author: Tom A.

description:
I ate so freaking much...

i would list everything i ate but i'm not even going to bother because we ordered a buttload of food. for an unemployed person, i eat like a king.

what i like about this place is that they have LIVE UNI and LIVE SCALLOP. 
Just ask to make sure if they have it or not. Uni is not my thing (it's an acquired taste that I have not acquired a taste for haha) but if you like it, try it! I had the live scallop tonight and it was good. 

service is good (duh.. one of them is my friend)

PEACH SORBET ICE CREAM FOR DESSERT.

i had 2 orders. =X
author: Susy C.

description:
Having an attentive staff is always ideal, especially when you're super thirsty and you just need your water refilled.  But over attentive can be more annoying then a wait person ignoring you.   That was our experience at Blue Fin.

My friend Karen T. and I purchased a Yelp voucher worth $60.  We made sure we ordered enough food and may have taken longer than normal to pick out dishes.  But two separate waitresses, who obviously did not consult each other, repeatedly asked us, within minutes and sometimes less than 15 secs later, if we were ready to order.  It got so annoying that Karen finally told them we would call them over when we were ready.   

Food was tasty but nothing more than 3 stars.  We got $60.05 worth of food but here's a short list of the good and bad.

The Good:  Sunkiss, yummy shaped like a ball!  Seabeam Tataki, I love lightly seared fish and the jalapeno gave it a kick. 

The BAD:  Spicy Crunchy Maki:  I don't understand how Yelpers actually enjoyed this.  It was mostly fried batter and rice and barely any substance to it.  The fish tasted fishy and we ended up pushing it aside.   

Overall, the decor was nice and it got somewhat busy on a Wednesday evening.  They have a bar/lounge area through a doorway.  Things seemed to be more lively on that side but it could have been the Giants game on.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Ever had a place you wanted to review on yelp but worried that if you did say what you REALLY thought about it, EVERYONE and her mother would start going there and you'd have to start waiting for a table? 

Yeah.  that's Bluefin.  The specials are amazing.  And they always have sports on the flatscreen.  And everything from the Romeo and Juliet Roll to the Seaking to the Spicy Girl are flat out incredible. 

I'll still go to Ebisu for the fresh Uni and the Oysters, but for everyday, mid-week, post-Bikram sushi, it's Bluefin or nothing.
author: Mike V.

description:
Blue Fin, doesn't that sound sexy and delicious to you?! I judged a book by its cover, and I am sure as hell it didn't let me down! Nice fresh sashimi. Very memorable taste.  We blew a $70 bill for 3 people. Wish we didn't come here with an empty stomache haha.

Crazy low parking availability during happy hours tho. Other than that, strongly recommended.
author: Dickson N.

description: This place has Japanese style pizza. Wasabi on pizza? You can get that here!
author: Carlos G.

description:
Just went there last night with my fiancée and it was a pretty good experience. The nice ambiance and the place felt clean and open. The service was pretty good. Not great, but definitely not bad.

The fish itself tasted extremely fresh and tastey, but I feel like the nigri lacked the proper amount of rice to go with it.

We got a couple of rolls as well. I think they were the Dragon roll and the Crunchy Spicy Maki. Both were very good but not mind blowing.

Overall, this is a solid sushi joint that I would definitely go back to again.
author: Brett P.

description:
you know how there are times, where you wished you listened to your friends.  i have a few friends that keeps on coming back here time after time, and they order the same exact item each time. and i never get why. It's weird because i've been going back with them, time after time, but this time, i was sold. the best time to come is during happy hour. if you and your friends order $30.00 with of stuff, you can get some of their appetizers for $1.00.. yes $1.00 which totally beats McD's dollar menu. So we ended up getting the Tempura and Takoyaki. The tempura had eggplant in it! Love it! i dont' know any other places that has eggplant in their tempura dish. The takoyaki was good, i would've had more if i didn't have to watch my cholesterol

Now it came time for the sushi. The Volcano Roll . The description of the sushi didn't sound all interesting to me. "Volcano Roll- Baked Salmon w/ Spicy Cream Sauce, Snow Crab, Avocado & Tobiko " .... lesson number 1) never judge a sushi by its description.  lesson 2) just because you are a "yelper" and your friends aren't, it doesn't mean that their suggestions are wrong.. in other words.. listen to your friends.....i'm not a huge fan of crab... so i figured it was a california roll with salmon with spicy sauce. like how special can this be? .. Answer,, VERY SPECIAL! i guess little words like the word "baked" can give you the idea.. the volcano roll is the best roll i ever had in the WORLD! and the world is pretty big.  the roll was served warm. you might have a hard time getting it off the foil but you better get every single bite off that foil, or you'll end up licking it.  The roll is warm and spicy, but i think it's more on the warm side. ever since i had this roll i've been wanting to go back EVERY week! and the pieces aren't small either.. it's quite big. i love how at the end the meal they will give you little oranges all cut up into little cute pieces. i wish they were open for lunch and i wish they will deliever to places beyond the richmond.
author: Belinda C.

description:
Solid good food. Fish is fresh without being overly expensive. But sushi being sushi is never quite cheap either. 

1. Salmon/tuna tartar. 4/5 really good and pretty. slight crunch form the chip and a pop from the fish eggs. 

2. ankimo. 4/5 I always get ankimo. Could use some more sauce but good portions. 

3. shira maguro toro. 5/5 dude more restaurants need to serve this stuff. Cheaper and just as tasty as o-toro.
author: Ray J.

description:
Parking is bad, what do you expect, you are in SF! 
Second best Susi I aver eat. Food is fresh, awesome presentation, work of art! Pricey! Good for dates to impress with it!
Very slow need to improve on that definitely!
author: Mark Z.

description:
I love their happy hour prices. I have been meeting up with friends on Happy Hour Fridays and they love it too!
The place gets trendier later in the night.  I was delightfully surprised.
An older couple who are regulars at the bar recommended going before 7pm to order 3-4 drinks at happy hour prices, order food from the regular menu and they will pace serving your drinks.
author: MLovely R.

description:
Japanese food!

CLEANLINESS: 4/5
SERVICE: 3/5
FOOD: 3/5
- Pork Yakisoba ($8.95)

The exterior of the place doesn't stand out too much. The interior is really dark and gloomy. Once we were seated, we tried to look at our menus, but it was way to dark to see anything. Some of us had to use our phones to be able to see the words on the menu. After being seated, the waitress didn't come back for a good 10 minutes. We had to flag her down. 

As for the food, I ordered the Pork Yakisoba. It was alright. Nothing too special. It was very similar to Chinese noodles. My friends got this sushi combination platter for $28.00, but it looked fresh. Maybe the sashimi is better at this place. I was disappointed that this place didn't have bentou boxes! 

The waiters were very good at refilling tea and water though. The place played music you would typically hear at a bar or club, which was a little different. I guess they are trying to draw in the younger crowd. Parking is available on the street and shouldn't be too hard to find.
author: Desmond C.

description:
Gotta say -- I think that some of my fellow Yelpers are off about this place... or, maybe it's gotten substantially better (as I have a hard time thinking I'd like a sushi place that my darling fish-loving Nobu would give one star to...)

Went there tonight with my girls Candice D. and Indie for dinner -- had salmon sashimi and escolar sashimi -- was quite tasty.  A little pricey, but worth it for the ambiance... I'd have to say that the bar next door would be a great place for a DYL if any of my friends still did that kind of thing... :)
author: Kate R.

description:
This place is pretty empty at 7PM, maybe 3 other groups besides ours. I assume this place isn't happening until after 9PM.

6 different rolls & an appetizer.

There were 4 of us, so we each picked whatever rolls we wanted, and picked a couple more that we all wanted.

We ordered Albacore Tataki as our appetizer. Since it's tuna, it tasted a lot like tuna, and it melted in my mouth. I never understand what people meant by raw fish melting in your mouth, but now I do.
