On to the rolls...we had...a payroll, volcano roll, iceland roll, dragon roll, raider roll & a philly roll. My favs were the raider roll and volcano, even 
thought everything sort of tasted similar. I could taste Sriracha sauce in the spicy rolls.

My friend also had a strawberry mojito, she said it tasted like they added soju to it.

The guys making the sushi were speaking Canto...so I guess it's not really authentic...

Everything was about $100 incl tax & tip. Everything was good, but I can find cheaper sushi elsewhere.
author: Kylie L.

description: I came here with a living social deal and it was amazing!!!! The Volcano salad was amazing. Also the tuna and hamachi sashimi were fresh, cold, and melted in my mouth.  My favorite thing was by far the albacore tataki. It is worth driving to the Richmond just for this dish!  Also they have a great bar to watch sports!
author: Julie B.

description:
I've heard good things about this place from word of mouth and finally had the time to dine here. Came last night and O-M-G, my meal was delicious! 

Complimentary Edamame began our wonderful dinner. 

We had the: 
Black & White -- Perfectly made little starter. (Cost only $1 if you spend $30 on the entire meal). 
Salmon & Tuna Tartare -- Pretty good. Wished there were more chips to pair with the fish. 

Spicy Crunchy Maki -- Beautiful presentation and yummy. 
Raider Roll -- Big stuffed roll. Also great. 
Caterpillar Roll -- Finally, a restaurant that makes the roll look like an actual caterpiller! 

Also, this place wasn't shady with their napkins. I like to keep my hands clean so always ask for extra napkins. Hate restaurants who hold back on how many they give you. 

Ambiance is enjoyable. Prices are decent. Parking can be a hassle (we were lucky to park in front of the restaurant). 

Keep up the good work...Will definitely come here again.
author: Dee T.

description:
They have a great saltwater aquarium! Love it! Oh, really good sushi too. I would definitely come back here again. 
We ordered a bunch of stuff - Tempura app, Yaki-Udon, and 3 of their House Special Rolls. My wife and I could not finish everything so we took the noodles home and they were just as delicious the next day.
One issue - we ordered a roll with shiso leaf but it was not included in the roll. We mentioned this and got a leaf on the side.
All in all, great experience, wait staff is very friendly and attentive.
author: Adam L.

description: We went here with a friend who goes here pretty often. Compared with Midwestern urban sushi, this sushi was amazing. So fresh, and in novel combinations of ingredients. I especially recommend the 49er roll!, the Hawaiian roll, and the Mexican roll (who knew you could put macadamia nuts or guacamole on sushi rolls??). I also highly recommend the white peach vodkatini and the vegetable tempura. The waitstaff was very attentive  and flexible. Would happily go back!! I know some people have commented that it is overpriced, I thought it was pretty reasonable for sushi (especially if you go at happy hour).
author: Gwen J.

description:
I went here on Christmas evening with my boo and it was as if I had sex in my mouth.

The menu was diverse for a Japanese restaurant, but I'm not complaining! 

Hamachi nigiri was just yummy. I swear I thought I had a dead fish in my mouth! 

You won't be disappointed.
author: Karry D.

description:
So I've never actually STEPPED INTO the establishment, but I've heard good things...

What I DO know is life is complicated enough when you work in a busy ass hospital have no time to eat, (and are sick of a gross cafeteria salad bar) and you want some damn sushi, but you have no time to scope out a restaurant and sit your ass down because you only have a 30 minute break...that I KNOW about.  

I've ordered from here online many times from my old apartment and work when time constraints have been an issue, and they deliver pretty fast, the food is A-OK.  The Crab Rangoon has changed over the years (more filling is not necessarily a great thing, but the dipping sauce is fancy...), the sushi is actually not too bad.  Salmon and tuna tartare appetizer is very good.  I also like the Hawaiian Roll, (tuna, mango, and macadamia nuts), and the Prime Time Maki (salmon, eel, tobiko, and avocado wrapped in soybean paper).  

Still in search of a 5 star sushi spot...
author: Meesh K.

description:
Location: in Richmond district where lots of Asian restaurant located; not easy to find parking
Environmental: there are two dining room: one is standard modern style Japanese restaurant; another room with a bar in it, very American style. 
Ambiance: relaxing and casual
Customers: at least 30% are American and mostly are Asian,who I would say Chinese. 
Services: fairly friendly and attentive but not engage with the customer at all; 3.5 star
Food quality: fairly fresh sashimi and taste good; love the Japanese fusion cuisine a lot^^ especially for its creativity; 4 stars 
Food presentation: mostly are standard and some are good; 3.5 stars 
Price: a bit pricey than the usual ones; i would say about 20% more. We pay $100 for 7 dishes for party of 2. It could be better to have more people to come for sharing the dishes, hopefully it would be cheaper. 

Overall, I would to try other dishes on the menu next time. It is highly recommended to come back at least once. In fact, this is my second time to have dinner there.
author: Charmine L.

description:
The service is great but then again we know half the people working in there so this review might be a bit bias although I will say if our friends weren't working this place would def lack the customer service that most places excel at. While their customer service is half decent they make up for it with their freakin fantastic sushi rolls and would not go any other place.  I have been taken to many sushi places to prove I am wrong about Blue Fin and with every bite wish I was at Blue Fin because it's so much better then whatever sushi I am eating. 

I have been many places in San Francisco looking for a great sushi place so I can feel like a regular but this place is definitely the one spot I can always count on to never be disappointed in great sushi. 

I do hope you all check it out and enjoy it just as much as I have.
author: Niki M.

description: I always get delivery, the food is amazing. I always order new things in their menu and never regret it! the Volcano salad, albacore tataki, Hawaiin roll, first love roll among random things ive tried are soooo delicious!
author: janat s.

description:
I hate phonies.  Which is why I hate USC football...and everything else that comes out of that campus.  I hate liars.  Which is why I revile Chris Daly.  (How is Fairfield living?)  I hate Blue Fin.  Why?  THEY FRIGGIN" LIED!!!!

The food here may be fantastic, but I would not know.  About a week ago, a garish blue menu was hanging on the door to my building.  It was from Blue Fin.  They were advertising the fact that they DELIVERED.  Well, last night I decided to call.  I got home a little late, and my fiance was not feeling well, so I decided to forego cooking and order in.  I did not want anything heavy, so the flyer from Blue Fin was calling to me.  Sushi would be nutrious, but not too filling.  So I called. 

A woman answered the phone.  I immediately said I was calling for delivery.  She asked me for my address, and then said she had to check if they still delivered there.  She then came back and said they changed their delivery area.  WHAT?  WHAT THE HELL???  I asked her why they left delivery menus?  Ms. Einstein on the other end had no clue.  (It was not really her fault, but she was messenger, and I was pissed.)  I asked for the manager.  Manager was not there.  Why does this not surprise.  She asked me if I wanted him to call.  I said "No!  You have already lost my business by being dishonest."  

I will never patronize this place.  Who knows if they will pull the same bait and switch crap with actual food.
author: Chris I.

description:
UPDATED: (Please Read)

Never eat here. I came in a second time and went to wash my hands first thing. When I entered the bathroom the Sushi Chef was peeing in the urinal. As I was washing my hands, I watched him shake his whoopsie and walk out the bathroom without washing his hands, after catching eyes with me as I was washing my hands! Who does that, no less a Chef in front of a Customer?! We caught eyes, and still he was such a gross human being that he went, "Oh well, I'm sure he doesn't mind me touching his raw fish with my penis hands." Absolutely gross. I went back to the table, told my Party immediately, and then told the Waitress that we would not be dining because of what I just saw. The Waitress looked more annoyed with us leaving then apologizing for such a terrible incident. As we walked out, the Waitress went to confront the Chef, who immediately through up his hands like it was no big deal, and that we were overreacting to someone not washing his hands after touching a potential petri dish of STDs, body waste, etc, and not want that on my raw, uncooked food. I will never eat here again. What's worse, the food here was great, until I found out what the special ingredient was. 


Original Review:

Sushi is really good here. The toro is pricey, but comes in large delicious portions that are well worth it. The only reason it is not a 5 star rating is that the service is slow. Not bad, just slow. Our waiter decided to talk, joke, and drink two pints of beer before submitting our order 20 mins later.
author: Michael B.

description:
The food was so amazing - my husband and I got two rolls (Romeo and Juliet and Ice-land) and the sashimi chef's platter. It was soooo good. The fish was fresh, delicious and just the perfect amount of firm and very generous portions. The shiro-maguro and the walu were the stars of the evening, but everything was great.

The rolls were also very good. Usually my husband and I just stick to sashimi or nigiri, but rolls looked so creative. Also everything was very affordable - we walked out completely fit to burst for about half of what it cost us at our usual haunts. The prices weren't any different, but the portions were much larger.

The only downside to the place was the lounge next door. I don't think this would usually be a problem, but OMG the 49's were winning and the people in the lounge were pretty loud. 

Great night, highly recommend.
author: Jen P.

description:
I am torn on how to review Blue Fin.

The sushi is delicious. I highly recommend the black and white roll, but you can't miss with almost anything.

The service sucks. As a girl who hates to see the bottom of her glass, this place falls short.

If you aren't starving upon arrival and you've got a drink in you, try Blue Fin.
author: Liz L.

description: I love this place. The sushi, rolls, pancake,fried rice ,the food is amazing. I always order new things in their menu and never regret it! Also the waiters are super nice and friendly. The price is kind of expensive!!! But I still recommend to go try it!!!
author: Jay C.

description:
whaaaa?? i am seriously surprised with all the negative ratings for this place! i've been craving sushi and sake bombs for awhile and felt like being adventurous, so i found this place on yelp and gave it a try. 

the interior's pretty cool--it's clean, kind of hip and modern without going overboard. there's also a bar area on the side. we arrived at around 9 or 9 30 on a saturday night, and the place was empty. weird. after ordering we realized its because they were closing in an hour, but they were cool about it and didn't rush us at all.

perusing the menu, the prices were actually alright. i'll get to the details a little later, but this was definitely better than most places i've been to in SF. however, i like my rolls with more raw fish than cooked and it seems most of the special rolls are more heavy on the cooked fish and what not.

we picked the mushroom stuffy appetizer, a volcano roll, a spicy tuna roll, and two orders of toro. we also split a large sapporo and a small bottle of their house sake. the mushroom stuffy was AMAZING. shiitake mushroom stuffed with real crab meat and topped with their spicy sauce.. and baked in the oven til it's bubbling over with awesomeness. the volcano roll was also delicious, and i love that they use real crab meat in most of their dishes as opposed to the fake stuff. the toro was melt in your mouth good. 

the house sake is actually pretty smooth, and after dinner i was feeling prettttty good. our bill came out to about $44, which seemed reasonable considering all the stuff we ordered. the service was also prompt and friendly, i can't wait to go again!
author: Angela L.

description: I previously had ordered from Blue Fin because I know the quality is good though pricey and I sometimes crave sushi for lunch while working and most other places don't deliver. Then my friend and I both got Living Social deals that were $15 for $30 of food.  Place never disappoints had it on Monday and then on Thursday. Green House salad was my only complaint was mostly yellow lettuce instead of the green leafy part, dressing was good just need fresher lettuce. Tried a few different rolls wasn't a huge fan of the 49ers roll but the dragon roll, romeo and Juliet and the one with the Soybean paper were amazing.  Will definitely come again more likely with the deals of course as it is a little pricey.  Well worth it though as the fish melts like butter in your mouth.  Also had some Oysters that were on special really tiny but good.
author: Nirea S.

description:
Volcano Roll is so good I wanted to suck the sauce off the foil lining the plate.

 I drive across town for it.

Yum.
author: Pamela W.

description:
My friend and I found Blue Fin Sushi by chance driving by, trying to find parking to head somewhere on Geary.

Best discovery EVER. So good, I rarely eat sushi anywhere but at Blue Fin, and I've brought several other friends there for dinners who have left the restaurant with the same sentiments.

The service is fantastic. The staff are friendly and attentive not overbearing. As soon as you are seated they bring you a dish of edamame and a cup of tea. The menus are well designed, with pictures depicting in compete accuracy what you can expect when you order. 

The food is...well, I'm practically salivating as I write this. Fresh, tasty, well presented. Did I mention fresh? The Miso Scallop appetizer is mouth watering and every bite is scrumptious. The Mushroom Stuffy is also worth a try.

I try each time I go there to try a new roll but some of my personal house special favorites are:

- Iceland Roll
- Rainbow Roll
- Hawaiian Roll

There are also the usual assortment of expected sushi rolls...California (with real crab), Alaska, Spicy Tuna, Philadelphia, Rock & Roll, etc. All of which are well made and tasty, though I prefer the House Specials simply because of their medley of flavors.

Personally I haven't tried any of the entrees but a friend of mine ordered the Salmon Teriyaki and raved about it as she was eating, so I assume their entrees are of equal exceptional quality.

As if the sushi isn't enough - and trust me I've gorged myself on one too many rolls in one setting - ya gotta leave room for dessert. The Lychee Sorbet is sure to delight your palate, but...my very favorite...the Fried Banana with a scoop of green tea ice cream. YUM!

Prices are reasonable. Parking on Clement Street is difficult but rather than waste time looking for a spot, park in the parking lot on 18th between Geary & Clement and walk over. It's relatively (City speaking) cheap and Blue Fin validates.

Happy eating! (Still salivating...)
author: Jen D.

description: great sushi! and the waiter let us order happy hour with only 5 mins left! it was so nice. The atmosphere is nice and the staff there is friendly. would go again but may be other sushi options in the city I would go to first
author: Allison V.

description:
My friend wanted to take my mom and I out to celebrate my birthday. Someone wants to buy me a meal? Well of course I'm going to say, "let's have sushi!" My friend recommends we go to Blue Fin Sushi because they have fresh fish. Well get this, my friend doesn't even eat raw fish. She rarely strays from the usual california roll and spider roll! What the??!? So she pretty much knew nothing about the fish here. I judge a place by it's uni. The uni here was creamy but not very fresh. I had the Sea King which was a roll with avocado, some other stuff, and uni!!! I've never had a specialty maki roll with uni before. I had the uni nigiri with quail egg also. The uni didn't taste sweet, kinda funky but the color was right.

I did enjoy the shiitake stuffed mushroom appetizer. The scallop appetizer was a bit too salty for my taste. The portions were average. We were there on a Saturday night at 7:45 pm and there was no wait for a seat. They also have a bar, so you have the option to eat there. The service in the beginning was kind of weird but after a couple of minutes, it got better. The cocktails were ok.

The bill for three people, which included two cocktails, carafe of cold sake, three appetizers, 3 maki rolls, uni nigiri, came out to $89.00.

I don't think I'll be coming back. Parking is a bitch and the uni wasn't very good. Okay, well maybe I'll come back for the stuffed mushroom app.
author: Tatiana D.

description:
My friends and I went here today, and i must say I WILL DEFINITELY NOT COME BACK HERE AGAIN!

This is base on a Saturday and happy hour review

The place wasn't that crowded (3/5 full) when we arrived however the service wasn't that great. It took a while for the waiters to get to us and we have to flag him down. When we got our plates for appetizer, there was one plate that has left over food in it. It makes me question how they clean their plates or if they reused it after serving it to people. 

The appetizer that we ordered were garlic fries, buffalo wings, calamari, and crab cheese rangoon. And couple of well drinks. 

I must say their garlic fries was cooked in a high temperature where its crunchy on the outside (which burn my tongue) but gets soggy real quick after it cools down. I didn't really taste the garlic on the fries, and I am assuming that they use garlic powder salt because it was really salty and powdery. (not worth $4 dollars) 

Calamari is a big deal to me when drinking. And I must say the taste and the portion sized (1 measuring cup size amount)  they served was such a let down. I even question if it was even a squid that they serve because i don't taste the squid flavor at all. And the portion is very small (1 person can finish it and still be hungry)

The crab cheese rangoon is horrible. I'm like "isn't there suppose to be crab meat  inside this wonton? I understand its happy hour, and atleast put imitation crab but theres just runny cream cheese inside it. And I don't think they use the right wonton wrapper for this one. 

After eating everything else, I didn't even bother eating the buffalo wings. For one thing its 4 pieces and its 4 dollars. that's like $1 dollar per wing... You're not really saving money here... 

I give 1 star on the happy hour drinks because they were okay and decent. It's kinda hard to screw up a drink. 

After the disappointment with the happy hour stuff, I was still willing to try their sushi atleast try to redeem themselves. I tried their Volcano roll, it was mediocre to the very least. Its passable for a sushi. but it was 9.50 per order and its 6 rolls. For that taste and serving size, i would say its only worth 6.50. 

I'm surprise that this place got 3.5 reviews... 
My friends and I walk out of there and we all agreed that were never coming back to this place. We left hungry and disappointed
author: Michelle D.

description:
Went last night with a group of 20, picked Blue Fin because it was one of the very few sushi places around that seemed able to handle a group that size.  All but one of us had great meals, the sushi was good, the teriyaki was good, the drinks were good, I would have given at least 4, maybe 5 stars, except...

One friend's meal hadn't shown up by the time most of us had finished eating, wait staff came back several times to ask what he had ordered (which was the same dish another person had already finished by this time).  His meal finally arrived when everyone else was finishing up their last bites, and the (cooked) fish in it was so spoiled it was inedible.  They brought a fried ice cream to try and make up for it, but the combination of super late meal and spoiled fish at a sushi place was pretty disturbing.

The waitstaff also seemed to be weirdly intent on turning on a TV next to our table (we were in a side room with only our table), with 20 people it was already hard to hear what was going on farther down the table, and they thought we wanted to add more noise?  They had to be prevented from turning it on 3 or 4 times.
author: Robert R.

description: great sushi!  good drinks!  Service? could be way better.
author: Emilia G.

description:
Sexy.. Thatz how I describe the lounge part of the place. Great original art and great lighting  (imma a sucker for ambiance!)

It was great hanging out with the interior designer of the place and being showered wid sushi not on the menu... Amazing stuffs..

Service was great and was definitely a great experience overall.. The sushi was fresh and tasty, and with the right t folks (and alcohol) haha., this place has a dope vibe..

Check out the private VIP room in the back.. Amazing possibilities for the Outer Richmond.. Definite gem..
author: Carlo M.

description:
This place is quite different from other sushi bar's I've been to because the layout and food's pretty different. I love the ambient and loungey appearance of the whole restaurant, it makes me feel like I'm actually at a super upscale restaurant...well maybe it was, but I was perhaps under dressed?

We came here on a whim one night because we knew the restaurant opened and was nearby and offered Kobe beef so we just suddenly agreed to go there and there we were. We ordered a spider roll and got something completely unexpected; they gave us 4 pieces of a super huge spider roll, it was massive yet kind of cool and refreshing because I've never seen such a massive piece of sushi before. Although it was cool, it's not bite-sized but that's alright. We also got an order of raw oysters which seemed to be a pretty good deal. In addition, we tried their two-piece Kobe beef sushi but it wasn't really anything special. People always told me about how great Kobe beef was but this place made it alright; it was super pricey for two itty bitty slices of beef. In addition, we had their sashimi combo and that was it because we didn't really have a budget for the place since we came on a whim. After relooking at the menu, I felt like we've missed out on a lot of other great dishes and hope to come here again in the future.
author: Judy C.

description:
Food: 3 Stars
Service: 4 Stars
Prices : 5 Stars
Lounge: 4 Stars

Not the best sushi in the world, but for the price it was good. The staff is friendly and the lounge is has a pretty cool atmosphere.
author: Luis B.

description:
Come here during happy hour, their bar menu is $3-$4, which is great.

We ended up ordering Wings, Calamari, Garlic Fries, Coronas, all for 3-4 dollars each.

I WAS at a japanese restaurant, so I tried their Romeo and Juliet Roll, and I thought it was really good!

My friend ordered the Char Siu Miso Ramen. After he was done, I wanted to try the soup. I ended up drinking it all because it was really really good.
I can't say anything about the noodles, but the Miso Ramen Broth wasn't too salty and was just perfect for my taste.
author: Eric A.

description:
Standing outside of the front door to Blue Fin Sushi you get a pretty nice view of SF. It looks really nice at night too! The place is small but the decor gives a great tranquil feeling with a giant fish tank! I think I spent more time looking at the fish tank than the menu. 

This is the first sushi place I've been to while exploring SF. The sushi was really nicely plated unlike the places I use to eat at before I moved. 

The sushi was fresh, hand picked every day according to the sushi chef behind the counter. They really go all out on adding extra flare to eat dish too. For example, they deep fried the whole bone section of the salmon and placed it with our salmon sashimi. It was super crispy and flavored with a little spice. 

The Price of it being in San Francisco does reflect some tension in your wallet but if you're going to bring a date somewhere, you better not worry about it!
author: Wilson C.

description:
I'm going straight to the point, the OLD LADY WAITRESS is the MOST ANNOYING waitress i have ever been encountered, she never put in three of our appetizer orders and then ACTED LIKE WE NEVER TOLD HER ABOUT THE ORDERS AND DIDNT KNOW HOW TO MAKE ANY DRINKS THAT WE ORDERED, AND ALWAYS SAID NO TO THE DRINKS OUR GF'S WOULD ORDER BECAUSE SHE DIDNT KNOW HOW TO MAKE THEM, example, mojito. 

If this place wants to have more customers that will return, i recommend it hiring some younger waitresses with more energy that wont forget simple appetizer orders and that actually know how to make drinks.
author: Jett J.

description: Don't let the Tales From The Cryptkeeper bartender scare you away; Blue Fin is a modestly priced sushi place that'll get you good and full.  They don't stray too far away from the CA Roll/Rainbow Roll "safe sushi" zone, but the ambiance is bizarre and interesting enough to warrant multiple visits.  Just don't look the bartender in the eyes, she'll steal your soul.
author: Michael D.

description: It's an ok sushi spot. Sometimes the nigiri and sashimi are quality and cut well, sometimes not. The atmosphere is pretty sports-bar like, but if  you go with a large enough group it's not so bad. The Sake list is so-so, but you can get cocktails here.
author: Maïa Cybelle C.

description: I like this place. Although I haven't been in a while I still have good memories about the food here. Got to go back
author: Moy V.

description: I'm not really a sushi connoisseur,  but it's good enough that we keep coming back.  There's really only one waitress there and she's nice, polite, attentive.  The drinks are a little expensive, but their happy hour is schweet.
author: Trevor T.

description:
I came here with my mom since we've heard good things and decided to give it a go. 

The first thing that my mom didn't like was the extremely dim lighting. It was hard for her to read the menu so I had to read some of the items to her. We just ordered different stuff and shared. 

We ordered: 

- Raw oysters with uni and quail eggs: everything tasted extremely fresh, and even though I don't really like uni, I didn't mind it since all I was focusing on was the oyster! 

- Miso glazed seabass: I usually love chilean seabass, but the way they cut this fish made it dry and when it broke apart in your mouth, it kind of felt like little pellets. The sauce was also very salty. 

- Romeo & Juliet roll: good but waaayyy to much rice. 

- Seaking roll: Ordered it with salmon instead of unagi because my mom doesn't eat unagi. Pretty tasty. 

- I had amaebi nigiri: the amaebi was a little mushy, but I like the fact that they give the fried heads with it and not charging for it. I hate when restaurants charge extra for the fried heads. 

We also had one of their cold house sakes. Don't remember the name, but it was yummy! 

Overall, I don't think I would go back, I've had way better sushi for a cheaper price at other places.
author: Ashley C.

description:
I came here because there were some lovely, lying photos of beautiful uni.  LIES.  They are all lies.  

I ordered the sashimi salad.  Not bad.  Came with some pickled turnip and an artistic "smear" of wasabi.  The vinegarette was nice.

One order of Uni: the smallest, saddest, pathetic-looking order of uni I've ever seen.  It looked like it was so ashamed to be served that it wanted to crawl inside the shriveling nori and die.  Definately NOT worth the $5.95.

$1 hand rolls!  I would have paid exactly one dollar for what I was served.  

The other tables ordered so many jive-ass rolls that their experience made up for our lack of an experience.  There was even one roll that was served in a soup bowl, and drizzled with a million sauce squirts.  I will come here again after I lose my sense of taste.
author: Christina C.

description:
I went to this place because it was listed as having a good happy hour. The worst part of the experience was that the bartender/waiter was a jerk. He treated everybody with disrespect. It was as if he didn't want anybody to order anything because he had to work. It says that well drinks are four dollars but everything that I asked for he said it was not a well drink, it was a cocktail and cost more.

The choices for appetizers were limited. I tried one of everything. The food was okay but subpar for Japanese food.

In general, I would say stay away from this place. The combination of bad service and food in San Francisco? This place should be out of business.
author: Mark L.

description: Ordered $90 worth of sushi togo. Asked the guy over the phone if they have Shiro Maguro Toro and he said YES and then told me my order will be ready in 30mins. When I got there in 35mins they told me to wait another 15mins because it's "busy", really? They consider 1/5 occupancy as BUSY. I can't imagine how long the wait would be if it was packed. Came back in 15mins and my order was 'being packaged' and I had to wait another 10mins. Don't tell customers to pick up their order in 30mins when you can't have it ready in 30mins. Total wait time, 1HR. Then they tell me a customer eating there ordered the last Shiro Maguro Toro, excuse me? They just told me you have it and now they don't, so togo customers aren't customers? On to the sashimi, I have no idea how their "chefs" can even call themselves chefs, more like kids holding a knife cutting fish. My Walu and Saba sashimi was cut into square chunks and were cut too thick, worst of all the Saba still had bones in it. The Unagi still had bones in it. Bones in sushi is completely unacceptable. This place gets a F from me. No wonder business is bad and I'm not surprised by all these "specials" they have hung outside the restaurant, they need it!
author: Panchali S.

description:
I went here with the bf on a Friday. We got here around 930 pm. The place was completely packed. We waited for about 30 min before we were seated. I have never been here before but heard good things about it and I was craving for some sashimi so the bf and I ended up here since we were in the neighborhood. 

First off, the service here sucks BIG TIME! The waitress we had spoke little English and we literally had to repeat EACH order to her about 5 times because she barely spoke English.  When we were almost done with our meal, we where like where is the sashimi?? I mean we came here for just for the sashimi and it's not here! We flagged down t he waitress and she told us, "Oh I forgot to put it in." OMFG! R u serious?? 

We were at the restaurant for almost 2.5 hrs. That is a long dinner for two ppl. Around 1130pm the cooks and the guys that work at the sushi bar all started to drink with some of their friends that came with a bottle of liquor. They were really REALLY loud and to me it just seemed unprofessional.

The food here is good but the service was bad enough for me to not return here. EVER.
author: Cindi Q.

description: The food was good the decor is nice just the waitstaff have a hard time speaking English which made it difficult to plan a surprise for my boyfriend's birthday dinner. Also I recommend going during happy hour
author: Pamela I.

description:
I used to come here often with one of my best friends, who also used to be my neighbor. It was a fun, short walk for the cold, quiet Clement St. And the fun continued inside while warming up with hot sake. We liked sitting at the bar where the sushi chefs were generous with their sake ;)

Our staples: Cherry Blossom, Romeo & Juliet, Ice-land, Volcano Rolls, and Hamachi Sashimi, Albacore Tataki. All were good, fresh and nicely presented. Usually. Off nights seem pretty standard around here, though it never bothered me enough to speak up or stay away. 

More recently, they've hired a new server who's kinda sweet, kinda not, but you know she's trying. She recommended we try the Japanese pizza, and being the risk-taking diners that we are, took her up on her dare and ordered one with unagi, teriyaki sauce and veggies. Not bad, I guess. It'll do for someone who wants pizza at a sushi restaurant. Not I. 

Do try the miso glazed Sea Bass. I'm all over that.
author: Deanna T.

description:
The volcano roll rocked my world with its baked salmon w/ spicy cream sauce, snow crab, avocado, and tobiko on top. It must be completely fattening but the flavor combination was amazing. The Nigiri was really fresh and had a good amount of rice that was perfect. Glad I got that side of  nice sweet sushi rice...

I was stoked to find a good new sushi place that delivers but their delivery dude was pretty clueless and could not communicate well. I could swear he called me from his car to come get it, but I said come to the door so I can buzz you up. I think I told him I was not dressed to come downstairs, he probably thought I was naked, but I just did not want to put my shoes on or have to go greet my raw fish at the curb. Next time I hope I have better service because there definitely will be a next time with this place.
author: Lisa J.

description: Big fan not only 'cause they deliver but the quality is outstanding - usually test drive the Uni to see if the chefs truly take the time for fresh selection and am happy to say that I've rarely been disappointed here - to me the art of sushi stems from being picky about freshness (seems obvious, but often overlooked - kinda like Pho broth) and Blue Fin really takes time to ensure that freshness - from there, we can move into creativity; this is why I cant' give it five stars as the quality is great but lacks some of the over the top kinda creativity you might find a Sushi Puzzle or others - solid place though
author: Richard D.

description: The food was good, service wasn't great. I don't know if it was because we had a Living Social deal, but they put us in the bar corner, basically ignored us and pushed us out the door as soon as the last bite had been eaten.
author: Natalie G.

description: I would go back to this place just cause of the huge menu and lots of different items you don't see every day . Pizza at a sushi place???? errr ok. Had the sushi which was pretty good. Also got the crab rangoon, my presonal favorite...not so good. But i would be willing to go back and try other things.
author: Chuck G.

description:
It's a cute place from the minute you walk in to the minute you are seated. It's loungie, without overdoing it. You can tell some thought went into the decor but it still has that neighborhood feel about it. 

Even if you're not a sushi fan, like my husband, he still managed to find things to eat like beef terriyaki, seaweed salad, miso soup, and crab rangoon (ok, but anything fried and with cream cheese can't be horrible). And there were things he wanted to try but didn't like, the Japanese version of pizza, look at the menu to see, it had the oddest but most intriguing things on there........tempura, and a ton of other non sushi items. 

Sushi wise there were some really creative rolls and they were all delicious and presented nicely. Service was pretty fast and overall it was a good experience.
author: Denise B.

description: The food was actually pretty good, but it was a bit overpriced.  The food was almost not worth the price, but the waitress who was serving us was so friendly it definitely made up for the overly priced mediocre food.  The drinks were a little too watered down for my taste btw.
author: John H.

description:
This place is pretty yummy but not to the 5 stars yummy. Best of all, I love the service. They have absolutely wonderful servers that are really attentive. These servers actually work together to check on all the tables. Thank god it's not one of those places where if I asked for tea, then someone delivers that message to my server for the tea. Nope, not this place! 
If you're looking for a place that doesn't have shady servers, because servers do make a difference in enjoying your meal, then here's the place for you!
author: Sandy T.

description: For around $60, we tried the live scallop sashimi with tempura, amaebi nigiri, saba nigiri, unagi nigiri, blue fin toro nigiri, and a couple other things I can't remember by name. What a deal! The reviews attest to the rolls being fabulous, but we were in heaven even without any rolls. The lychee martini is delicious, too. Service was excellent. Our waiter took the time to describe a few foreign/unusual options to us, telling us about their flavor and texture as best he could and advising us against a couple items in favor of others that turned out to be wonderful choices.
author: Johanna K.

description:
God... all I have to say is VOLCANO ROLL!! I must come here at least once a month for this roll, it is soo irresistible. A little bit hot and it is so delectable and melts in your mouth, absolute sushi heaven. Been coming here for at least a year or so, I can't believe not more people go here. Another good one is the spicy crunchy roll, looooovveeee!

You have to come here, its an outer sunset treasure!!
author: Nikki S.

description:
Came here for my 24th birthday dinner. I love the interior of this place. The tropical fish tank you see, as you walk in and the sushi bar to the back. Its an niceand clean place. I can see a small club event happening here. The bar on the other side is fitted with TV's and lounge seats. One of the bartenders was banging hot!

 The host seated us in the back room. Alot quieter than the main but the table was lower. I found it more comfortable seating my legs crossed.  I ordered the Chirashi $14, Rainbow roll $12, and Green Tea Midori $7.
The Chirashi was filled with all types of raw fish and the rice had little more rice vinegar than i expected but its fine for me especially for the price.
Rainbow roll was BOMB! plus the fact they had avocado with it.
Green Tea Midori.. eh looked nice but tasted to girly sweet. Its looked as if they obtain Slimer from Ghost busters and liquify him and threw hella sugar in it.

I would come back if  im with a group or maybe just want to lounge at the bar. Prices you cant beat either.
author: Brent W.

description:
I'm writing from delivery experience only.

Pricey food. 
Small portions.
Tastes pretty good.
Average delivery time: 1 hr. 

Not the greatest and not the worst either but for those prices, you could be getting much more quality Japanese food elsewhere. Also, the chicken karaage has bones and are very tiny- a pity because I usually love 'em.
author: Julie M.

description: Came here for their drink specials. It was $5 goose shots and $3 coronas on Friday and Saturday. My friends and I got some of their cocktails. I had the Macha Green Tea Mojito. Didn't taste the green tea in it at all. Just tasted like a regular mojito. The place wasn't bad but the waitress was super slow. We kept asking for the check and she forgot and gave it to us after we reminded her. We actually had to get up from our table and go to the bar where she was so that we can pay and leave. I heard this place has good sushi though. Haven't tried it...
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Went again and must say that I really like this place! The rolls are very good and fresh!
author: Angelica V.

description:
It's interesting. I write this review after reading multiple reviews of how OVER attentive the staff was. Perhaps they've been reading yelp and decided to push their service in the other direction, though the way that they've chosen to do it is rather like a pilot realizing that he has flown too high and, in response, crashing his plane into the ground. 

We chose blue Finn, it now appears given the 3.5 star rating, either because it was late (around 10:30), or because I allowed my girlfriend to choose the restaurant that evening. 

Now, blue finn is open until 12am on Saturday night so sayth their menu and website, yet as we entered the young waiter at the door looked at his phone and back up at us as if we were trying to slam a party of ten into the restaurant five minutes to close. Once again, we arrived at 10:30. 

We were reluctantly brought to our table and I got a good look at the restaurant. The decor at blue finn is awesome, very modern and clean, however the cleanliness was offset by the large odorous stain that arrived with my girlfriend menu. I took it upon myself to replace that as the host who brought us to our table played with his iphone and chatted with his apparent friends. We waited a good 10 min to talk to anyone until finally our waitress came to the table. 

Now I didn't expect a TON from a waitress at a place like this but i do expect certain things. Things like, you actually know what the fuck a gin and tonic is. I mean really. How could you work at a restaurant with a full bar and not know what a gin and tonic is? After taking time to explain what a gin and tonic was, which made me feel like i was doing a damn disorono commercial (god i hope someone gets why that's funny) she apparently didn't know what well gin was either and instead, brought me a list of gins written by the bartender, all top shelf. I got tangaray and tonic which came so promptly that it blew past my girl's mojito (a house specialty) which came almost five min later. Why one would bring two drinks ordered at the same time at different times was a bit baffling but by this time i had a new distraction. Namely, the young man who had brought us in smoking directly outside of the restaurant, visible though the window. Now, this was okay with me but I decided to watch to see if he deemed it necessary to wash his hands post-fumeulously, He did not, and instead busied himself setting tables and eventually brought our next drinks. 

In sort, the service here, fast or slow, attentive or lax, is just plain bad. We were one of two tables in the entire restaurant and failure was, most certainly, afoot. 

Food-wise, it's not terrible, and not that great either. I mean it's passable as sushi, the salmon sashimi i got was of good quality and their menu is interesting. I would like to try their folie gras ningiri at some point but not in the near future. All in all, i would pass on this place for sure. There are many a great sushi restaurants in sf and Blue Fin does not number among this group.
author: Logan H.

description:
dont get their chef boat sashimi or chef's choice sashimi. Not everything on there is fresh.  Butter fish def. saved one of their stars.  Service was not bad for a huge party. They were quite quick or it was as fast as they could do it. 

Most of their rolls are just decent.  Appetizers, nothing too memorable.
author: AhLin C.

description: Meh. That's really all I can say about this place. I'm a sushi fanatic so when I go out to fulfill my craving for Japanese food, I really want to make sure it's done right. I got the Chirashi here - the quality of the fish was just ok. Definitely nothing special. This place is also kinda pricey for what it was. If I'm served amazingly fresh fish then I definitely don't mind paying the good money for it. But this place just didn't do it for me. I think I'll stick to the hole-in-the-wall Japanese restaurants from now on.
author: Sara K.

description:
Blue Fin Sushi saved me from the most sour mood and probably even saved me from what easily could have been a horrible chinese new year and valetine's day.

We went in at 8, it was pretty busy, but we were seated immediately. We had the following:

Oysters on Half Shelves w/ uni and quail egg: Holy christ delicious!!
Uni nigiri: Amazingly fresh
Albacore tataki: fantastic, even more fantastic was that it was only    ONE DOLLAR!!! (they have a dollar menu that you can order everytime you hit $30)
ka-Maruyaki:Grilled Whole Squid, pretty darn good
Iceland roll: Spicy Tuna w/ Avocado, Topped w/ Butterfish, Tobiko, oooooooh my god this was mighty good!!!

I've been trying to get in the habit of taking pics of my food whenever I go out. But every time a dish came out, it just looked so amazingly delicious I forgot about my camera and just dove right in and didn't remember about taking pics until we were already halfway in!

And if only our tummies were bigger cause there is so much good stuff to try. This is our second time here and each visit was AWESOME! 

And how is this for going the extra step with already great customer service, at the end of our dinner, they gave me a long stemmed rose for Valetine's Day. I didn't even get flowers from the bf. Thanks Blue Fin! Was a great V-day and chinese new year!
author: Pauline T.

description:
Meh. 

It's alright. 

I ordered delivery for Wednesday night viewing of Lost. It took about an hour to get there so I was relieved we ordered an hour before the show or we would've been SOL. 

I agree with fellow yelpers who have ordered delivery from here that they should separate the hot stuff from the cold/raw stuff to preserve some sort of semblance of freshness when it arrives. 

The rolls were pretty big but it could be because of the amount of rice in them.  It was a rather rice heavy meal and I was stuffed early on and could not finish it.

The agedashi tofu was good and I'd order it again, maybe with another hot item so as to avoid the warm raw fish/lukewarm hot dish debacle.

Maybe if we dined in the place it would have been better, but I'll probably just keep sushi delivery limited to Zaoh as it's been the only Japanese delivery that has not let me down.
author: Jen I.

description: I really liked this place - the service is good, the sushi is good & the pricing is good. I also really enjoyed the Hawaii roll with mango & their salad dressing was very very good.  It is a nice dinner out close to home.
author: Kyla G.

description: We love blue fin sushi!!! The service and food is perfect.  Their special maki rolls are all creative and delicious
author: Liz R.

description:
Came here tonight for dinner with a few friends. Stan m, the guy that is sitting the furthest to my left on my profile pic, lost a bet to me. Wanted to try Warakubune Sushi because Gen Y and Philip W said this is probably one of the better sushi boat restaurants in the city. Unfortunately, after driving all the way to Church st we found out that they were closed tonight. 

So, we drove around looking for either a shabu shabu place or a Japanese restaurant. We came to the intersection of Clement and 20th and we noticed that we had options. There was Minami, this hot pot restaurant and then Blue Fin sushi. Minami was crowded, the hot pot place looked dead, and Blue fin Sushi was just right. Not too crowded but wasn't too dead. 

Yes.........the prices here are a little higher and the portions are a little smaller. Never had a roll that cost 14 dollars and some change. The rice was just a little too mushy for my taste but overall it wasn't too bad. We had white tuna sashimi which was good, the fried chicken which was very flavorful, california roll.......I know why do I always order this, I just like it, Toro which was very fresh, this raw oyster with uni and quail egg.....i didn't have any but my friends said that the ponzu overpowered the uni, and the seafood roll which was an unagi roll with uni on top of it. This dish was actually very decent. We wanted to try the live uni but they didn't have any tonight. 

Service was decent and the food came out nicely. The table next to ours order the unagi fried rice and a bowl of ramen noodles. It looked very good. They have even expanded their menu to include Japanese pizza.
author: jason g.

description:
Um...I have very mixed feelings on this place. It's my friend's cousin's restaurant, but I have to be fair and square. I've been here three times, all with very contrasting experience. 

Excellent vibe if you like a popping place that speaks energy. The first two times I was here, the sushi chefs and waiters were very engaging with me. They even drank with me. I think that's very important at a Japanese restaurant and especially if you're sitting by the bar, you don't want to stare at chefs who does nothing but make sushi. It's also a Japanese culture for the chefs to be engaging.

The food was...well, let's just say they have good days and bad days. Catch them on a good day, then they're good. Catch them on a bad day, well, they're still ok, but I wouldn't go for the sashimi.

The best feature of this place is definitely the lounge right next door. It's owned by the same owner and the restaurant and the lounge is connected. You can get you sushi fix and alcohol fix all in one spot!
author: Tracy W.

description:
I've had a great stretch of great food lately. OK, I just jinxed it.

But Blue Fin is up there with Shimo and Kabuto in the Richmond. It has everything you'd expect a good sushi place to have: fresh fish, manageable, well-crafted rolls and a good view of the sushi chefs. Blue fin tuna (you kind of have to get it, right?) is expensive as always, but is so soft and buttery, you'll be glad you ordered it. I often get boring standbys like rainbow rolls, caterpillar rolls, sake nigiri and a cooked roll here and there to mix things up, but our group of four liked everything that came to the table.

The decor definitely made for an interesting conversation topic; my roommate described it as "euro disco," and it's actually accurate. Salt-water fish tank and blue mood lighting abounds, and I'd add that it feels a hair like old-time Vegas as well with that wacky casino-style carpeting.

I don't often find good dessert options at a sushi resto, but yay: green tea ice cream and fried banana and ice cream.

Fun fact: It's connected to a sports bar next door, so you can (I hear?) eat your sushi in there if you prefer that to euro disco.

FREE DELIVERY! (Or so the giant neon sign outside says).

The RichNOMd never lets me down.
author: Tara R.

description: Used to be pretty good, but the quality of the fish has gone down hill throughout the years. A couple night back I ordered a simple yellow tail sushi roll and I got some bone or cartilage in about four of the pieces, which totally turned me off to the meal. I don't think I will be ordering again.
author: Joel B.

description: Great sushi, slow service. Definitely try the Raider Roll!
author: Andrew L.

description: This is my favorite sushi in SF.  Everything I've ever ordered from them is amazing, and I'm always happy with everything!  I'd eat here every meal of every day if I could.
author: Scarlett C.

description: Monday night random and powerful sushi craving combined with extreme lazy self-indulgence.  Ordered from Blue Fin in large part because they also deliver sake.  Within the time denoted, fresh, delicious, presentation and friendly delivery.  Very pleased.
author: Sallie A.

description:
Wanted some GODDAMN sushi for my birthday this year. Not just any sushi, but some GODDAMN sushi. Know what I mean? Sometimes that Safeway/Trader Joe's stuff just won't cut it. So my friends and I decided on Blue Fin since it was in the City, close to where most of us live, and looked reasonable in terms of pricing.

We had a reservation for about eleven people, and upon entering we realized that our group alone took up a pretty fair amount of space; overall the place isn't that big. Half of Blue Fin is a restaurant while the other half looks like a bar/lounge. Atmosphere-wise it's pretty nice, with dim lights and modern decor.

The menu isn't nearly as expensive as you'd imagine for a place that looks this nice, but some items look questionable - check out that "Sunny Day" Japanese pizza if you get a chance. I ordered a pair of special rolls and an appetizer and it came out to be a little over $20, which isn't bad. Everything was tasty and came in moderately sized portions (including the wasabi/ginger ... DAMN), and by the time I was finished I felt pretty full and satisfied. I think most of my friends felt the same.

Service was quick, and they were pretty patient with us considering we had to wait an extra hour for a few stragglers who couldn't find parking - that's the risk you take on a Friday night on Clement though, right? They even gave us some free edamame while we waited; no tea though, strangely enough. And considering we had so many people, they didn't seem to mind the raucous we made. Sorry!

Given that I haven't been to a whole lot of sushi places in San Francisco (yet), Blue Fin automatically takes a pretty high spot on my growing list. While it's not the kind of place you'd want to go every week due to the moderate prices, it's a place you'll want to visit when there's an occasion that calls for GODDAMN sushi. I'm definitely satisfied with my first visit, and I'll definitely be going again in the near future.
author: Will C.

description:
I think I've found my new fav sushi spot! Their special rolls are innovative, fresh and delish! They even have kobe sushi and fresh uni out of the shell!! The amaebi is also very fresh and they give you the fried head on the side to munch on. Both the romeo and juliet and sea king roll are favs. Its the first time I've seen uni and fresh raw scallops on top of a roll. They also have a special dollar menu on certain days. For every 30 dollars you spend,  you can get one item off the dollar menu. We chose the takoyaki and salmon sashimi. Both delish! Food is excellent, service is great, price is reasonable. Can't wait to go back and try other things on the menu. highly recommended!

*nom nom*
author: Steve H.

description: This place sux......i think the only good roll is the romeo and juliet roll but other than that they have a crappy HH menu and I feel like most of the stuff on the HH menu is frozen food...
author: Diane L.

description:
Typical pseudo sushi in S.F.,
Again, no offense to Non-Japanese sushi chef.
but I just can't go there again.
The menu is anything goes.
if you are the person who does not care about "real", "authentic", and you just don't know what is "standard", go there.
I think its over priced, I think all of  their jive-fat-ass-rolls look just bad as three layered cheese burger from burger king..
you know, you just don't make a soy sauce-mess while you eat sushi.
it just turns me off when I see the soy sauce mess on the table. 
that's another reason why I don't  like to go to those pseudo sushi bar because you'll see more kids and people who don't know how to eat sushi making soy-wasabi-rice-mess all over the table.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Forward Note: This is a review on the bar portion, the right hand side of blue fin sushi. 

This bar is kind of divey, but cleaner than most, and with better food. There is only one bartender, who does his job, but not with the charm that they usually try and sell (kind of refreshing). Tvs all around with various sports programs playing--minus one star for that. 

People at the bar are almost always older men who have some sort of relationship with the bar man, a regulars joint. 

I gave it a high score because it was a family friendly place despite the atmosphere (i saw multiple people there with children). either the kids are starting early or the resturant has managed to not attract scumbags.
author: Amy S.

description:
I've been here many times several of those times for sushi, but I've never eaten in the dining room.  Attached to this restaraunt is a little sports bar with a dozen or so TVs and a good bar.  I usually sit at one of the small tables there and order some sushi along with a drink.  No line.  Informal.  

Their specialty rolls are great and sometimes I crave them.  There regular rolls and nigiri are good.  They also have good burgers and other foodstuffs if you don't eat sushi, but the real joy I get there is on Sunday mornings.

Sunday mornings the bar is open early for all those who like to watch sports and for those wishing to nurse their hangovers.  The bartender whips up this concoction called a "ramos fizz" which is a light citrusy gin fizz that will knock out any hangover faster than you can say "bloody mary".  Their breakfasts are okay but their early lunch menu selections are actually pretty good.  The only down side is they don't serve sushi until the sushi bar opens in the evening.

I've spent many a sunday morning or afternoon here.  It's the only place in the city I've found that makes these concoctions and there is something about the atmosphere I really dig.

I'm definitely a fan of this place so it gets four stars.
author: Theron L.

description: This is for the sushi chef at the bar. Why didn't you let me sit at the bar when it was completey empty and 5 minutes after I sat down at a table, you let other people sit there?  Was it my "appearance"??  Thought I wasn't going to spend?  Maybe if I had your "background" you would of said yes?????  I easily spent 60 not even trying... could of topped over 100 at the sushi bar. I've spent 200 to 300 at other places close to you at the sushi bar with just one other person, depending on the fish.  I could of spent more at my table but your fish sucked.... it was ICY.. no flavor.  Your UNI was very OLD!
author: Demanding T.

description:
This place would get 2 stars from me, because there are TONS of better sushi places in the city, but I am giving it a bonus point because it is the only one who will deliver sushi to my front door. 

I have to say the best thing I could find about this place is that the food arrives fresh and at an appropriate temperature to let you know it wasn't sitting around, pre-made, waiting for the driver.

The sushi itself, as well as the gyosas I ordered, were just okay. Not "make you sick" bad but nothing I would ever go into the restaurant for. In addition, quantity vs. price was ridiculous. 

I will only eat here again if I find, sometime in the future, I am way too lazy to go out and get better sushi. That is, sadly enough, a distinct possibility.

EDIT 3/23/07 - I found another, much better, place that will deliver to me. Sorry Blue Fin...you are now a 2 star establishment!
author: Drue C.

description: Over all the sushi is very good, though too many rolls and not enough really different sushi/sashimi choices.   We go frequently and I am pretty picky about sushi so it must be pretty good. There are after all a lot of other places we could go.
author: ilena f.

description:
Alright, I am a sushi girl at heart and since I just arrived from New York City, I had to compare. The atmosphere is very interesting but not only that, the service was great. I went very early since in Eastern time it's 9 o clock and I was very hungry. The sushi chefs are so nice, and really awesome. The fish was fresh, and I ate so many different kinds that they offer. It's my first time eating fresh wasabi and I really enjoyed it!  

San Francisco over New York anytime. If you haven't been here yet, I think you should really come out and try this place. It's AWESOME (:
author: Fiona L.

description: Good atmosphere, reasonable prices and good service. Sushi was great. Overall really liked it.
author: Chris H.

description:
We came here tonight for dinner with a Yelp coupon that I purchased a few days ago.  I've known about this place for some time but because it's not quite conveniently located in the more commercial area of Clement St., I have not really kept it in mind.  But I will now!!!!

We've had such a great meal!  We had the live scallop that was presented 2 ways: sashimi style and lightly sauteed with green onions and what appeared to be pieces of monkfish liver and squid.  Next, we had a sashimi plate of butterfish, more squid and white tuna toro.  Then we got the "seabeam" (snapper) tataki and finally, the unagi fried rice.  My partner also ordered 2 temaki rolls.  Every item was as good as what we hoped it would be, if not better.  The sashimis were so fresh and generously cut (but be sure to ask for the prices on items marked "MP" so as not to get a sticker shock when your bill arrives).  The tataki was so tasty!  The fish was lightly cooked from the hot oil that was poured over it.  The flavor from the (invisible) garlic and onions just made this dish from an otherwise mild tasting fish stand out.  But, the best dish for us both turned out to be the unagi fried rice.  We both loved the smokiness of the rice, the chunks of eel and the portion size.  I will definitely be back for this dish alone.  

I don't care what others may say, Yelp, you are our friend :-)
author: Yvette F.

description:
I've visited the restaurant enough times and to be honest, it's not my favorite sushi spot in the city.. but definitely my favorite in the Richmond! 

And quite frankly, it's not just their sushi that is fresh and tasty. One of my favorite things on this planet, hands down, is their JAPANESE PIZZA. I bug my boyfriend at least every other week to get one delivered (Osaka Fever plssss) and although he usually says no (not a big fan of foods minus red meat, pshh) I can usually bug my way to getting one from time to time.

Let me just make sure you know, it's soooooooooooooooo goooooooooooood. Yummy yum yum yum. This place has amazing foods all around, plus they deliver?! Gotta love this ish.
author: Tay R.

description:
Sushi in the Outer Richmond is almost as ubiquitous as taquerias in the Mission. Almost.

That said, distinguishing between them is a similar endeavor -- you start looking for slight variations, on the food, the service, the atmosphere. The ones that stand out win the day, while those that blend in and offer standard fare fall off the radar like so much aluminum-foil wrapping on a burrito.

But enough analogies.

Blue Fin is solid. Our server was quirky, and simple things like glasses of water took forever. But she was nice enough, and not bad enough to warrant too much demerit.

The food was flavorful, fresh, and creative, all you can ask for in a sushi place. We had blue fin tuna nigiri and sake nigiri. The sake was fresh and delicious, but the blue fin was to die for. It was perfectly fatty and salty and savory and so so fresh and good. I wanted more, but I have to contain my inner glutton when eating sushi.

We had four rolls between four people: Caterpillar (eel and cucumber, topped w/avocado); Rainbow (standard, with various fish and snow crab); Spicy Crunchy Maki (hamachi, sake, tai, shrimp and onion, lightly deep fried); and Volcano (baked salmon w/spicy cream sauce, snow crab, avocado and tobiko). All were excellent, but I have to say, Volcano and Spicy Crunchy Maki stole the show.

Even the desserts (green tea ice cream and fried bananas with ice cream) are outstanding here.

Decor left me slightly nauseated, but that's okay. I was with good company and didn't look around too much.

Best part of it all was the affordability. All that I've mentioned (and blue fin tuna nigiri was $14) came out to around $25 per person, including tip.
author: Jeff H.

description:
If I could give Blue Fin 4.5 stars I would.  Both times dining there were quite enjoyable.  Tonight I went with a group of eight and service was on the ball (my tea was constantly refilled and was never empty), and (almost all) the food was right on point.  The seaweed salad was nice, though the miso soup was served too hot and was on the bland side.  I love how their rolls are classic yet some are inventive.  The Hawaii roll is a must as well as the Volcano (love the creamy, slightly spicy sauce) -- both are filling and tasty.  I even enjoyed the Rainbow and Spider rolls-- classics that hit the spot.  Their desserts are decent though I wish they used green tea ice cream for the tempura ice cream (that's more standard, no?) and it was a bit too cakey for my taste ( I prefer a bit more crispy tempura batter).  

Go to Blue Fin for the inventive and standard rolls that are always consistently good with no fuss.
author: Marie B.

description:
not for me.  please understand that i am a japonese.  also i am a jasonese from hawaii.  
here's my fusion food story.
i got so mad one day when i sent my old bf to work with some japanese style spaghetti. He came back and told me some older dude saw what he was eating and belittled him by saying that what he was eating was sacrilege to his ancestors.  I Was Pissed!  I used spaghetti noodles and tomatoes, and went japanese from there.  i felt bad that someone felt i was breaking the culinary rules once i decided to use spaghetti and not chow mein.

That story being told, i go into my experiences with blue fin.  Most recently, I ordered a poke salad app, and it was not good.  the flesh was mangled, mealy, and tendony.  they could have used those cuts of fish to make stock.  it was straight up shameful that they expected people to want to chew through that.  
as far as plain raw fish, it was bad.  As poke, it was also bad.  old, cloudy, oniony and fishy.
ah, im sorry blue fin.  i feel bad writing this, but, it was sacrilege!  HA!  
ill try them again, but i will try their cooked and fried foods.
sorry.  Thanks for reading!
author: yayoi s.

description:
By far my favorite sushi place in the city!  I've been going here since I lived in the neighborhood in 2003 and it is still amazing - the freshest fish in the city and the yummiest rolls.  Sitting at the sushi bar is always a great experience too, as the chefs usually share special treats I wouldn't normally order on my own on the house.

I cannot visit this place without having a volcano roll, romeo and juliet roll and the walu sashimi.  I've had pretty close to everything else on the menu and there hasn't been anything I wouldn't order again.  

Most of the complaints I read on here about Blue Fin are about bad delivery...so I wouldn't recommend it - but I don't think you can justly review a sushi place based on the quality of their delivered fish...try it in the restaurant and you will love it.
author: Stacy W.

description:
My regular sushi joint is not this one, but this is the best sushi I've ever tasted in San Francisco. It's one of the few places I've ever been where you can get FRESH wasabi (you have to ask) and not that green paste. Every piece we ordered was delightful, even though some of them didn't sound that appetizing to me. I still don't have the temerity to try the live sea urchin though.

If you sit at the bar next door for very long, the bartender will start feeding you her "do over" drinks. Depending on how many drinks SHE has had, this could be a very good deal for you.
author: Darren M.

description: prices are pretty average. Service was fast and pleasant. The fish tasted okay to me. Definitely a place to go if you're in a pinch. There is a lounge right next door. We had 6 people, it was about $120. They don't take Discover.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Blue Fin is awesome!  I'm reading some of the other shortsighted reviewers slamming Blue Fin for having just OK sushi.  Clearly, Blue Fin isn't a high end sushi joint, but it gets the job done.  My friends and I ordered a few rolls, including the Dragon Roll with eel and shrimp tempura.  It was fantastic.  The temperature was spot on.  The fish wasn't cold, the tempura inside the rolls, fresh and crispy.  Overall the sushi was great.

But what's really awesome at Blue Fin isn't their sushi, it's everything else on their menu.  We also ordered the Salmon Skin Salad, the Baby Lobster Tail, and the Chilean Sea Bass.  In one word--delicious.  The salad was light and flavorful, the lobster tail tender and seasoned to perfection, the sea bass had a nice buttery texture with just the right amount of crisp grilled in.

Blue Fin also offers delivery, a true godsend, so whether you're ordering in or having it delivered, you have options.  If you're in the mood for some fabulous sea food with sushi on the side, or if you've only been here just for sushi, Blue Fin is definitely worth a shot.
author: Tony L.

description:
There are two reasons why I keep coming back here.  #1 is the Walu (butterfish).  I haven't found many other places where I can get fish.  I crave it.  #2 is the Romeo and Juliet roll.  Salmon and avocado topped with scallops and tobiko.  It is the perfect combination of flavors and just melts in your mouth.  

Otherwise Blue Fin is standard.  Their fish is fresh and tasty.  The cuts of nigiri are sized right.  The prices are a little high in comparison to the rest of the sushi places in the Richmond.  The atmosphere is an attempt to be cutting edge with house music, flashy lights, and flat panels. 

Blue Fin is in our Richmond restaurant rotation, especially because they deliver!  But I do think you can get the same quality fish for lower prices just a few blocks down.
author: Zoe H.

description:
Solid three star sushi. Not mind boggling, unless you only rank the miso-seared sea scallops, in which case you've got a strong 4.5.  The fatty tuna sashimi was a little thick and not as melt in your mouth impressive as I've come to desire, however, the food was solidly good and we had a great dinner. We did walk in at 9 pm on a Friday night and get seated immediately, which was bonus.  Not bonus, the bill.  You would think that in a joint so far out of the way, that they would charge slightly less than they do at, oh, say Tokyo A Go Go.  Alas, no.  We walked out paying about $60/person including tax and tip.  

Also, final judge on a sushi place, if the food is GOOD, then someone will be eating the remaining rolls before we walk away from the table and that just did not happen.  Sooo, if you are desperate for some sushi and find a spot in front of Blue Fin, then go for it.  Otherwise, take the time and money to hit your usual.
author: Claire C.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place for quite some time ever since one of my friend's raved about the place. But I was loyal to a few other sushi joints in my neighborhood, so I usually took a pass. Lately, I've just been ordering for "take-away" (as the Brits like to call it) since I'm always impatient when it comes to delivery - except when it comes to pizza (and these guys have it too). Anyway, I found one of their menu's strapped to my door. I usually toss these things since most of the times it's from a really bad Indian restaurant in my 'hood.

So I decided to give it a shot...and then another a week later...and yet another. Yum. I usually go for some sashimi, a roll and a salad. I know, picture of health (seriously, it is). I know when it's good sashimi when it literally MELTS in your mouth. That's the shit right there!

As for take away service, I called them and in about 10 - 15 mins, it's ready. There's a white zone in front that's usually open, if not, roll the dice, put on your flashers and park next to the fire hydrant. I'm usually out in about a minute.

I did eat there a few times as well, and I wasn't disappointed either. The atmosphere is cool and the service seemed pretty efficient - I usually sit at the bar so I'm usually taken care of pretty good.

Oh yeah, the pizza. I did try a slice of the Osaka that some peeps at the next table let me try. It was good, and different. I actually felt like I was in an episode of the original Iron Chef trying this slice (I was actually waiting for some fish flavored ice cream to be served for desert). Would I order the pizza for myself, I doubt it. When I want pizza, I want a traditional pie...maybe from Gaspare's on Geary (but that's in another review of mine). When I'm at Blue Fin, then I want sushi.

Damn, I did a long review. I hate long reviews...I felt like I just blogged. Crap.
author: Ted P.

description: Food was good but it was terribly overpriced. Totally worth the yell coupon but I won't be coming back here without another deal.
author: Christina D.

description:
I have been skeptical about getting sushi from a Sports Bar/Japanese combo restaurant that also serves pizza, but a friend of mine said Blue Fin was really good. 

My bf and I got take-out last night, and we were quite disappointed. 

I think the amount of fish in the rolls was the minimum requirement by law to be called sushi. The ratio of rice to fish was about 4.1 to 0.9.
The pieces of nigiri were quite small as well. The fish was fresh and good, but nothing too special.  The Romeo and Juliet roll had a small dollop of mayo on top which was not in the menu description- IMO- yuck!

The presentation was pretty.  I asked for extra ginger which they totally provided. 

There are many other sushi joints in this city, I do not need to go back here again.
author: Amy J.

description: Came here at about 8:30 on a Saturday night with 3 friends and the place was pretty empty. We ordered a bottle of sake to share, a caterpillar roll, pay-roll, go-roll, seafood ceviche, and ahi tuna salad. The total came out to $76 w/o tip, so $90 altogether. The meal was very meh. The caterpillar and pay rolls came out before the go-roll, which seemed easier to make, but the seafood ceviche was last? Go figure. None of the rolls were particularly good, and the fish tasted old (fresh fish only has a slight hint of the ocean; this fish was really briny, especially the tuna). The ahi tuna salad was over-priced and overdressed with balsamic vinegar. The seafood ceviche was not a ceviche at all, as the seafood was cooked through. The service was also pretty mediocre, as we had to ask to order, and our water cups were left empty until the end of the meal. You can do much better for $90 elsewhere.
author: Danny C.

description:
Is best you speak CANTONESE to the servers to receive prompt & accurate service - better than reiterating 3 times in English trying to order since all their YOUNGERS servers barely understood ANGLAIS...just sayin'!!!

Guess we were lucky arriving around 7:15pm with no reservation and got seated right away. What we ate:

Gyoza - YUM
Ika Maruyaki - grilled seasoned whole squid - YUM & not dry
Raw Oysters - pretty fresh
Salmon & Tuna tartare - MUSHY, BLAND & YUCKY!
4pcs Sake (Salmon), Hamachi (yellowtail) & Shiro Maguro Toro (white Tuna belly) sashimi - all YUMMY
Ice Land roll - not that great especially the butterfish
Romeo & Juliet roll -  only the name sounds great; nothing special

Peach Martini - YUM especially for lightweight like myself that does not like the strong taste of alcohol yet will get you BUZZ & HAPPY - had 3 :)
author: Katy N.

description: Ordered Age-Dashi Tofu, Nama Kaki, Ahi Tuna Salad, Ice-Land roll, Spider roll, 49er roll, Rainbow roll and fried banana w/ice cream. Each and every dish was fresh and so delicious! Staff was extremely attentive and kind. No complaints whatsoever, so will definitely be coming back.
author: Jenny Z.

description: My fiance and I had a fantastic dinner here.  We arrived at about 6:30 on Saturday night and were seated right away.  The waitress was very attentive and refilled our happy hour drinks and let us know when it was about to end.  They had a large selection of special sushi rolls.  The 49'ers roll and Grasshopper roll were both fresh and delicious.   We will definitely be returning for happy hour again.
author: Jen K.

description:
*Disclaimer:  I don't like sushi.  Actually, I don't like seafood.  Yes, I'm a freak, and I'll wait while you get the rope. 


Okay, so I don't like sushi, and the Japanese portion of their menu is mostly sushi.  There are a small number of non-sushi, non-seafood items -- I found their pot stickers to be okay, but I probably won't get them again.  My boyfriend loves sushi and he liked it a lot -- the only real complaint that he had about it was that the portions were quite large and therefore relatively expensive.   

They do have a fairly large American menu as well, and the bar portion of the building place is called Prime Time Grill -- we have not actually eaten inside the restaurant portion, just the bar.  I have not tried their burgers yet though I am intrigued, but their pizza is really good, and their garlic fries are excellent.  

There is a brunch on Sundays from 9a-1p where they serve their American menu as well as some special brunch items.  Don't bother with the brunch food as the hash browns are pre-formed frozen patties a la Ore Ida, and the eggs are cooked in some sort of omelette cooker that causes the outside to get a bit brown/burnt -- if you must have brunch here, go for the Spanish Omelette.  DO go for the drink specials though, especially the Ramos Fizz -- they're great for hangovers yet you still get your buzz on, and the bartender does a great job.  Bloody Marys and Mimosas round out the list of drinks, and you can ask for them for as long as the bar has the makings of them on Sunday.  

Overall, a great place for a really picky eater who hates seafood and her boyfriend to get sloshed.
author: Sus... B.

description:
honestly, there's so many sushi restaurant in the city that's wayyyyyy better than blue fin.  i came here few years ago, the food was "eh watever", and i come back few years later.. its still "eh.. watever."  the sashimi isn't that fresh.  everything is mediocre!  

i give this a 2.5 stars, go somewhere else.... shimo a few blocks down is so much better!
author: Anna W.

description:
I don't particularly fancy myself a masochist, so why I would return to this place a second time after a rather unpleasant experience is beyond even me.  

Food aside (which isn't very good anyways), the service here pretty much stinks.  Both times I've been here, my friends and I have been mistreated.  The first time, we had to wait for a special roll because it needed to be baked.  We asked the waitress and she told us that their lone toaster oven was already occupied by numerous orders of the same thing.  Ok, I'm reasonable, I can take that.  But why is it then that parties who came in after us, and who ordered that same roll, still ended up getting their order before we did?  Well, we decided we'd ask our waitress that same question.  Her response this time, which funnily enough doesn't correlate at all with her previous reply, proceeded to inform us that we had in fact, never placed that order with her.  

To say that this happened again on our second visit to this place begs two questions.  One, why we'd order the same thing again.  And two, why we had even bothered to go back in the first place.  Beats me, but there won't be a third time.
author: Philip W.

description: pretty decent joint. don't know why but I'm always here. one time we went into the kitchen and stole a couple bottles of sake and we thought no one was there so I was exploring the kitchen and I ran into a chinese lady and it was hilarious. good times
author: Edward S.

description:
My gal and I were wandering around the Richmond and decided to have an impromptu pre-birthday dinner.  I had gotten a recommendation for Blue from Rick A. (who, BTW is a highly opinionated sushi connoisseur with excellent taste; when he recommends a place, you pretty much have to go there)

We had the Sake Sashimi, 49ers roll, Hawaii Roll, and a special order (not on the menu) Mango + Avocado roll.   The Hawaii roll in particular was very good, especially if you like Macadamia nuts.  The Sake (both sashimi and atop the 49ers roll) was particularly fresh.   The lady was very impressed with the Mango/Avo roll, saying that it was one of the best she'd had anywhere.
