The atmosphere of the restaurant could have been a bit nicer and the price is a little inflated (even by sushi standards).  That said, we did have a good time and really enjoyed the food.  I'd definitely go back if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Josh L.

description:
This may be the worst sushi I have ever had.  I've never had sushi in San Francisco that I thought wasn't at least ok until now.  Rice was cold and gooey, shrimp from their tempura rolls must have been sitting around for a while.

I went here on a Saturday night at about 8:30pm -- right during prime time dinner hours -- because my cousin was in town and had a sushi craving.  This was the fourth or fifth place we tried because of course during prime-time on a Saturday night, all of the good places had a long wait.  The fact that this place could seat us right away should have been the first clue.

Saturday during dinner hour you would hope that the turnover in the food and presumably the A-team kitchen staff would make the food at its best and freshest.  We had a small assortment of sushi -- New York Roll (shrimp tempura), Kappa Maki, Inari, FutoMaki, and one of their premium rolls with salmon and seaweed salad on top.

The rice was the worst I've had in any sushi restaurant.  It was quite cool and obviously not fresh.  It had no bite to it at all -- in fact it was a little overcooked and gooey and was sitting like a rock in my stomach a few hours later.  The shrimp tempura in the New York roll was heavily breaded, soggy, and cold.  It had obviously been cooked several hours before and had been sitting around, although from the heavy batter I doubt it had ever been very good.  The miso soup and wakame salad were fine, but seriously how hard are those to get wrong?

This place would still have gotten one-star from me but it didn't help that the kitchen also lost most of my order.  With the restaurant half-empty, this place still couldn't figure out that we had received only one of the seven dishes we ordered.  I had to get up from the table and track down a waiter to complain.  But as I said, this place was already a one-star before the service gaffe.  They were polite and apologetic but the damage was done.

This is the only sushi I've ever had that was worse than no sushi at all.  If this place is your only choice, save yourself some time and money and go to bed early hungry.
author: Steve B.

description:
I hate to give just 1 star since it wasn't horrible, but there are so many other sushi places in the bay area that I'll probably never come back here.

First off, we sat by the window which seemed like a good idea until we noticed the horrible smell of urine, but I'm not one to let something like that affect my opinion of the food.

The service was fast and friendly.

We went for the rolls.  Lots of unique rolls on the menu, but everything was too saucy for my taste or had MAYO.  Everything seemed fresh and well made, but just not my style and, in my opinion, not authentic.
author: MS C.

description: I decided to try this place out because they had a great Groupon deal: $30 for $60. It turned out to be a really fun time and the drinks are awesome. I love Lychee martinis and they have a frozen one that is one of the best i've had (and I've had quite a few!). The sushi was up there as sushi goes, the service was good but the price was definitely right.
author: Robyn M.

description:
Went last night,was an awesome time the bar side has a dj,nice ambiance and great beer and cocktail price's ,the apps were great for bar food it's better than most.

The Bartender's can I say HOT there is a tall blonde whos eyes and body are mesmerizing and she is really fun.

And there is this asian one shes just a beauty, a bit forgetful, but very charming you dont mind repeating, Were heading there again tonight,
author: scott r.

description: I did not get any rolls so my review is purely skewed towards the sashimi and service. The sashimi was not the freshest that I've had...not bad fish, just not fresh. Service was nice although they checked on us every half an hour or so, so not the best of service. I probably won't come back again unless Yelp has another deal.
author: My V.

description:
I love this place, i mostly get take out cause they have a great and fast check out system online. 
The sushi is always good, and very inventive. They also have a bar, so that makes the place that much better.
author: margarita g.

description: I would love to tell you about the food...but I never got any. When there one night starving. A waitress walked by and rudely said she'd be right with us. Twenty minutes later hen she still hadn't come over to take our order or even get us drinks we left. I've worked in lots of restaurants before and would understand if it was busy, or if she'd been a bit friendly, but there we about 3 tables full in the whole place and she just seemed to feel like ignoring us. I can't give hem one star because i never got to taste any food...but man, do I want to.
author: Courtney S.

description:
We've eaten here several times for many reasons:
1.Food is really good.  I love sushi and although I am not a "I lived in japan and that makes me an expert of all things fish", I know when the fish is fresh and the sushi is tasty and creative.  Blue Fin is all of the above. 
2. Prices are decent.  There are a lot of choices on the large menu so everyone can be happy here.
3. Free parking.
4. wonderful friendly service.
5. They have a cool fish tank that you can stare at.  I like staring at fish...a little creepy while I am waiting to eat their cousins but I still like staring at fish.
We have always had a good meal here and plan on going back soon.
author: Nilu r.

description: I don't have any complaints about service. My review is for the food....which is BOMB DIGGITY! Their volcano role is A M A Z I N G! Also had the Seared Albacore Tuna. Also....AMAZING! And this is the only place that makes the prefect Lychee Martini.
author: Maria G.

description:
Cute sushi restaurant - I like the salt water aquarium and blue light interior. The sushi here is very fresh and the service was great. It's a quirky little place with TVs in the dining room that shows a slide show of their different sushi and how they made them. 

We had the albacore tataki for appetizer - it's seared white tuna and it melted in my mouth. We tried a couple of the house special rolls that were also very good. The prices are decent - $8.95 - $14.50 for the house special rolls. Their nigiri and maki rolls seem a bit more expensive than other places, but I would stick with the house rolls - there are a lot of different ones to choose from. 

I grabbed a to-go menu on my way out and found out they also have custom-made pizzas as well. A bit strange... stick with the sushi!
author: Gladys C.

description: It is a good place to hang out with guys and gals- for food, for fun! Pretty nice service. A great place for dinner or just chill around with tasty cocktail in your hand!
author: Angela F.

description:
I love this place, especially since it's near my house. I eat here frequently and usually have Angela as my waitress. If you're nice, she'll bring you a tasty cocktail called a Starburst. Oh yeah and the sushi is great too!
I love the spicy tuna roll, ahi tuna salad and the spicy crunchy maki..mmmmm! A large aquarium and wall mural make for great ambiance too!
author: Rebecca R.

description:
You know, I had been here a couple times and thought it was just ok.  Its definitely not my favorite in the city but it has a big menu, its next door to a bar where you can get cocktails and its in my hood.   And it turns out  they deliver, which is actually why I'm Yelping... 

I had gotten a delivery menu on our gate and kept it with our other delivery menus even though I don't like to have sushi delivered.  Well my folks were in town this weekend and long story short we ended up placing an order on Saturday night.  For four of us we ordered about $100 worth of food.  We stuck to mostly rolls since I have a problem with fish being delivered to begin with (but thats what my fam wanted.)  I just don't know about sashimi coming to my door, you know.  But anyway- all the appetizers and rolls- and even a Japanese pizza- came quickly and freshly to my door.  They didn't get the order wrong, they were quick and we all enjoyed the meal.  I would go back but out of convenience.  I would also only have sushi delivered again at my guests request...
author: J L.

description:
this place is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant in sf! and i try a lot of sushi places! blue fin never disappoints.

this is the sf dinner spot for my girlfriends and i. even when i'm back in the bay, i go here for sushi.

last time i was in sf, i took my bf here and we had such a fabulous dinner! i mean, we went all out and ordered soo much delicious food! the freshest fish and my bf loved the butterfish!

my favorite roll here is the mexicano roll, which has guacamole on top and shrimp tempura inside. LOVE IT! 49ers roll is pretty bomb. miso scallops- the shiznit. romeo & juliet is fresh and light.
author: Vanae W.

description:
This is one of my favorite sushi restaurants in the City and here's why:
1. The Hawaii Roll (complete with macadamia nuts) is the best.
2. The Cherry Blossom and Romeo and Juliet rolls are also very fine (along with pretty much all their other specialty rolls in their attractive sprial-bound menu and accompanying snapshots).
3. The Miso Scallops are very tasty. 
4. The blue watery light on the back wall is pretty, as is the aquarium and seashells under the glass floor entranceway.
5. They give free validated parking (the lot is located about two blocks away).

The reason I am giving four stars instead of five:
1. The music is often too loud and always cheesy.
2. They leave the door open between the restaurant and the connecting pub. Why? It's loud.
3. We have had at least one grumpy waitress (but usually the service is good).
4. There is a roll which involves garlic and green onion which was way too garlicy and oniony for our taste.

All in all, great sushi that's a big step up from the standard rolls of most joints around town.
author: A Y.

description: Three sweet waitresses but I had to keep getting up and asking for everything since they rarely ever came near us. Customers next to us were having problems too. Finally got my beverage after three requests. Got sushi (okay) and chicken (rubbery). Staff made no attempt to communicate on a personal level.
author: Mae L.

description: Eclectic decor inside and decent sushi menu, although in no way would I describe it as authentic Japanese sushi.  I also thought prices were too high, although the yelp deal I purchased made the price more palatable
author: John D.

description:
My favorite sushi in San Francisco!  

The sushi chefs here are artistis and the food tastes as good as it looks!

Try the mushroom stuffys (crab stuffed mushrooms with a delicious sauce) or the Spicy Girl (spicy tuna with an avocado and spicy mayo overcoat -- deeeee-lish!).  Whatever you try it's bound to be good...

The atmosphere is a little odd, with a techno soundtrack and a neighboring sports bar that they share a bathroon with, but otherwise, thumbs up!
author: Alex C.

description:
Blue fin is by no means the best sushi in the city, but it is damn good and a great price for the quality. They also deliver!!!! That alone is worthy of 5 stars for a sushi place.

Their specialty rolls are very good and offer some combos I have not seen elsewhere. I love their first love roll with scallop and peach. A sweet and surprising marriage. The prime time maki is also a very tasty treat. And the Hawaiian with mango, macadamia nuts and tuna is also an interesting flavor and tactile experience if you don't mind a little sweet and crunch in your savory.  They also carry the traditional rolls and Japanese food. Their chicken kara-age is particularly yummy for an appetizer. 

They also sell japanese pizzas, of which we only tried once and were not convinced. 

You can order online, and in person, they are always friendly and prompt. I love this place!
author: Aimee B.

description:
I live nearby so although it's unappealing from the outside the food inside is AWESOME!!!!

Actually, I never would have ventured to go inside but we kept getting a delivery menu at my complex so since I love sushi and the pictures we so appetizing I thought I'd try it out.  I haven't regretted it ever since.  It even drew us in enough to actually go to the restaurant although most times I opt to order in.

I've tried almost all of their "special Sushi" rolls and so far they are all awesome.

This really truly is a neighborhood gem.
author: Alyx L.

description:
i came here mainly for their drink specials ($3 coronas and $5 shots of goose) and hang out with some friends, but i cannot coming to a sushi restaurant and NOT try out some food

albacore tataki - ive tried many albacore tatakis from all over the place and this is one of the better ones. it came with a good amount of seared albacore and i liked the ponzu sauce with thinly cut red onions and other little greens

volcano sashimi salad - nothing too special but it was delicious! spring mix topped with what i like to call stringy shrimp chips avocado and cubes of sashimi. good flavor and good combination of textures

49er roll - it was a-okayyyy. a very simple soy wrapped roll with salmon, unagi, and avocado. 

we had a lot of people check up on our table throughout the night to make sure we were going okay and they were all really nice, especially stanley! from what i had, this place has good cold dishes and good drink deals - ill definitely come back and recommend this place to others
author: Katherine C.

description: This place is pretty awesome. I took my Floridian friend here when he visited SF and we both loved it. I had actually bought a yelp or FB deal for this place and the prices were so fair and the portions were so generous that we had a lot of trouble using up the entire voucher value, and we even had drinks with our meal. The customer service was super friendly and fast and the ambiance was good too. The food was sooo fresh and very delicious. I would definately reccommend this place to a friend, it is a little out of the way but if you are ever in the area, please stop by and be prepared to try some new things. Their selection was crazy! Crazy good, that is. NOM!
author: Adrianna H.

description:
OK.  I ordered an order for delivery about 7:15... simple order of about 3 or 4 items.  They said it would be about 45 minutes.  An hour later I call to check on my order and the dude on the phone says it's on it's way.  Great.  I live about a mile away.  Half an hour later I call again and find out that the dude on the phone had no idea what he was talking about and they had no record of my order at all.

HELLO - I just gave you my phone number half an hour ago!  Why didn't you call me back and tell me the order was lost??  OR - you coulda offered me SOMETHING to make up for your shitty service.  Discount maybe?  Free roll??

WHAT THE F!?  
SUCKY MCSUCKERSON!  You guys at Blue Fin need a brush up course on customer service!!

Thanks for nothing Blue Fin!!
author: AIMEE C.

description: I loooooove BluFin.  Literally one of my favorite eat in and take out sushi places in the city.  The menu has a great variety of tasty treats... I definitely recommend getting the grasshopper roll.
author: Alec M.

description:
Pretty good.

Great service. They had $1 soju drinks on the night I went... perfect!

Sushi didn't seem overpriced. Good menu selection.

I like the atmosphere, kinda makes me feel like I'm in Japan (not that I've been)
author: Colleen M.

description: Had the Kimchi fried rice, unagi fried rice, some noodle dish, and 3 rolls.  I thought everything was avg.  Service was good though and and it wasnt too busy.
author: Hugh L.

description: Mmm mmm delicious. Japanese pizza with wasabi and seafood? They serve it. Sushi roll with Hawaiian style spicy white tuna topped with seaweed salad? It's on the menu. There are so many delicious sounding creations on the menu and the service was great. I'll definitely go back.
author: Niffer K.

description: Blue fin is a great neighborhood sushi spot. Fresh sashimi and very different types of rolls. I love a lot of the rolls that we've tried. And I definately will come back. Great sushi is hard to find and blue fin is a great find!
author: Stephanie F.

description:
Been here many times.
follow these rules.
1. the asian waitress that laughs at your jokes will bring you the small  bottle of cold sake in the clear bottle with the black and white label if you ask her nicely.  get one, or two, if you're with a date.
2. order the Romeo and Juliet roll.  get two if you're with a date.
3. ask if they have the butterfish.  if yes, get two orders.  you see where I'm going with this.  (Note: butterfish is known to be troublesome to some people's bellys, but man is it tasty.)
4. tell Paul, hey, thanks man, you rock.
author: Kev M.

description:
I was taken here by a hardcrore Blue Fin Sushi fan, and was not disappointed! we had the: 
-age dashi tofu: nice and crispy on the outside, tender on the inside and in a very flavorful sauce
-volcano roll: baked salmon with their special spicy cream cauce (looked like melting cheddar! haha), snow crab, avocado, and tobiko.. mmMm.. a MUST TRY
-hawaii roll: it had mango, macadamian nuts and tuna on top. i was a little skeptical about this at first but surprisingly the flavors blended together so well and i loved the crunch the nuts gave!
-kappa maki: nothing special but i just always like getting this everywhere 

overall, the rolls were excellent and service was great. the atmosphere is nice and clean, they have an awesome fish tank as you walk in with some cool exotic looking fishes, including this super spikey one and some "nemo" clownfishes! one star off for being a little on the pricey side though.
author: Jennie L.

description:
We saw the review on local  SFO TV and decided to give it a try. Definitely, were impressed by the exotic names of sushi roll and the food arrangements. Ambiance were nice, and music was eclectic. The service was good but could be improved. Definitely a family place, we saw many kid there. 
Make sure you check out the 1$ specials every day. That is a good deal, if you sent more than $10 per person. 
The UNI were fresh from Monterey, Tuna and salmon were fresh and tender as it can be. Strongly recommended.
The Chef tends to be heavy on the Rice portion, so  lots of starch per serving. 
This is a good family style dining place....
author: Bob W.

description:
Hip... Interesting...  Not bad for a guy who put his time in at Ebisu, learned a bunch then opened up his own shop.  I spent way too much time watching the television ubove the bar showing all the wonderful creations they make there at Blue Fin.  Normally I would watch the skill of my sushi chef in front of me preparing unique creations.  There are a lot of fusiuon J-spots out there, this place didn't blow me away.  Eh.  Food was solid, the company was great.  3 of us ate well and the sake never stopped flowing.  The Bill was about $200 and I was hammered and stuffed.  

Best dish:  Off the menu.  Uni 3 ways:  Uni Wrapped with Shiso, Ikura, Ika with a sprinkle of toro.   Followed by Uni/oyster shooter finished with Uni over scallop with a dollup of black caviar on a cucumber round.

I hear they deliver...
author: Scott S.

description: Went there with my boyfriend on a Friday night around 7pm. We were able to be seated within 5 minutes at the sushi bar. The place has a good atmosphere and I was pleased that there was a TV for baseball discreetly in the corner- good to check scores, but still not loud and in your face if you are looking for a nice night out. The rolls were delicious!! We got some complimentary ahi tuna (which was also wonderful!) The servers and sushi chefs were all really friendly, but not pushy. We felt relaxed, taken care of and left satisfied! I would definitely go back!
author: Kristen L.

description:
Blue Fin is thus far my most reliable go-to sushi place for yummy rolls in SF if I have access to a car (validated parking), and that is why I went here on my first day of normalcy after a bout of food/alcohol poisoning where I hadn't eaten much of anything for 3 days. 

This is also a really cute date spot -- even the worst date could be salvaged with the great rolls here, the 2 TVs showing their rolls being prepared (or alternatively, Japanese TV), and a fish tank with the cast from Nemo living in it!

I've been here more than 5 times, and their fish is always fresh and delicately prepared and plated. There is generally no wait most of the time for small groups, and service is really friendly. The prices are pretty reasonable for a sushi place. My favorites are the miso glazed scallops, albacore tataki ($9), mushroom stuffy (with crab) ($6), steamed clams in sake soup --YUM ($9), Romeo and Juliet, Cherry Blossom (all the rolls are around $8-12). 

Yum! Having Blue Fin is seriously a great incentive to recovering from food poisoning even faster.
author: Erica Y.

description: i've been to paul's restaurant back when he first started in Bolboa.  He has never let me down on the creativity and freshness on the items in his menu.  I love the house maki, second favorite is the lobster tail with the salad, and most importantly the butter fish and aji are also on the top of my favorite sashimi..  I've tried many places in the city and honestly i've seen mostly worst than and hardly any better than Blue fin.  I also posted some pictures of a sashimi platter with aji on the cocktail glass, on one occasion I had special ordered the lobster sashimi which was awesome, and lastly the third is UNI which everyone love sushi should always try.
author: John L.

description:
When I'm craving for phenomenal Japanese food, I come to Blue Fin. I've been coming here for over a year.  I'm always greeted by the friendly and well informed staff.  I have brought my foody friends from NYC, LA, Vancouver, Seattle, Japan and Hong Kong. They're always amazed by the quality and selection Blue Fin has to offer.   

Let start with their large selection of Sake and Mixed drinks.  They have a variety of Junmai, nigori, Dai Ginjyo and honjozo .  I prefer the simple bottle of Junmai called Hatsuhana Utatane.  My friends enjoy the Lychee and Mango Martini's.  

Now comes the food;  Live UNi(Sea Urchin) brought to our table with its spines still moving and  Urchin glissading on a bed of Shiso leaf ;  4 orders of lightly seared Waygu(Kobe Beef) nigiri topped with a light splash of ponzu sauce and thinly sliced scallions.  The Smokey aroma from the seared Waygu makes all our mouths water;   Karage(fried chicken) with a squeeze of lemon makes this a signature dish.  

There's more;  Orange clam with fried green apples; Foie gras nigiri wrapped in shiso leaf...so heavenly; Grilled mini Conch served with garlic and butter...so Yummy;   Spicy crunch Maki; Hawaiian Roll, Miso Black Cod, assorted Sushi's, etc etc etc....the list goes on.   

I have no relations or shares in this great restaurant.  I just have a love for food and Blue Fin has it all.   

I can't wait till my next visit.  

PS: What's great is that there's free parking on 19th Ave next to the closed movie theater.

Enjoy
author: Joe L.

description: Nice decor, service and food was good.  Prices are a little high compared with the many sushi/Japanese places in the Richmond and Sunset districts.  Does have a very extensive menu, especially the appetizers.  Lots of unusual combinations for the appetizers that you wouldn't find at other restaurants.  First time I tried a pizza at a Japanese place, it was pretty good.
author: Jimbo Y.

description: I found this to be a reasonably priced and good quality fish spot.  Nice sashimi portions and very fresh with good garnishments; had the yellowtail and tuna.  Also got an order of rainbow rolls and spicy tuna rolls, the latter which were a lot different that the standard I'm used to being much bigger with whole pieces of avocado sticking out and the tuna was sort of orange.  I liked it, in conjunction with the other items in the meal which were more "real" sushi.  Get the $2 Tiger beer if it's on special as it's pretty good.  Good service as not too crowded, though it was around 9.
author: Marc S.

description:
I think restaurants have started taking ordering take out to the next level.  I did my order online and also put in a coupon for a free appetizer, and I think this is really a time saver and just makes things that much easier.  However, for future reference, i'd suggest to let them know to separate the hot foods from the cold when they package it to go.

I ordered the following and it was pretty cheap, about $10 a pop:

- Curry Katsu (again with the curry katsu) over rice
my friend seemed to enjoy it

- Raiders Roll 
smaller than expected, but relatively good

- Scallop over Salmon/Avocado Roll 
i think the scallop was pretty fresh, and the dab of saracha and mayo helped it seem a lot more filling than it looked.  

- COMPLIMENTARY Crab Ratagoon
basically its a crab and cheese stuffed in a fried wonton.  REALLY creamy and good.  can't have too many of these though. 


Overall, the rolls are relatively smaller looking than expected, but they do get creative with what they can make.  And the next time i come back, i'll definitely try out the dine in experience!.  I even used to come here and try the tofu/eel sushi and the chicken karage (WHICH USED TO be sooo good.  i'l have to try it again to make sure next time)
author: Vincent K.

description:
Now I am not a hard person to please. All I ask is that you take my order, give me my food, and just don't be an a** about it. 

I came here with a friend on a Saturday night.  Place was pretty crowded, but we were given a table immediately. The guy who sat us was pretty friendly. The waitress who served us was not.  

After we looked at the menu and figured out what we wanted, we closed it and waited for the waitress to come by.  After 5 minutes...we still didn't see her. By that time I had to make a restroom run.  When I came back, my friend was still not able to flag her down.  So I'm swiveling my head around  like a ping pong match spectator trying to spot her. When I finally saw her, I waved my hand around to get her attention.  She completely ignored us. By this time, we have been sitting down for close to 20 minutes without even being ACKNOWLEDGED by our waitress, and my patience ran thin.  I understand that you might be busy, but the least you can do is come by and tell us you'll be a few minutes. That way we know you actually KNOW we're here.  When I finally see her serving the table behind us I call out " Excuse me!....."  and before I could even finish my sentence she yells out rudely " YES,... I SEE YOU HOLD ON" .

At this point, I am BEYOND angry.  Excuse me? We've been sitting here for 20 minutes and you act like we're BOTHERING you when we want you to take our order? If we weren't so damn hungry at the time we probably would've walked out.

So a couple of minutes later she comes by (no apologies or anything)...and huffily asks us what we want without making any eye contact with us. 


We ordered :

Nama Kaki  (Raw oysters with uni and quail eggs) 15.95
Albacore Tataki   8.50
Volcano Roll  9.50
Spicy Tuna Roll 5.95

Now the food was actually very good, especially the Nama Kaki. The oysters were fresh, and they paired very well with the uni and quail eggs. The volcano roll was delicious too, being actually spicy.

I would have given them more stars just for the food alone, but I just couldn't with the kind of service we received. With so many sushi restaurants in the city, why spend money here when you get treated like crap?
author: Anna C.

description: I came to Blue Fin, for the first time, just a few nights ago with 2 other people. The service was decent and the food was better than I expected. The atmosphere was great. I loved the decor of the restaurant. We ordered the fresh oysters, stuffed mushrooms, volcano rolls, dragon rolls, lady finger rolls and the teriyaki chicken with rice and veggies. Everything was good, but the volcano rolls were my favorite. The prices weren't bad and we were all full. We all agreed that we'd come back and eat there again. Yay!
author: Alisha T.

description: 2 stars. Decent, but kinda over priced. Even with a yelp deal!. Some of the food looks better than it tastes. Chicken terayaki looked like frozen chicken with terayaki sauce on it. The steak had lots of fat. $15 combo plate, geez louise!
author: kevin c.

description: used to love to go here for sushi, but is going down hill, fish is getting not as fresh, but the price is getting higher and higher, worse things is the service is getting bad too.
author: Zac Y.

description:
Blue fin has ummm a different kind of crowd. Picture old, grumpy Richmond locals. You can tell management put effort into the decor but the crowd brings it down to another level. 

Beers are cheap for happy hour but the food is definitely lacking and I swear tainted with MSG. 

Stick to the beer if you do go and say hi to the weird guy at the bar for me!
author: Jasmine M.

description:
It felt a little weird walking into an empty sushi place tonight.  The last time that happened somewhere else, I ended up with a food poison.  Having that very graphic vivid reminder, I was cautious.  My friend assured me that the last time he was at Blue Fin, the place was packed.  

Feeling a little nervous, we opted for two seats at the sushi bar so that we can inspect the raw goods.  Service was great when we were the center of attention.  The sushi chefs were super nice, offering to change the T.V. channel for us so that we can watch the Warriors game.  We also managed to get freebie bite-size appetizers to start our meal.  

The sashmi melted in our mouth.  The rainbow roll was good.  The two salads that we got were also very nice.  As I started to wonder why this place wasn't as packed as it should be, I noticed that they had a lot of take-outs.  Apparently, they deliver too!

Overall, an enjoyable experience.  I am glad that I gave it a try.
author: Shirley F.

description:
I had a great experience here. We originally wanted to go to Minami Sushi, but it is closed on Mondays. So we ordered:

Hamachi Sashimi: fresh
Mushroom Stuffy: shitake with snowcrab, reminds me of dynamite, its very tasty
Rock n Roll: eel with avocado, simple yet delicious
Baby Lobster Tail: kind of small but it has a great dipping sauce
Lady Finger: deep fried roll that's beautifully presented
Salmon and Tuna tartar: served with shrimp chips thats slightly stale, but the tar tar is fresh
Lychee infused sake: it's actually a sake martini, served in a 5 oz martini glass. pretty refreshing, but i thought it was too small.

Great food great experience.
author: Emily T.

description:
i came here about 5 years ago and didn't like the food here at all. i just came back here last week and everything changed. the food is delicious. every $30 you spend, you can pick an appertizer off their happy hour menu for $1. we had 5 people and ordered 3 things off the happy hour menu, oysters, tuna tataki, and salmon sashmi, which were all really good and fresh. the portions are decent too.

on top of that, the hamaci kama is the best i ever had so far and it's pretty big, the volcano roll and crunch roll are to die for, also got the oysters with uni and wasabi...i didn't eat that, but everyone said it was really good, the tuna and salmon tartar was good too, but not enough chips, the steak we asked for a medium rare, but they gave us a medium, but it was flavorful. for dessert got the fried banana and fried ice cream.
author: Karen H.

description: I know a couple of friends who comes here occasionally for sushi. These couple of friends claim that Blue Fin is one of the more "decent" sushi places in S.F.. omg are you kidding me????????????????? are you kidding me? this place for such is mediocre as hell. I don't even need to look at the menu, by looking at the sushi rolls, obviously its owned by a chinese person because every single roll is overpowered with RICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! omg. my 49ers roll was a thin slice of salmon on top and in the middle, it was just a DAB of avocado, the rest was RICE. I was at Sushi Bistro the other day,  and the 49ers roll had 2 chunky pieces of avocado, a good share of salmon and very little rice. That's what sushi rolls are supposed to be. And their prices are seriously about the same!!!!! SCREW BLUE FIN.
author: A L.

description:
too much vinegar in their sushi rice.

curry tasted a little funky.

the Kara-age in it was soggy and bland. 

slow service. 

cute decor though and seems like it would be a fun bar.
author: Marisa R.

description:
Eh, it's alright.

Actual food quality really merits only 2 stars, but I will give it an extra star due to the modern decor and extensive menu (although I think the menu tries to compensate for the lackluster sushi).
author: Sandy Y.

description:
The best sushi that I have found in SF so far! The volcano roll is the most amazing thing ever. The chefs are artistic too, which makes it more fun to eat. The service is attentive but not annoying and good miso soup too.
Good to know: they have a free parking lot nearby. So don't drive in circles.
author: Kyla L.

description:
One of the best sushi places in town. The fish is always fresh and the rolls are yummy. The volcano roll is tasty and super filling, while the lychee martini is great as well.

WARNING *** parking in that area sucks! ****
author: M Z.

description:
wow... first time there.. excellent food .. its hard to find a place combining good food and bar .. 

...also help that I found a $20 voucher for 2 bucks at BucksLive! hahaha
author: Alex Y.

description:
There's a lot of good sushi in the neighborhood, but this is the spot that we keep going back to thanks to the great fish and the great staff.

Some of our favorites on the menu:

Spicy crunchy maki roll:  huge roll fried tempura style with a little hit of spice in the sauce that is drizzled around the plate.  The sauce is key, so make sure you get some on your roll before you eat it.  

Volcano salad:  tasty salad with big hunks of spicy raw tuna and avocado.  We order it without the quail egg because, well, I don't like raw egg yolk in my salad.   Mix it all up before eating so that you get the dressing well distributed throughout the salad.  This is a good healthy counterbalance to the deep fried goodness described above.   

Volcano roll:  baked salmon roll with spicy sauce.  Delish.

***Also, a few notes about the adjacent bar/lounge:

The sports bar that shares the same kitchen and bathrooms as the sushi restaurant was recently revamped into a lounge.  Although the old school Niner jerseys that used to adorn the walls are long gone, thankfully they still show all the games on Sunday on their new flat screens.  Its far from a rowdy sports bar scene like you get at places like Underdogs, but the BBQ pizza, the full bar and the new couch-style chairs make spending 3 hours here on Sundays during football season quite comfy.   And we like comfy when we wake up early on a Sunday to watch a game.
author: Marcela R.

description:
I like this place. Whenever I'm out in this area I always try to convince my husband to take me there.  I like the Sea King roll.. i think.. if you love uni this is place to get an assortment of sushi covered with uni.  Yum.  

If you love oysters, they do this oyster shooter (you can order 1/2 a doz. in a shell.. ) it comes with the egg yolk, sake and other delicious stuff.. I'm craving it right now!!1  I always go back there for the oysters.  

It is quite pricey, so I'd go for a special treat. :)  I love sitting by the fish tank and love that they offer the movie parking lot for their patrons.  I also love how the plasma screens show how some of the menu items are made.  It made me order one of the salads.  Yum! 

Can't wait to go back for the oysters!
author: B. D.

description: The service at this sushi eatery is the only saving grace. The cocktails are too sweet and generic japanese american fusion concoctions. I went for the sushi and i was highly disappointed. The quality was average but the garnishes and flavorings the chefs add to the items are too salty,too sweet, too sour, just too much.
author: Yoon P.

description:
Went here for dinner on a Saturday night.  Decor was nice and kind of hip, not like your typical place in the Richmond.  The music might be a little loud for older guests.  Parking in this neighborhood on a Friday or Saturday night could be hard to find.  

Sat at the sushi bar.  Had some nigiri sushi, rolls, sashimi, the whole grilled squid, and a small bottle of sake.  Everything was quite good.  Sushi was well done and sashimi was quite fresh and large pieces.  Prices were decent.  My only complaint was the sushi chef kept trying to "up-sell" me on something I didn't want.  Kind of annoying and started the meal on the wrong foot.  Otherwise, service was quite good and the waitresses were attentive and not pushy.

The sushi bar is connected to a full-service bar next door.  You can have your dinner in the bar, if you want to eat and watch some sports.  The drinks are good and reasonably priced.
author: Chris C.

description: I am giving Blue Fin Sushi only 3 stars simply because it is inconsistent.  Some of the sushi is just as good as I want it to be (albacore nigiri and rock 'n roll) but other dishes are not good (salmon has been a bit rubbery a few times as was the maguro nigiri).  That being said, overall, in my neighborhood at the moment, its my sushi restaurant of choice.  There is better sushi up the street, but it is twice as expensive.  There is better service down the street, but that sushi bar recently received a mediocre health inspection report and the fish quality has gone down in recent times.  So for now, I will be dining at Blue Fin Sushi.  And when I say dining "at", I mean dining "with", because the other reviews are right, the in-restaurant service is pretty horrible.  But they have take-out and delivery service so, problem solved!  Give it a try.
author: Holly L.

description: I went there for dinner and they definitely deserve credit for their drinks- they were great! As far as food is concerned... They FAILED! We got several dishes including a spicy tuna roll and tar-tar: there is a difference between fish that is not fresh and fish that is already rotting.... The tuna in the dishes was rotting! It smelled like roadkill. the other stuff that did not have tuna in them were so-so but I don't understand why anyone would serve rotting food in their restaurant.
author: Lena T.

description:
LOVE:
1. Stanley!  THE best server EVER!  Excellent!!

Likes:
1. Nama Kaki Special (Half a dozen oysters with uni & quail eggs)
2. Albacore Tataki
3. Oyster shots

So so:
1. Seafood Ceviche
2. Hamachi Kama
3. Spicy Tuna Roll
4. Kappa Maki

Dislike:
1. Parking is huge issue! 45 MINUTES!!  But Stanley's service made it all worth while.
author: the s.

description: The aquarium and transparent floor panels make this an awesome place for kids. The sushi is inventive, tasty, and not outrageously-priced.
author: Wesh W.

description:
Great specialty rolls and large nigiri make this my favorite neighborhood sushi restaurant. The spicy crunchy tuna roll (mentioned by Mia B) is the best I've tried, and it's awesome. Get there early for half-price appetizers, and save room for lightly fried bananas and ice cream. The waitstaff is excellent.
Minus one star for annoying electronic music and the fact that it's a little too pricy to eat at more often.
author: David V.

description:
a very underestimated and obscure item sits comfortably on the menu of this sushi joint...Japanese pizza. 

Probably the only place in the city where you can see some of these toppings on a fluffy crust. 

The chefs who came up with some of these pizza creations are straight up geniuses I tell ya. 

A place you wouldn't expect to have pizza at and be not only widely amused by the flavor profiles, but actually impressed by the pizza as a real good pizza.  

5 stars from Tomas!
author: Tomas V.

description: I ordered online through eat24hours since they came up for my area. They call me 30 mins after I place the order and tell me they don't deliver to my area. WTF! should have called me right when you got the order so I'm not waiting. Now it's nearly 7 pm and I've wasted 30 mins waiting for food when I could have ordered somewhere else for my family.
author: Rein G.

description:
Went there a week ago and finally have recovered the bad experience to be able to give come here and write a subjective review. 

Place is located in a funky block of clement street, located next to a sports bar. Parking is non-existent in this area but if you drive around 10 times you may be able to fine a space. Decor isn't anything special not warm or exciting. Staff is very non-service oriented. 

Pluses: They had a special oyster on the half shell dish w/ quail eggs and uni. It was soo delicious and sexy!!

Negatives: Service was horible!! Had to always get the waiter's attention for everything. At the end of the meal they added the tip. There were only two of us. I asked about it and he said that my date had requested it which he completely LIED as she said she didn't. 

RIPOFF!!  My bill for two was over $140. Of course we had drinks and ordered the most expensive stuff. But I've been to 5 stars restaurants in this town for the same amount. So needed to say , BUYER BEWARE!!
author: H M.

description: I brought my family there to celebrate Father's Day for my dad.  They ran out of room and placed us on the bar side which is very nice and decent looking too. We ordered a lot of food (we especially like their pizza and a duck breast dish), and the check is not too bad for 8 people. They gave us complimentary dishes and paid for our parking. The parking is especially a nice touch because it is super hard to find parking in the area. Great service and good food. We really had a good time.  I also purchased the Yelp deal to Blue Fin, I can't wait to go back there again with my other side of the family! :)
author: Cindy C.

description: This is a decent spot to have some different sushi rolls. They have a full menu and they have really fresh fish! This is a sushi spot owned by Chinese people done correctly. We had the sashimi half order, the maui roll, the mexicana roll, spider roll, and spicy tuna roll. All were good and would probably go back again. Lost of stars due to not checking my reservation in and taking a bit longer than usual to take my order.
author: Gordon L.

description:
While I don't require authenticity in my sushi joints, the place smelled fishy when I entered. Bad sign.

There's a jillion other sushi places to go to in the Richmond if you don't need the fanciest of the fancy and just need something satisfying.
author: Stacy J.

description: Now, I have to admit that I haven't been to the restaurant, I've only had delivery. But, sooooo good! I love the Hawaiian Rolls - tuna, mango and macadamia nuts, so yummy. And the Mexicana Rolls - shrimp tempora, avocado and salsa. That may sound gross to some, but it's great. The raw fish I've had has been very fresh and yummy. I hear their drinks are very good too. I'll have to take my lazy butt in to the restaurant and try them. Great food!
author: Lisa A.

description: Awesome awesome awesome. I love this sushi restaurant - great service, great food, great drinks, great location, great setup... I have no complaints about Blue Fin. Fun for all occasions too. This is a must go if you're looking for a good sushi restaurant - it is a little pricey, but worth every penny.
author: Ashley B.

description:
We tried this place twice and both times thought it was OK. Not great, but will do in a pinch.

The first time, we ordered the unagi pizza, which was good, but the crust was soggy. Not sure if it was supposed to be, but I thought this would have been much better if it was a bit less greasy and on a thinner crust. If you like the BBQ chicken type of pizza (which I usually don't), you should like this. We also ordered the Hawaiian roll, which was also good. I mean, it's definitely not the best sushi (tasted a little frozen), but again, will do in a pinch. 

Based on that previous experience and craving sushi, we ordered the prime time maki, the Maui roll, and the Raider roll tonight. We also got an appitizer of miso scallops. Well, the scallops sure were an appitizer! It was tiny--way too small a dish for the $8.50 it cost. So, 40 buckeroos later and I'm still slightly hungry. The rolls weren't great. They weren't bad and certainly weren't the worst sushi rolls I've ever had, but there are sooooo many better options for sushi, including options that deliver. 

Basically, I doubt we'll be ordering from here again.
author: Amy B.

description: Very good food with fresh fish! Not like other sushi places with normal sushi. A lot of new and different kinds!
author: Hin Fai L.

description:
This place had been recommended to me by my friends, well they're fired.

Their spicy tuna had that godawful mayo that is reserved for mall sushi - YUCK.
Their "real wasabi" is unimpressive.
They couldn't make me a traditional Yamaimo.
Their presentation was good, but I've definately had better.
I will not be back any time soon.
author: Tom S.

description:
We ordered this for our lunch break at work. The delivery didn't take that long, and the ordering process was easy.

The sushi is good, but not worth what they charge for it. I've had better sushi for cheaper. 

Still good, though, if you want some tasty sushi delivered to the comfort of where ever you are! :)
author: Chelsea C.

description:
great raw seafood; they're all fresh. good services, very tentative. overall 5/5! 

nomnomnom. my satisfying tummy!
author: Valerie N.

description:
My star-rating system feels sporadic. Oh well. I had an enjoyable, take that back, amazing birthday dinner here in April. Great service - good food - good drinks. Fun, attentive waitress.

Then I came before my prom in May (don't ask) and the service was just so-so? Perhaps because I was only with two people versus 20. 

That said, I would say it's California-Sushi, not Sushi-Sushi. Everything is fresh and well prepared, and I like that it's attempting to be all modern and cool in the middle of the usual Richmond places. Whether it is or not is questionable, but it gives it a sense of character.

I would come here again for sure, but I would agree with the other reviewers about it being more of a happy-hour place than a regular joint.  Seems like it would be a fun date place though.
author: Kristi D.

description:
We ordered from the delivery menu. It was one of those nights when you've just gotten off a plane and you can't stand the idea of cooking and cleaning up after. We thought the delivery gods were smiling on us because we found Blue Fin Sushi take-out menus on our door. We were mistaken.

I called and, though the young woman on the phone was polite, she was painfully confused by my order (delivery/take-out menu doesn't correspond with the restaurant menu) and kept me on the phone far longer than I would consider reasonable. Never mind. It won't matter, I think, once the sushi gets here and my hunger has been tamed. I hung up and waited for about 45 minutes. Just as promised.

Sushi - mediocre to poor. There was something "off" about the fish. It was NOT fresh. There, I said it. Damn them for sending old fish. No excuse.

Noodles - decent to mediocre. Hot noodle dish arrived cool (what can I expect from something that had to come from a whole three miles away).

We were tired, hungry and eager to try something new. Frankly, it wouldn't have taken much to impress us. But Blue Fin Sushi disappointed on the one level that matters most: freshness. 

Never again!
author: Steve J.

description:
I have never actually visited this restaurant....I recently had it delivered through GrubHub.com, so this pertains just to the delivery and the sushi itself. You'll have to read another review if you want to know about the Happy Hour and the vibe of the venue. 
Although I pride myself in not overspending on takeout during the week for health and financial reasons, there comes the time in every law student's career that he/she is so tired of reading and hunger overwhelms to the point of giving in to the evil cycle of San Francisco takeout. On Tuesday night, after a long stint in the library, I found myself in this category and absolutely craving some good sushi. I have NEVER ordered sushi and had it delivered, but being that I didn't feel like moving, I figured I could find a place that would deliver some sushi. It is SF after all.  Being that I am relatively new to the area, I relied on some yelp and some other online reviews which led me to this place. 
I placed the order on GrubHub.Com and I immediately received an e-mail confirming the delivery time. The delivery ended up arrived about 35 minutes late, which I wasn't too pleased with. But this place is not a skip, hop, or a jump from my house, so how mad can I be? Also, due to the nature of raw fish I was a little concerned what the uncooked sushi concoction could do to my colon after 35+ minutes without refrigeration. 
All of the sushi I ordered was very well prepared in terms of presentation and the taste was great. I would highly recommend the Romeo and Juliet roll which consists of salmon and avocado wrapped in soybean paper and topped with fresh scallops. If you like a little kick in your sushi, but not over the top alarm spice, this is a great specialty roll. The spicy tuna and Rock and Roll - Roll were both delicious. I also ordered the sunomono which is a cucumber salad with a side of light vineager dressing. Although I usually gobble up salads at sushi spots, this one was a little sogged out as if they had cut the cucumber the day before. I am a pretty heavy eater, and these 4 items were more than enough for two meals for myself, but I always like to try out a bunch of different rolls. It was a little on the pricey side, but for the quality and the convenience of having it delivered ($20 delivery minimum and no delivery fee FYI!) it was worth it at that point in my day. Don't skimp when it comes to sushi and generally you will find you mind, body, and bathroom will be better off for it. I would definitely try it out if you have some time to wait for the delivery and you have a few extra dollars to kick down on some great sushi. I am sure I will order from here again.
author: Cody S.

description: I come to Blue fin once and a while and its always decent. I met Paul the owner many years ago when he had a small spot on balboa st. They have a decent assortment of fresh sashimi  and I love it when they have blue fin toro. On the bar side of things if your a dude you have a cute Korean bartender who makes stiff drinks and can take you down playing dices :( dam you Young!!!!!!! I like it here come visit and try for yourself
author: Dennis K.

description: My husband and I have been going to see Paul and Blue Fin Sushi for years now. Paul has turned this little Inner Richmond gem into a real treasure. The fish is always fresh. The place is comfortable and inviting. Paul is always there to say a friendly hello (he has never failed in coming over to give us a warm hello when we come in!). And now there's even a fun little bar attached that is also pretty fun. I'm sad by all the negative reviews recently! We've tried sushi all over the city, but keep coming back to Paul (whether at Blue Fin or through the online delivery). I think the food is reasonably priced and yummy every single time. Go and enjoy!
author: Sarah M.

description:
My dad's in town and he wanted to eat sushi....so where do we go?  Blue Fin.   Why?  I dunno, it's good, has parking, and it's by bros' favorite place to go for sushi.  That's why.  ahaha
We started out with a couple of the happy hour apps and they were only $1 i think?   It was a little confusing because I think it's $1 per app per $30 spent or something like that.  whatever.  so then we got a sashimi platter, dragon roll, spicy tuna roll, the uni served on the shell, chicken karaage, oysters, soft shell crab roll, tempura roll, and a couple others.  Everything was pretty good and the sashimi was especially ono-licious!  Soft and buttery!  
They do have a bar thats connected to the restaurant, but the waiters dont seem to know too much about the inventory and they had to go back and forth a couple of times to get some things answered.  
Overall, this is a nice spot for some good sushi that wont break the bank!
author: Greg C.

description: Went back recently, had the Karage Curry Rice - I have a problem with cooks leaving bay leaves in sauces, also the chicken pieces were a bit over fried and not moist..  The rices was also a bit on the try side too.  The sushi rolls that we ordered (Payroll, First Love roll and Raider Roll) was a bit bland and nothing to write home about.
author: Jerry W.

description: Amazing rolls, a lovely cocktail menu, and all in an ambiance that makes you feel like you're under the sea (without being '70s tacky, you know?).  Being that it's in the Outer Richmond, it does feel like it's a bit BFE, but it's worth the trip.  I will absolutely be coming back.
author: shojua p.

description: Haven't eaten here yet, but we did spend some quality time at the adjoining bar.  Very friendly service, comfortable atmosphere - rounded off a fun evening with friends on a high note.  We were shocked when we got our bill.  It was cheap!  $4 average for beers and wine.  Cockails for $8.  Where else can you get that in the city???  Our friends tell us the food is good too - so I'm anxious to try.
author: Denise M.

description: They have $1 happy hour specials here.  Order $30 worth of food and get a full dish for a $1.  E-mazing.  The sushi here is decent.  This place uses a  little too much rice but the sushi itself is not bad.  The albacore tataki was awesome for $1.  The skinny cow ordered a sea lion roll.  I never knew you could eat a raw sea lion.  Cows only know land animoes.  But she actually wanted the sea king roll.  I think thats the best roll you can get.  Who doesn't like sushi topped with a heaping pile of baby turd called uni?  I bet skinny cows would bathe in it.  I should go find out.  ;)  I would def go back for $1 happy hour.
author: Fatty A.

description: If you're looking for decent sushi, smothered in sauces- look no further. Blue Fin has a good selection, but their quality of fish is not all that great. Their drink menu is unique & the green tea mojito is quite tasty. The delivery service is hit or miss.
author: Kate S.

description: We didn't have any food but me and my gang of kookaburras drank beers until 2 at the bar and the good lookin bartender girls were pouring us shots of some white sake of some sort. We talked to a regular at the bar who said he was a gynecologist and proceeded to get really trashed before going out to his car to drive four blocks home.
author: lazslo t.

description: Been here a few times when I lived in the neighborhood and bought some groupons. Both times we got the waitresses drunk by taking sake bombs with us. Love this place
author: Eric W.

description: Fresh clean fast good service and yummy!
author: Star Z.

description: this sushi is better then any sushi in the bay area........Bruce can cut some mean salmon.....BLUFIN SUSHI absolutely rocks..........they have great service for wheelchair bound patrons
author: Dennis B.

description: Purchased a GroupOn for a good excuse to try a new Sushi place. Went on a Saterday and was told I could not use the GroupOn on a Saterday. My fault I should have read the coupon. Another couple seated next to us made the same mistake. To be fair it was Our fault not the Restaurant's. Ordered squid to start and specifically told the server to start with it. However the sushi came out first. They were good about canceling the squid. Rocknroll, spicy tuna, and alaska role. Right away I could tell the tuna was not fresh. The color while it was not grey, was less then pink, and no way even red as fresh tuna should be. The flavors just kinda blended together and tasted the same. non fresh fish will do that. I won't be back even with the groupon.  This town is full of good sushi places, and littered with bad ones.  While I would not consider blue fin a bad one, it is slightly less than mediocre and most certainly not a good one.
author: david b.

description: Meh. I would not recommend this place. The rolls were average to not good. Service was ok but not great. We didn't have water refills for a good 15min. In a city with places like sushi b there's no need to try these mediocre places all over Clement and Geary.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I WENT TO THIS PLACE WITH WILL C. HE IS STUPID.

Same thing he said, but with two differences:

- DJ playing awesome music (Amplive, Santigold, etc etc.).
- Hot asian bartender in blue dress. Sooooo pretty.

Alright enough with my pervertedness.

I would give this place 5 stars (mainly for the two things mentioned above) but I was kind of disappointed with my beef teriyaki.  It was good, just too much fat and not enough actual beef. So -1 star for that.  My una-tem roll was great though.

I recommend this place though for special gatherings, the ambience/ambiance(?), and the SUSHI.
author: J C.

description: The perfect sushi place. Cozy enough for a date night or a night out with co-workers. From outside you wouldn't know how spacious it is or how talented their chefs are. I only get to go here about 1-2 times a month but when I do I love to try everything. We start with the duck (amazing) that served with this sweet dipping sauce and sliced thin. Then we pick a few rolls and take our sake bombs. The fish tank is beautiful and inspired me to expand my fish collection. The service is excellent everytime we go. There aren't enought stars on yelp to show my live for this restaurant so I'll just keep going back.
author: Reuben B.

description: This place is my favorite spot in the city. They have good friendly staff and excellent sushi. They make the best volcano roll and 49ers role! Love them!
author: Tatyana R.

description: Bomb(dot)com, but too far from central SF for the price. I used a Yelp deal and the $30 we spent to eat $60 of sushi was well worth it. However, without the deal, it would be hard to rationalize a trip back. Would be 4 stars if it were not on the other side of the equator.
author: Lianna T.

description: eating in is generally better than delivery. love the dark classy atmosphere. there is a bar. its one of those upscale sushi restaurants that focuses as much on appearance as the food. i Definitely recommend the MISO GLAZED SEABASS and the LAMB CHOPS. omg the lamb chops...the meat melts in your mouth like butter it is so tender. im exaggerating of course, but you get the picture. definitely try those two dishes!! I've been here many times and will go back whenever i feel the urge to splurge and treat myself :]
author: Vicky T.

description:
The food here is great presentation and taste-wise.

We always order the Spicy Crunchy Maki Roll, Caterpillar Roll, Sukiyaki and some sashimi.  I also love the Volcano Roll, Takoyaki and the albacore tuna salad dish as well.  There are other dishes I like also but the ones I've mentioned are our faves.

Word of advice:  Do not sit in the backroom on the bar side.  I've gotten terrible service both times I've sat there, and had I not eaten there before and had good service, I would have truly not wanted to return.  I think it's a case of out of sight, out of mind - they forget that you're there or something, not to mention the seating is arranged so that you have to hunch over to eat back there.
author: Stephanie N.

description: The food is tasty, the stuff if friendly, and the management is GREAT. I went there a few times and a random person came up to me a few times to ask how everything was, next thing I know, its the owner of the place. this place is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
author: Dmitry O.

description: the baked salmon roll is to die for, drinks are cheap at happy hour, fun vibe!
author: Jill G.

description:
i love  this place, amazing sushi rolls, the" Volcano roll" to be exact.
great customer service, & they have a bar inside as well that i haven't yet gone to but will definitely have to check out!
author: Briana B.

description:
Not a bad place to get sushi, I like the ambiance in the place.  When we went here, it was completely empty, so the service was great :)

Overall the rolls were fresh and tasty, nothing more you can ask for.
author: B F.

description: I just got delivery from them last night and was totally disappointed. Every cut of fish was just... bad. Everything seemed really cold and gummy. Blah. I hope this was just a fluke.
author: Suzi G.

description: Delicious and fresh options.  Enjoyed very large rolls and separated my hot items from cold when delivering.  (However I requested it)  Fast delivery and I am out at the beach.  Wasn't missing anything, which is a common problem with take out these days.
author: Sasha S.

description: I eat a lot of sushi, and this is some of the best I've ever had. I've only been once, but I had an appitzer of crab wrapped in ahi. It was good, but not particularly memorable. For dinner I had a Romeo & Juliette roll w/ scallops and sirachi sauce. It was probably the best roll I've ever had. It was amazing. I dream about it. I can't wait to go back!
author: Roseanne W.

description: Even if you don't live in the neighborhood, this is still worth the trip.  The food was delicious and a total bargain!  Service was very good, the diversity of the menu made us try foods beyond sushi, and atmosphere was comfortable for groups.
author: Len W.

description:
I don't know what some are smoking to give it less than 4 stars! I know the ambience has alot to be desired. I do not like the TV screens showing how they make their sushi, or the catchy tune when the free parking ad comes on! But hey! There rolls are fierce! The romeo and juliet is to die for :) I LOVE IT. They have the freshest scallops around AND Walu! You never see Walu and it melts in your mouth. I drive over from Marin for this sushi. Very Very fresh fish, and nice service. They have Sushi Ran beat and the prices are just so reasonable! Parking can be a bit of a problem, but they will give you 2 free hours parking in a lot 2 blocks away! The only reason I do not give it five stars is that it lacks ambience. If they only turned the dang TVS off and played Jazz all would be good :)
UPDATE 3/21/07  OMG WHAT HAPPENED? I leave this place for a while and it falls apart? I had to take 2 stars away! The mushroom stuffy was almost not edible, and my romeo and juliet roll had a teeny tiny amount of scallop on it, where it used to swim on top, and it was not fresh either. I am hugely dissapointed and will not be back. I have no clue as to why it has turned out so crummy. This bums me :(
author: Christine E.

description: this place is ok, the sushi is is sure not fresh tho, i don't think they get quality seafood, and for that quality, it's overpriced. if your here with a bunch of friends i guess it's a perfect spot but you could get a better quality sushi for the same price or even less at elsewhere. good thing i had a coupon when i went here, i don't think i would like to come back here unless someone else is paying for me. service here is o-k, i didn't have any trouble with the servers but they could have been more attentive. if your looking for good sushi, don't go here.
author: Toni Rose M.

description: Decent sushi delivery for Richmondites. And they have pizza, too. Not that I've tried the latter, but you gotta admit it's a fantasy combo.
author: Patrick G.

description: My friends and I have been going here for about a year.  We have never been dissapointed.  The food is great, the service is fast and very attentive.  I don't eat fish, and they have some of the best vegetarian rolls I've ever had.  Must try it!!!!
author: Courtney W.

description: I ordered delivery sushi tonight and was greatly disappointed. The avocado in one of their special rolls was ROCK HARD. Disgusting. I do not recommend this place. I wish I had the balls to call them and tell them how terrible their sushi is and get a refund. :-(
author: Bunnie R.

description: First of all, I would like to say that I am not a picky eater. Also, i signed up for this site SOLEY to warn people about this restaurant.  2 of the 5 dishes we order had to be regurgitated from my mouth into the napkin and into a nearbye bowl of pickled stuff when the napkin filled.  Never have I done this before but it seemed as if the sushi was "spiced up" with even grosser sushi, perhaps from the floor or even yesterdays scraps.  I hate bashing, but I would never return here even for free sushi served by real sumo wrestlers.  Maybe it was a bad day, definately will not take a chance as I feel like throwing up still 3 hours later.
author: josh h.

description: I just revisited this place on recent date. The fish was incredibly fresh. The rolls where large. The saba was amazing. Probably the best I have had in awhile. Good Sake selection. Friendly service. foie gras on the menu and best of all I order the hamachi kama. ohhh so good.
author: Jennifer S.

description: I used to be a koo loyal but this place was oh nom nom enough to make me mix up the rotation. The fish was fresh, the prices were reasonable (for sushi), and the rolls were very creative. I can see how the atmosphere could be seen as "phony" but who cares! Head in on a sunday for a quiet dinner an enjoy.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: There is a spicy roll there that is really delicious - some magic sauce they use.  Of course it's pricey but the place is cool looking.  I've been there a few times and have never been overly impressed.  I think it's kind of hit or miss depending on when you go and who's working the sushi bar.
author: A H.

description: One star because they answered the phone promptly and delivered the goods when they said they would.  That's about all I can give them.  When I bit into the Spice Tuna Roll I gagged and spit it out.  How do you mess up a Spicy Tuna Roll?  I thought I had bit into a can of tunafish that had been left out on the counter open and a cat had eaten and regurgitated back into the can.
author: Brian H.

description: Chill place for a casual saturday night ! Gotta give props to the service, very friendly and really showed that they care! We got the nasu appetizer (if you like eggplant then definitely order this) with miso paste sans the fish flakes and was delcious!!! Also ordered the vegetarian dragon roll and it was amazing (if ur vegetarian be sure to ask for it without the eel sauce) the other rolls (first love roll)., washed down with a sapporo and it was a great meal.  All in all a very relaxing  atmosphere and friendly service- (David  our server was very accomodating and really friendly). Check this place out if your in the neighborhood! :)
author: sue c.

description: Can't give much opinion on the food since I've only had the edamame all this time but I've seen wha other patrons order and it seems pretty decent! I like this place for the loungey relaxed feel of the place! It's great for hanging out and chilling or watching sports games and their panel of TVs
author: Topazskye L.

description:
I come here often with my mum. Its a great place for fresh fish. 

Live scallop
doesn't get much fresher. They make 6 little nigiri pieces and add flying fish eggs. They also deep fry the tendonous portion of the meat with a bit of vegetable and batter (as often done with ama ebi heads)

Sea King Roll. This is a nice roll that is topped with uni.

Blue fin toro
Break the bank! For four (chunky) pieces, we paid $22. But, if you haven't had blue fin tuna toro, its a treat!

Butterfish nigri
This is a nice tasting fish. Its got a lot of flavor without being fishy like mackerel
author: J C.

description: Great service, nice decor, only gripe I have with this place is the price, top dollar for average sushi.
author: Raf Z.

description: For you sushi lovers.....here is a great lil hangout where they have really good sashimi and specialty sushi's...for starters everyone should try the "black and white" which is a combo or eel and tofu wrapped in seaweed n deep fried...they also have fresh uni which comes in the spiny uni shell....very nice presentation...if you like spicy u should try their volcano roll...it has a very good spicy mayo..then for dessert, you have to get their fugi apple sorbet and their fried ice cream...they also have these really pretty oyster shots with chili sauce and tobiko and mountain potato...jya mada...(until later) ps...another inside scoop, they used to be the owners of ibiza..
author: Mee-stique K.

description: My first time going to Blue Fin, I drive by a lot.  Decided to try Blue Fin with some friends.  Seating wasn't too long of a wait for dinner.  The place is nice and clean.  My friends kids loved the huge fish tank, with Nemo's.   They have tons of staff on hand and they try to make sure we were taken care of even.  Everything was great but the menu is quite expensive.  I have had better Sushi better and for this price I would have expected more.  The live Uni brought to are table was live and was still moving on our table.  It was worth a try and thanks for the great service Blue Fin, but I think the it is too pricey.  The Rolls were good size, but the rice was too slushy and didn't taste that great.  Overall I was really disappointed of the quality of the sushi and what they charge.
author: Ronald L.

description: I don't know what to say about the food... theres been days when I went and the food is VERY GOOD and there was days where the Food wasn't that good... but they have a nice sized bar right next door and a few parking spots available right in front of the restaurant for their customers. This is a good place to eat and drink
author: Dao C.

description: I like the set-up of Blue Fin. Good use of space. I ordered a couple of rolls, which were decent. Not sure if I'd go back however...
author: Ruth R.

description: The food is great! They have great dishes & fish that most sushi bars dont have.  The main sushi chef is so creative.... the sushi dishes are a piece of art.  This a great place for real serious sushi lovers!
author: super b.

description: Service is good.....Food is delicious too. Variety to choose from. Specials are fabulous too. Some items are a bit pricey (Foie Gras sushi) but yummy. Hope that they'll have the $1 daily special again. In general, everything is good. I'll go there occasionally for sure.
author: Winnie H.

description: I always ate in the bar next door, to watch sports on the big screen.  Decent sushi.  I remember liking the scallop roll.  The pizza is crap, tasted like Pizza Hut.  Good place to go to watch the game.
author: Derrick V.

description: They have interesting rolls, as well as you're standard spicy tuna, shrimp tempura, ect. Their sashimi is pretty good, fresh and reasonable. We ordered delivery, which took about 15-20 from when we placed our order on the phone. We may try the online ordering next time, since we did end up getting 2 orders of the same roll when we ordered by phone. That way there is pretty minimal margin for error. Oh! They have fresh wasabi - look under their sides - this is SOOOO much better then wasabi paste.
author: Valerie O.

description: First time visiting. Great food. Great prices. Great service. Will return.  Had to wait a little extra time for a dish cause the got busy and they brought us a free desert.  We didn't even notice the extra wait.
author: Ross W.

description: This place is real hot and cold.  You can sometimes get yamakake, sometimes you can't.  Sometimes the chef will make requests, sometimes not.  The live uni was terriffic, but the rest of the sushi is nothing special.
author: James D.

description: Walked in right before closing and had a good experience tonight.  Had the First Love roll with peach and scallop and tobiko.  Sweet and luscious.  Aso had  salmon skin salad, which was very tasty with mixed fresh greens, smoky, spicy salmon skin and some of the best tangy vinegar I've had.  Almost wish the salmon skin was crispier, but it was the first salmon skin salad I've ever had so can't compare.  Also had a half dozen oysters that were $1 with our $30 purchase.  Fresh but don't compare to east coast oysters, but then we're not on the east coast.  Service was fine and speedy.  My companion complained his nigiri was a bit chewy and may have been too cold, but did seem fresh.  Will probably go back and give this place another try soon.
author: Lauren J.

description: for the first time going here.........it was not bad. better than i expected but a bit on the pricy side. had the lady fnger roll and the unematu roll. both were good. my friend had the uni...she didn't like it.....but she did like her other roll, romeo and juliet!
author: Stella J.

description:
I've never actually eaten in the proper sushi restaurant side of Blue Fin, just in the sports-bar connected to it.  The sushi they serve is absolutely delicious and I could eat 10 servings of the monkfish liver.  With the full bar, and the baseball games on the TVs, I am one satisfied customer. 

Also, if you know someone crazy and foolish who doesn't like sushi they can eat from a different menu that includes burgers, pizza, fries, etc.  

My only complaint is that the prices are steep.
author: Archie C.

description:
Had dinner with friends here.  We shared:
Volcano Roll
Rainbow Roll
Seeking Roll
Iceland Roll
Cherry blossom Roll

All were fresh and fantastically good!!!

It was not crowded at all, but we were wondering why they did not have tuna and uni at 7pm on a Monday evening.  The good thing was that we were informed "they were on the way" and ended up with all the items we ordered.  And they offered the option of substituting of alternate ingredients if we agreed.
author: Antonio E.

description: delicious food, great customer service and it was a party for my friend that was leaving. im definitely coming back again.
author: Linda A.

description: First off, I love sushi!  I try to eat it as much as possible.  I was pumped when i came home one day to find one of their menus rubber-banded to my front door knob!!  I love their inventive rolls and super fresh sashimi/nigiri.  Normally, I wouldn't even think of ordering anything but cooked, veggie or tempura rolls from a delivery sushi place.  But with Blue Fin Sushi you'll be stoked on it!
author: Chard M.

description: I ate here for the first time with two non-picky eater friends, and we had a blast sampling the sushi menu and trying our luck.  The rolls are a inventive and fun, and everything is beautifully presented, if perhaps a smidge fussy.  But the fish!  Fresh and totally enjoyable with nice variety and without crazy prices.  I'm a sashimi girl, and I love the thin, delicate slices and great wasabi.
author: Martha S.

description: The Grasshopper Roll was delicious!  Their Japanese-style pizza was good too (we had the Wasabi Seafood).
author: Grace Kaori S.

description:
The food here is actually pretty good if you ever get it.  We were seated and ordered before another table but they got their food first.  We ask about our food and they say it's coming.  The key to getting your food in a timely manner is knowing the people who work there.  We saw the waitresses playing with the kids at the other table.  While they had a table full of food.  We had a clear table for 10-15 minutes before the next dish came out.  I'm talking about 8 people being served 4 orders of Uni and then the dishes are cleared and waiting 15 minutes for ONE sashimi combo to arrive. When we asked again about our food and why the other table got all their food already.  The waitress came over with an attitude and lied to us and told us that they were seated first.  When the 8 of us walked into the restaurant, the restaurant was empty because it was only 6:30pm.  There was one other table of 2 dining.  How are you going to not serve us properly and then LIE to us about why our food has not arrived yet.  After inquiring 3 times, our food came out one after another while the restaurant was busy.  Does that make any sense to you?

Food - 4 stars
Delayed Food Service - 2 stars
Service with attitude and lies - ZERO stars
Price - not cheap for that kind of service

Thank you for reminding me why I do not dine here anymore.
author: Julie W.

description: Wow..... really good sushi that you get to enjoy at a not that trashy dive bar while drinking a Thai beer. Pretty amazing find. I had the Mexicano Roll and the Prime Time roll. Both were excellent. The bill didnt do too much damage either. I will definitely go here again. If you are looking for affordable fresh good sushi, I highly recommend. My friends who are regulars say the best days to go are Wednesdays or Thursdays because they get their fresh fish deliveries in on Tuesdays and Wednesdays (just to pass along some insider information).
author: Nicole L.

description: Absolutely delicious!  The sake (as in salmon) was like butter...soft and yummy.  The sake (as in liquid) was almost too easy to drink and complimented the fish beautifully.  The service was super friendly.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Dawn G.

description: I am very concened with your customer service overall . First the order for the delivery was not to my expectations. But i also added the point that when you have something delivered it is just medicore. But when  your sushi is mixed in with your warm or should i say lukewarm entrees. THe freshness of any fish will falter. I am not sure what you guys are thinking when you do your deliveries. This is definitley not pizza that is all wet and sweaty but it is still ok cuz pizza is pizza. But Sushi????? WTF
author: jacqueline c.

description: This review is for the bar, not the restaurant. Decent prices on drinks, friendly bartenders and great service.
author: Ramon H.

description: This is my favorite overall 'sushi bar' in the area - the chefs and service are great, menu is neverending, and there's plenty of choices in terms of beer and cocktails (I'd recommend beer though, as the cocktails are a little kooky).
author: John H.

description: Innovative sushi rolls and a lot other cooked seafood to choose from. A gem in the upper clement neighborhood, worth the drive away from downtown to check it out.
author: Angela H.

description: I love Blue Fin, its small, and right next door to a sports bar!!! It is so hip, considering its in a small neighborhood place. Kind of pricey but so worth it. They have the most creative sushi's, appetizers, etc!!! The fish is always fresh, and they have plasma TV's hanging everywhere with photo's of their menu, so you know exactly what looks like when you are ordering it. Parking sucks!!!
author: yana Z.

description:
i came here for my birthday a couple of years ago. i really like their unique rolls. the menu has pictures of their rolls so you can get a better idea of what you're gonna get. i remember their dynamite roll was really good.
