the waiters were really nice. when they found out it was my b day they brought out a tempura ice cream w/ a candle in it. so sweet! and the tempura ice cream was great!

it's kinda weird that this place is joined w/ prime time pizza though.
author: Douglas F.

description:
As I walked into the restaurant, you can tell it's tastefully designed.  There was a glass see-through floor which shows a feeling of a beach type theme.  The walls were designed with waves.  We were immediately greeted and seated.   The waitress was extremely patient and helpful since this was our 1st time here.  

So many choices.  (Not for me, I'm not a sushi fan).  I just ordered the usual Nabeyaki Udon which was filled with flavorful broth and a lot of chicken.  We also ordered the Tampachi Sashimi and Rock'N Roll.  The fish was FRESH (Only told!). 

Good food...definitely come again when have another chance.
author: Gary Y.

description: What a great sushi place! I tried it for the very first time tonight and the entire dinner was amazing. I love the fact that they serve tea to start the evening :) It was great that they had a 'picture book' for their sushi selections. Try their Spicy Crunchy Maki Roll & the Volcano - amazing!!! I will need to head back to this place, its decently priced and the sushi is awesome!!
author: Jackie D.

description: This place changed my perception of how delicious sushi can be. I don't even know where to begin. Maybe that this is the first time I've ever seen fresh wasabi, or that they offer kobe beef nigiri, or the seafood pizzas. . . this place is amazing. As for the complaint about the uni, your crazy i tried the fresh uni last night and it was amazing. the chef/owner even came out with a squirt of lemon to show us how fresh it really was (and yes it looked just like the picture). We also had some grilled squid, salmon w/ oyster shooters, as well as foie gras nigiri. The bar has a nice lounge feel to it and was remolded very nicely. This place is a sushi gem in the richmond. hands down best sushi i've ever had. i would recommend trying the specials of the day or having one of the knowledgeable chefs prepare something special for you.
author: Zachary L.

description: Nice atmosphere, nice people and good food!  I hope people will support this neighborhood restaurant!!!
author: Debbie F.

description: Their sushi is pretty good, not as good as Shimo but still good!  The only reason that I am giving them 5 stars is because they deliver!!!  There is no place in the Richmond that delivers sushi.  At least I haven't found any.  Their crunchy maki roll is my favorite.  If you try this place also try their mushroom stuffy appetizer.  It is delicious!  Over all I like this place, but for GREAT sushi...just walk a few more blocks to Shimo on Clement and 25th.
author: Samantha R.

description: I've gone here with my bro 2-3 times and each time was good.  It can be a little pricier than avg sushi places but the food is really good here.  Some of the best sashimi I've had (I usually eat at the "cheapo" places..not those famous places in SF).  Appetizers, ramen, udon, sushi...all good.  Service here has been fantastic every time too.
author: Gilbert C.

description: Though the location may not be the best, the restaurant has really nice interior. We had a birthday party there, and everything we ordered tasted great, was beautifully arranged and serviced. Definitely would eat again here if I'm in the neighbourhood.
author: Andre V.

description: Fresh sushi with a wide variety!!! I sort of know the owner and He and his wife are really nice. He wanted to serve high end and fresh sushi which he does! You'll really love the food for it's high quality. I'm a very picky eater. The price is high but it is worth it.  It's next door to a sports bar which he owns too, so go afterwards and have some more fun!!! That place is great also. Parking is not easy , but if your patient enough youll find it. Worth it!
author: Leon C.

description: I love this place! They have great sushi. Everything is really fresh and the ingredients are all high quality. Atmosphere is nice for the richmond and the service is good.
author: Nicole L.

description: Wonderful food! Loved suchi: yammi and beautifully presented. I also ordered Salmon teriyaki: fish was fresh, steamed carrots and broccoli were good. My husband ordered shorb ribs, they were not bad, just little bit chewey and raw. Overall very good experience. Service was great as well. Some Yelpers gave slow servcie reviews, but in our case, the service was great, courtious and fast. Will definately come back!
author: Nozima T.

description: My Favorite sushi bar in town!  Its a hidden treasure.
author: David G.

description: I've been dying to come to this place since like forever especially since i live in the area. the ambiance is very modern and chilled. they have a beautiful salt water tank when you walk in. I had the romeo and juliet roll and uni. i felt incomplete after that and it didn't make me want more. definitely disappointed and didn't know what's all the hype about.  the prices are definitely pricey.
author: Lynn P.

description:
Blue fin has fresh and good sushi.  They got toro and butterfish sashimi which few places do.  

Parking is hard but they do give you free validated parking at the old Alexandria movie theater.  and they have RAMEN which is always always a plus.
author: kenny l.

description:
cute spot with some interesting one-offs.

this is the place where i first had needlefish.
author: Ameer N.

description: Loved it. Everything was simply great from service to food I could not have imagined a more perfect evening with my girlfriends :)
author: Mashylya r.

description: I enjoy every visit to the BF. Bartenders are attentive and make excellent drinks.  The food is very good, especially the sushi.
author: william m.

description: I really wanted to like the food at Blue Fin. I ordered the 49er roll and was disappointed by the minimal amount of salmon since it was extremely thinly sliced. There was also so much rice that anything else in the roll was almost indistinguishable. I was craving udon and ordered the nabeyaki udon. Disappointment again. The broth was flavorless and the chicken was chewy and seemed old. With so many other great restaurant options, I will not be returning.
author: Lindsey S.

description: It's shocking to me that people could give this place a 5-star rating! Perhaps I was there on an off-night but the food was entry level, the ginger was hard like when you pick up sushi in a plastic container at the grocery store and the ambiance?...there wasn't any! I did sit on the other side of the building where there is a bar but that still shouldn't have made a difference in terms of food quality. Finally, the food took quite a long time and I only ordered 2 rolls and a piece of sashimi. May go back to have a beer at the bar and that's only because it's 2 blocks from my house and they have sports on t.v. - good for Monday night football.
author: Gabriel R.

description: Overpriced chinese run joint that thinks you pronounce it SHOOSHEE.  WTF?  This is a place for people that dine with their eyes and not with their tongue...  The tuna tataki appetizer is my only recommendation. Go during happy hour for half off, otherwise not worth it.
author: Eric X.

description: Great service.  Nice Decor.  Happy people.  Aside from that, the sushi is average at best.  The rice was too soggy.  I was not able to finish the sushi due to the soggy rice, so my boyfriend had to take it home.  He left it in the refrigerator overnight, only to have the rice still be soggy.  The rice ruined it for me.
author: Carrie-C N.

description: The food was fab! The owner put a lot of effort in the dishes! They are very unqiue and good-tasting!! highly recommended!!
author: miako s.

description:
This place is alright.  I have been to better sushi restaurants but the fact that they deliver and the fact that if you go they have free parking in a nearby lot is pretty great!
The food is nothing to write home about.  The salads have way too much dressing on then.  I mean "can I have a little salad with my dressing, ummm... thanks."
For what you get, it seemed really overpriced and i felt the sashimi could have been more fresh.  Call me picky, sorry, but I have had better.
author: L M K M.

description: Never eaten in, but this place is my favorite for delivery. Mostly because it always comes super fast, and its always fresh and delicious and I LOVE the 49'er roll. Simple, lemony, salmon. Yum.
author: J J.

description: Without question the worst sushi I've ever had.  Rice was gummy and disgusting - and there was too much of it.  Sashimi was flavorless.  Tempura rolls were excessively dry and limp.  Unimaginably foul.  AVOID!
author: Chris P.

description:
I don't really know what to make of this place. I don't love it - although certain items on the menu show really flashes of talented deliciousness from the chef - but I do go back.  What can I say - it is a couple of blocks from my house, they are tolerant of my baby snoozing in his stroller or staring at the fish tanks and the noise level makes it so they cannot hear him if he bitches that his mom is keeping him up too late at night (bad mommy!) - but there is not much to distinguish it from every other sushi joint in the Richmond -- other than the odd coupling with the pizza place/sport bar next door.  There are usually large groups celebrating birthdays for some reason. There are big flat panel TVs showing demonstrations of chefs making sushi.  What the owners' thought this added to the restaurant ambience I cannot fathom.  I also do find is disconcerting to sit in a restaurant full of fish tanks whilst eating raw fish - but maybe that is just me. 
Highlights are the appetizers.  If you stick to the lobster thingy and the other groovily-named apps, you cannot go wrong.  Good places for big noisy group and probably kids.  The service is quite good and the chefs friendly if you sit at the bar.  But if you are a fishy snob like me, you can find a lot better within a stone's throw of this part of the city.
author: Kirsten M.

description: What I like about this place that it has delivery and that you can order online.  Or more accurately, good for Japanese delivery.  The best thing they have is the chicken kara-age (as they put it).  They do it a little different.  Instead of a boneless piece of meat deep fried, they take a wing and butterfly and then deep fry it.  The result is a cool variation on a classic dish.  Everything else is ok.
author: Shane Y.

description: This place has it all!  Perfectly prepared grilled squid, vast choice of nigiris, makis.  The prices are right and the service is attentive.   The only negative aspect is their flat screen TVs, not really needed.  The amaebi is very well presented, sweet, fresh.  Definitely one of the best Japanese restaurant in the city.
author: Laurent G.

description: I ordered the volcano roll and the new york roll and they were both VERY delicious. There are no other words to describe the sushi other than YUMMY. I don't know if everyone else is on crack rock but the service was great, very fast and efficient...never saw the bottom of my glass and my waiter was quick with the order taking, food delivering, water refilling, and check giving.
author: Cassy M.

description: I went to this place with my husband on our anniversary and we enjoyed everything we ordered. The best was the giant clam sashimi, I really liked it a lot and there're not many sushi restaurant will offer that.
author: viv h.

description: Great atmosphere, yummy sushi, super FUN staff, and great deals!  We highly recommend this place!  We love it!
author: Mia L.

description: we love this place, the atmosphere has change with the incorporation of the adjoining bar, but yet it still has a great ambiance. As always, the sushi is fresh and delicious. Their plating technique is such an art
author: B F.

description: wait staff is beyond nice! seriously such sweethearts. the food is a bit pricy, however. but i definitely enjoy the sushi, vegetable dumplings, and house salad. though i wish they had a better/more vegetarian options for the main courses!
author: Kate B.

description: I ordered on Grubhub, and after the food didn't arrive in 1.5 hrs, i called and was told the food was on the way.  An hour later, still no food and the restaurant then claimed they didn't have my order.  While waiting to see if my group wanted to reorder, they hung up on me!  I'll never order from here again.
author: Lisa B.

description:
my roommates and my first time here at blue fin sushi, and we are super happy. we had gotten a delivery menu that blue fin and stuck under our door and were pleased to see that yes, another sushi place in the richmond will deliver tasty tempura and sushi rolls to my fat ass who is too lazy to get out of the house. but! in order to shrink our fat asses, we decided to walk over to blue fin and check out the merchandise. very unassuming from the outside, the restaurant is modernly decorated with lcd screens showing how they prepare their food. i liked the inside. it all fit together. they were attempting to go for a central theme, and they did everything in their power to get there. i'm going to appreciate that. i really liked that they had pictures of what all the food looked. it was like my own private flipbook at the table. it really helped me to decide what i was going to munch on. i had the spicy crispy maki and it was delicious. there was this great spicy sauce on top that i would gladly bathe all my food in from here on out. mmmmmm. my roomie's maui roll was also excellent. we were fans of the seaweed salad on top. i also broke down and got some green tea ice cream. they put a strawberry puree on top. YUM!!!!! 
this place isnt kitaro cheap, but you really do get great quality and quantity for what you pay for.
author: Aly L.

description: Blue fin is a go to take out place for our house. They have decent Pizza and decent sushi. The price is right, and dinning in is OK also.
author: RileyDog M.

description: amazing specials. the live scallops and the sunrise roll are favorites. decent ramen, as well. just wish it was closer.
author: Eric G.

description: this place rocks. great sushi chefs and great service. i looooove their VOLCANO ROLL. it is THE best. i go there almost every wednesday after work to relax and enjoy some good sushi. also if you like sports there is sports bar next door with lots of tv so you can always get some sushi and have a drink next door to watch some games on tv.
author: dj g.

description: haven't been back here for a while...and now i remember why. it's not that the sushi was bad, but it wasn't great.  it's not that it taste funny, there was not taste.  it's not that price was super expense, it wasn't cheap. and it's just that there are so many sushi places around the same area, so really no need to go back.
author: Food Is L.

description: wow this place has the best sushi ive ever tried and ive eaten a lot of sushi. my favorites are the black and white, unagi fried rice, and chicken karage (also has the best chicken karage anywhere) and soooooo much more i cant name them. many unique dishes. u must try the unagi fried rice, tell me who has that on their menu??? presentations of dishes are so nice and beautiful also. excellent service all the time. a hot must try sushi restaurant. Way better than Ebisu and every other sushi place.
author: Cory Y.

description: great atmosphere... i had my bday here and i have no complaints.. great service and food... the sea urchin was tasty!
author: tom w.

description: They have the guts to call what they offered sushi. Tuna salad was okay. The oyster special was the highlight of our meal, and it was not bad. The scallop sashimi was not fresh at all. Hamachi kama was overcooked. Forget about the rolls; they don't know how to cook rice. Service was okay, considering there were only two tables for the two waitresses to serve at the time we visited. They spoke in a strange accent but we have no problem understanding them.
author: Bias W.

description:
This place is no good. While the quality and freshness of fish is overall GOOD, the workmanship of the rolls, sushi, and special sashimi plates sucks. The spicy tuna roll had a few problems with how it was made, 1.) wayy too much rice and cucumber, 2.) roll was wayy too wide and should be cut in 6 pieces, not 4  3.) hardly any spicy tuna!!  The halibut sushi still partially had the skin on it, so it was very chewy. The tea they served was a nice compliment, although it was chinese black tea, not green tea as it should be at any authentic Japanese restaurant.  The miso soup was hot, but was pretty bland and not enough flavor. Lastly, the special sashimi plate (w/ ponju sauce) was LOADED UP with wayy too many condiments such as onions, carrots and sauce.  The dessert we ordered was the green tea frozen mocchi ice cream, which was good, but the kind they serve you can buy in the freezer section at any japanese or korean grocery market -- kinda cheap.

I'm not sure if this place is owned by Japanese or not, but the details, workmanship, service and authenticity are not there. I'm from LA and I won't come back here again.
author: James S.

description: this placed is pretty decent but the bill can add up to an arm and a leg. everything here are made and served to look exotic. way different from other sushi places. i do recommend this place. it is a must try. parking is a real pain in the ass during dinner hour.
author: Tuan D.

description: My sister heard good reviews so we decided to give it a try.  The rice was just a sticky mushy mess.  I felt like I was eating paste.  We eventually just pulled away the rice and ate the insides.  We only ordered rolls so I can't tell you if the fish is fresh.  I wouldn't go here again.
author: shelly t.

description: I came here 3 or 4 times and every time i ate SOO much and the price would surprise me in a good way. When we eat at japanese restaurants we would think it would expect the bill to cost a lot but this place always keeps me in a good mood. the food is so pretty, delicious and fresh all the time and it's a restaurant with good quality and a great price... unlike most japanese restaurants that give so so food and charge a fortune... my favorite dish here would be this one dish with fish and thin thin slices of lemon on it. when you eat them together, it creates a very fresh taste in your mouth. sorry for the bad grammar.
author: vicky c.

description: I think I've eaten here so many times over the last 4 years that I've ordered just about everything on the menu - seems like I always leave here with a food coma. They have the freshest fish (except on Sunday), creative specialty rolls, the chefs listen to what you want and will make recommendations if you engage in conversation with them. Waitstaff is fine but the sushi is excellent. You never have to wait for a table, so if you have a big hungry group that is craving sushi, I would take them here. By the way, this restaurant is connected to a sport bar that has its own menu but you can order sushi there too. At first, the sports bar (and the strange vibe in there) seemed weird but the food more than makde up for it. Oh, the only thing that sucks is street parking in the area.
author: JG W.

description: They have an original selection of delicious and very fresh rolls. And they DELIVER, amazing! I will go back very soon.
author: Thomas K.

description: I love this place.  People are friendly and service is good. Raw fish is fresh all the time.  The payroll is delicious, it's a spider roll and a dragon roll made into one roll.  I love the hamachi.  The sorbert dessert are good too!
author: Sam C.

description: the sashimi really is divine, but the presentation is a bit overrated in my opinion. there's a point where too much is just too much. the grade of sushi definitely does not match the low key yet modernist decor. interesting location being connected to a sports bar. unfortunately did not get a chance to sample the toro.
author: Jon N.

description: I'm a regular sushi eater and I have to say that this is one of my all time favorite places. I even took two friends of mine, who eat like 20 lbs of sushi a week at different places, and even THEY were impressed. Good sized portions, fresh, lots of selections...validated parking behind the old Alexandria theatre. Two big flatscreens continually play footage of different dishes made there...thumbs up!
author: Steve K.

description: yummy!  really good service and good sushi.  very accomodating to special requests.  the fish was fresh.  that's kind of key when it comes to sushi.
author: jen b.

description: We used to order from here every week, but have stopped for two reasons. First, the food lately hasn't tasted as fresh - not a good thing when you're ordering raw fish. Second, the main reason we were ordering from here was because it's one of the only sushi places that delivers. Unfortunately, the last time we did, their third party delivery website,  grubhub.com, somehow CHANGED our order after we hit the submit key! Literally half the sushi order was changed, and all we had done was click on the "reorder" link which is supposed to just redo the exact same last order and had always worked in the past. We didn't discover the change until the food was delivered and we saw the new receipt. We contacted grubhub and they took no responsibility, even claiming that the our order history had always been what we just now received. We took a screen shot of our order history as it appeared on THEIR website to prove they were wrong, and all they said was that they would try to fix this error so that it wouldn't occur again in the future. They refused to give us a refund even though we couldn't even eat the sushi that had arrived since it contained shellfish (allergies) - $30 worth of sushi that we had to just throw away.  We're done with both the restaurant and grubhub, just not worth the headache.
author: Laura W.

description: Bluefin Sushi is one of the best sushi restaurants in SF. When you walk in, you tread over a small glass case filled with sand, starfish, shells, and other sea themed objects. The restaurant is next to a sportsbar, but you can't hear any drunken revelries, so the dining ambience is still relaxing. There is a nice big aquarium in which many brightly colored tropical fish dart in and out of rocks and coral. On to the food... WONDERFUL! They have a bevy of rolls that are unique to Bluefin, and they have a little book on each table with 3x5 photos of each roll so you know what to expect. The appetizers are very delicioso (shrimp, lobster tail w/ mango sauce), but you must save your appetite for the SUSHI!!! Sadly I can't remember the names of the rolls, but the plating of each roll is beautiful.. I think it's called a volcano roll, it has spicy red mayo on it, and tuna.. oh it's so good!! A big, thick green streak of wasabi, huge roll in the middle, and fried sprigs of something in tempura batter. WOW. Don't forget to order the fried ice cream at the end either :)
author: O K.

description: yummy and fresh and they made me a veggie roll with mango even though it wasn't on the menu (always a bonus in my book!). i liked the creativity and quality of the food.
author: lisa w.

description: too much rise on sushi, appetizers where very good, actually any plate without rice was goood, nice service, except for the blond waitress...
author: ika v.

description: After getting partially-frozen Edamame, being served everything all at once when it shouldn't have, and being pressured to finish up and get out the door, BFS loses a star. I like(d) this place... but not so much anymore. Keep it up, and you'll lose the last two stars.
author: David S.

description: I am not sure what took me so long to find this local sushi spot, but I really enjoy their sushi and the fish is very fresh.  We live a couple blocks away and it is a huge plus that you can order pick up or delivery online.  The spicy tuna rolls are HUGE and the Tako Nigiri is fresh and tasty.  This was a great find for us.
author: greg F.

description: Delivery is great.  Haven't been to the restaurant yet but I'm sure it's fantabulously even better considering the yummy delivery.  My fiance and I always order far more then we can actually consume (which is a shame 'cause leftovers don't get eaten) and add an indulgent free crab rangoon.  Spicy Tuna Roll, Volcano, Dragon, Spicy Crunchy Maki & Una-Tem rolls are the one's that repeatedly make the cut and the age-old staple: simple Tekka Maki.  Yum.
author: M M.

description: So I walk into here and at first I walk into the lounge, pretty confusing because I didn't know they have two separate entrances. I wait for like 2 minutes, the bartender stares at me and doesn't say anything. I finally figure out that the restaurant has a separate entrance. The first set of food came out in rather normal timing. We ended up ordering more food. I understand sometimes the restaurant get busy but the waitress forgot about my soup, which could be understandable. We waited for our dessert for like an hour, the waitress should have said something like "it's coming up sorry for the wait". Instead we were ignored. I get the bill and she included 15% gratuity in our bill which I found outrageous that she felt that she can provide bad service and then force us to tip her. I came to the host and I asked him to take it off the bill because I don't have to pay 15% when I receive bad service. I would have tipped 10% in an instance like this but I felt like she was trying to pull one one me. I usually tip 20% for good service but this wasn't ok with me.
author: Erica K.

description:
we ordered lots of sashimi since we're avoiding carbs so we were pretty happy.
-gotta order this sashimi app w/ chili oil onion, yes, i forgot the name of the fish -crazy i know- but it's killer.
-i don't eat the flesh, but the kids had chicken kara age which is not thigh meat, but chick wings rolled back to look like baby drumsticks - they loved them.
-sashimi combo - very good, fresh, cool presentation.
-the kids had nabeyaki udon - looked good.
-they have a happy hour deal which is great if you like the fried stuff - i do - so i was rolling in fried oysters.
-fried nana's for dessert - good deal @ 2.75w/ ice cream.
here's the bad:
-dim lighting,
-black menu pages w/ dark font - headachy.
-from the look of some of those entrees - this place slams a huge hemisphere of white rice on the side - not so appetizing.
-big screen tv's which the kids loved& watched, therefore i kind of loved but not the best for date atmo.

haven't tried that pizza but it looks awesome. after this carbo thing is done, i'll dive in.
author: Kim Y.

description: Some of the best sushi I've had in a long time - I'm actually changing some of my ratings at other restaurants after going here, because I felt the need to redefine what I thought good sushi was.  The fish here was incredibly fresh and it was just so damn good... oh man.  I'm the kind of person who can eat sushi nearly every day of the week and not get sick of it and if I had the dough, I'd probably spend a lot of it here.  Main problem: the video playing on both sides of the room showing how they make the sushi were distracting and the annoying music (it reminded me of the Strong Bad email about techno music... and then the bass comes in and it goes 'thump thump thump' and then the sirens come in with the obscure noir movie quotes).  Definitely worth checking out though.  Side note: they offer 2 hours of free parking if you get a ticket to put on your dashboard - I guess just roll by the restaurant, pick one up, then park a block and a half away at the lot between Clement and Geary on 18th.
author: Margie N.
